texts.en: Guliza is 29 years old, married and is raising two children, who are six and four years old. To have an income source for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry two years ago. This business, started with a purchase of two cows, today yields about 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat. In order to further increase livestock headcount, Guliza requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional livestock. This will allow her to expand her business and increase livestock headcount, and help her to complete construction of a house in the next two years.

loan.use: to purchase livestock

loan.name: Pricilla T.

texts.en:
Here is Princilla, a small scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Princilla sells cloths, threads, etc. She has been doing this business for twelve years now. With a loan of SLL 5,000,000, Princilla will expand the size and quality of her business by buying cloths, threads, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business.
A native of Yoni Bamna, thirty-seven-year-old Princilla is married to a trader and the couple has two children â€“ one in primary school and one in college.

loan.use: To buy cloths, threads, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business

loan.name: DjiguÃ©ne Bakhna 39 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DjiguÃ¨ne Bakhna 39 regroupe 5 femmes qui habitent dans la mÃªme maison et qui ont pour activitÃ©, la vente de fruits et lÃ©gumes. La responsable du groupe Mame Kardiata a une expÃ©rience de plus de 10 ans dans le mÃ©tier. Avec le crÃ©dit, elle va acheter des fruits .Elle compte dans lâ€™avenir ouvrir son propre magasin.
texts.en:
The DjiguÃ¨ne Bakhna 39 group is composed of five women who live in the same house and who all sell fruits and vegetables.
The group's representative, Mame Kardiata, has over ten years of experience selling fruits and vegetables. She will use the loan to buy fruit. In the future, she hopes to open her own store.

loan.use: to buy fruits and vegetables intended for resale

loan.name: Mumbi

texts.en:
Mumbi is a 57 year old married woman. She has 6 children ranging in age from 20 years to 39 years. She describes herself to be social and talkative.
She operates a retail stall where she sells juice, sodas, bread, wheat flour, salt, maize flour, beans etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a comercial area and her primary customers are repeat and new ones. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more wheat flour and cooking fat. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking fat.

loan.name: Souleymane

texts.fr: NÃ© en Novembre 1964 Ã Doumanani prÃ©fecture de Sikasso, Souleymane est polygame avec 2 femmes et pÃ¨re 11 enfants rÃ©sidant Ã Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. Monsieur Souleymane aprÃ¨s avoir menÃ© plusieurs activitÃ©s sans succÃ¨s, sâ€™est initiÃ© il y a environ deux annÃ©es au domaine du commerce notamment Ã la vente du bois de chauffe dans lequel il s'approvisionne Ã Denderso et environnants. Il est beaucoup sollicitÃ© de sa clientÃ¨le pour la qualitÃ© de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientÃ¨le de plus en plus croissante, il dÃ©cida de rejoindre lâ€™institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est Ã son deuxiÃ¨me prÃªt individuel; le prÃªt prÃ©cÃ©dent a Ã©tÃ© correctement remboursÃ©. Avec ce deuxiÃ¨me prÃªt, il compte acheter 5 chargements de camion â€œ10 tonnesâ€ en bois de chauffe. Il envisage rÃ©aliser avec ce prÃªt un bÃ©nÃ©fice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisÃ© essentiellement pour contribuer aux dÃ©penses familiales, payer les intÃ©rÃªts de son prÃªt et investir le reste dans son activitÃ©.
texts.en:
Souleymane was born in November 1964 in Doumanani, a prefecture of Sikasso. He is a polygamist, and he has two wives and eleven children. His family lives in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso.
About two years ago, after having pursued several business activities unsuccessfully, Souleymane began buying and selling firewood. He buys the firewood in Denderso and its surrounding areas. He is in very high demand thanks to the quality of his product.
To satisfy his ever-growing customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his second individual loan through Soro Yiriwaso. His first loan was repaid properly.
With this second loan, he plans to buy five truckloads (10 tonnes) of firewood.
With this loan, he plans to achieve monthly profits of 175,000 FCFA, which will mainly the used to cover family expenses and pay the interest of his loan. The rest will be reinvested in his business.

loan.use: to buy firewood

loan.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline has been in farming for 7 years with her milk and egg products being sold in the local market. She is 40 years old and married with 3 year old child.
Evaline has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She says the 7 years of experience in farming has helped her acquire good skills and she hopes her business will continue to grow. She added a dairy cow to provide milk both for family consumption and resale to provide other family basic needs.
She says animal diseases remains a challenge in farming.

loan.use: To buy poultry birds

loan.name: Yamoussa

texts.fr: NÃ© vers 1967 Ã Ouayere commune de Farakala, Monsieur Yamoussa est mariÃ© et pÃ¨re de cinq enfants. Il rÃ©side avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants Ã Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisiÃ¨me rÃ©gion administrtive de la rÃ©publique du Mali). Nâ€™ayant pas eu la chance dâ€™aller Ã lâ€™Ã©cole et aprÃ¨s avoir menÃ© plusieurs activitÃ©s sans succÃ¨s, il sâ€™est vite initiÃ© aux activitÃ©s commerciales notamment aux stockage et commercialisation des cÃ©rÃ©ales, il y a maintenant sept ans. Avec une telle expÃ©rience dans ce domaine, il jouit dâ€™une forte rÃ©putation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nÃ©cessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait dÃ©faut. Ainsi, il dÃ©cida dâ€™intÃ©grer le programme de crÃ©dit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il sollicite ce premier crÃ©dit qui lui permettra dâ€™augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux rÃ©pondre aux attentes de ses clients. Avec ce premier prÃªt il compte acheter 20 sacs de mil, 30 sacs de maÃ¯s et 20 sacs de riz. Avec ce prÃªt, il envisage rÃ©aliser un bÃ©nÃ©fice mensuel de 270 000 FCFA. Avec ces bÃ©nÃ©fices rÃ©alisÃ©s, il compte rÃ©soudre lâ€™essentielle de ses dÃ©penses, celles de sa famille, payer les intÃ©rÃªts de son prÃªt et investir le reste dans son activitÃ© principale.
texts.en:
Yamoussa was born around 1967 in Ouayere, a district of Farakala. He is married and has five children. He lives with his two wives and his children in Hamdallaye, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (the third-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali).
Not having had the chance to attend school, and after having pursued several business activities unsuccessfully, he quickly became involved in commercial activities, namely the stocking and marketing of cereals. He began this line of work seven years ago. Thanks to his extensive experience in the field, he has a strong reputation and receives many orders. However, he lacks the necessary resources to meet this demand.
That is the reason why he has decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. It is with Soro Yiriwaso that he is asking for his first loan which will allow him to increase his capital so that he can better meet the needs of his clients.
With this first loan, he plans to buy 20 bags of millet, 30 bags of corn, and 20 bags of rice.
With this loan, he plans to achieve monthly profits of 270,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover most of his business expenses, family expenses, and pay the interest of his loan. The rest will be reinvested in his business.

loan.use: to buy cereals

loan.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 38 year old restaurant owner in Mariakani. She is a married mother of three. She has been operating the restaurant for the past twelve years with great success.
This is Estherâ€™s fifth business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to renovate her restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables.
She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loan.use: To renovate her restaurant and purchase more chairs and tables

loan.name: Zakaria

texts.fr: NÃ© en Janvier 1970 Ã Sikasso Monsieur Zakaria est mariÃ© et pÃ¨re de 8 enfants rÃ©sidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle Ã©largie Ã Mancourani II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisiÃ¨me rÃ©gion administrative de la rÃ©publique du Mali). Monsieur Zakaria est un dÃ©panneur de radios et tÃ©lÃ©, qui pour amÃ©liorer son entreprise dÃ©cida dâ€™associer la vente des appareils dâ€™occasion Ã son activitÃ© de dÃ©pannage. Il dispose dâ€™un atelier au grand marchÃ© de Sikasso, il est beaucoup sollicitÃ© par sa clientÃ¨le qui ne cesse dâ€™augmenter. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientÃ¨le de plus en plus croissante, il dÃ©cide de rejoindre lâ€™institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois. Il est Ã son premier prÃªt individuel. Monsieur Zakaria vend ses appareils (TV, Radios, Mines ChaÃ®nes, DVD, etc) dans son atÃ©lier de rÃ©paration Ã ses clients composÃ©s gÃ©nÃ©ralement de ceux qui sollicitent ses services de rÃ©parations Avec ce premier prÃªt, il compte acheter 10 DVD, 6 Radios, 5 TV Ã©cran 29, 3 Mines ChaÃ®nes et des CD. Ses appareils proviennent de la rÃ©publique de Ghana. Il envisage rÃ©aliser avec ce prÃªt un bÃ©nÃ©fice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisÃ© essentiellement pour contribuer aux dÃ©penses familiales, payer les intÃ©rÃªts de son prÃªt et investir le reste dans son activitÃ©.
texts.en: Born in January 1970 in Sikasso, Zakaria is married and a father of 8 children living in a large traditional extended family in Mancourani II, the central town of Sikasso (the third largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Zakaria is a radio and TV repair man, who decided in order to improve his business, to add the sale of second hand equipment to his repair business. He has a workshop in the 'grand marchÃ©' of Sikasso, and is much sought out by his ever growing customer base. With a view to better servicing this growing customer base, he decided several months ago to approach the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first individual loan. Zakaria sells his appliances (TV, radio, mini HiFi systems, DVD etc) in his repair workshop to customers - mostly people who have brought in equipment for repair. With this first loan, he intends to purchase 10 DVD players, 5 29 inch TVs, 3 mini HiFi systems, and some CD players. This equipment comes from the Republic of Ghana. With this loan he expects to generate a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA which will mostly be used to contribute to the family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and the rest will be invested in the business.

loan.use: to purchase electronic equipment

loan.name: Barou

texts.fr: NÃ© en Juillet 1977 Ã Sikasso, Monsieur Barou est mariÃ© et pÃ¨re de deux garÃ§ons rÃ©sidant avec son Ã©pouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle Ã©largie Ã Fama, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisiÃ¨me rÃ©gion administrative de la rÃ©publique du Mali). Monsieur Barou aprÃ¨s avoir menÃ© plusieurs activitÃ©s sans succÃ¨s, sâ€™est initiÃ© au domaine de lâ€™aviculture depuis lâ€™annÃ©e 2008. Il dispose dâ€™une ferme non loin de la ville de Sikasso oÃ¹ il y a des centaines de tÃªte dâ€™oiseaux (poulet, pintade, oie, dindon, pigeon, etc.). Il est beaucoup sollicitÃ© de sa clientÃ¨le pour la qualitÃ© de ses volailles qui sont de bonnes qualitÃ©s et bien suivis par des vÃ©tÃ©rinaires qualifiÃ©s. Pour satisfaire sa clientÃ¨le de plus en plus croissante, il dÃ©cide de rejoindre lâ€™institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est Ã son premier prÃªt individuel. Avec ce premier prÃªt, il compte acheter 50 poulets, 5 pintades, 5 paires de dindons, 5 paires de canards, 4 paires dâ€™oie, des mÃ©dicaments et nourritures de sa base cour Il s'approvisionne dans les villages environnants de la ville de Sikasso. Avec ce prÃªt il envisage rÃ©aliser un bÃ©nÃ©fice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisÃ© essentiellement pour augmenter contribuer aux dÃ©penses familiales, payer les intÃ©rÃªts de son prÃªt et investir le reste dans son activitÃ©.
texts.en: Born in July 1977 in Sikasso, Barou is a married father of two boys. He lives with this wife and their children in a large traditional extended family in Fama, one of the urban regions of the town of Sikasso (the third largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having tried his hand at several activities without success, he turned his hand to the rearing of poultry in 2008. He has a farm not far from the town of Sikasso, where there are hundreds of birds (chickens, guinea fowl, geese, turkeys, pigeons etc). He is much sought after by his customers for the quality of his poultry, which are of a high standard and properly overseen by qualified veterinary professionals. In order to satisfy his growing customer base, he decided to approach the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where this is his first individual loan. With this first loan, he plans to purchase 50 chickens, 5 guinea fowl, 5 brace of turkeys, 5 brace of duck, 4 brace of geese, plus medication and feed for his poultry flock. He does his purchasing in the villages surrounding the town of Sikasso. With this loan he expects to generate a monthly profit of 175,000 FCFA which will principally be used to increase his contribution to the family expenses, to repay the interest on the loan, and the rest will be invested in the business.

loan.use: to purchase poultry, feed and medication

loan.name: Fullah Group

texts.en:
Alimamy is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alimamy was born in Makeni city about thirty-two years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple have three children â€“ two in primary school and one in secondary school.
For nine years now, Alimamy has been a businessman. He sells market food â€“ onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. With the help of this loan, Alimamy and members of his group will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.
Alimamy is going to use his share of the loan to buy onions, margi, palm-oil, etc. in large quantities to add to his business.

loan.use: To buy onions, margi, palm-oil, etc. in large quantities to add to his business

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase stocks of cereal products

loan.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Denis is 30 years old, married with two children ages 3 and 6. He does plumbing to earn a living,he has been in the business for 3 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition.
Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business. He hopes to expand his business and be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy taps, rubbers and filters.

loan.use: To buy taps, rubbers and filters

loan.name: John

texts.en:
John is thirty years old and he is married with two children. He runs an Agrovet chemical shop in Oloitoktok. He has been in the business for one year now and gets a monthly income of sixty eight thousand shillings.
This will be Johnâ€™s first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more agrovet chemicals. With the profits that he will get, he will add more stock to his business.
In the future he wants to be able to expand his shop to be a wholesale agrovet chemicals shop.

loan.use: To buy more Agrovet stock for sale

loan.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 35 years old and married with 5 children who are between the ages of 12 and 1 years old. She has been actively farming in her home area of Kitale for eight years and sells her farm produce of milk, maize and beans to the local market. Besides farming she operates a food vending business with her sales made to casual workers in the town, especially in construction sites.
Eunice has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry farming by buying more birds. She says this will enable her to enjoy the economies of scale and give better returns for her investment. She aspires to grow her business so that she can sustain high transport costs to supply the goods to the market and to have access to better markets.
Eunice is however worried about the high cost of treating poultry birds for diseases.

loan.use: To buy poultry birds

loan.name: Salimata

texts.fr: NÃ©e vers 1977 Ã Sikasso, Salimata est mariÃ©e et mÃ¨re de cinq enfants, elle rÃ©side avec son Ã©poux et leurs enfants dans une famille nuclÃ©aire Ã MÃ©dine-Sikasso. Salimata aprÃ¨s avoir avoir menÃ© plusieurs activitÃ©s sans succÃ¨s, sâ€™est initiÃ©e au domaine du commerce avec la vente de lÃ©gumes. Elle vend au nouveau marchÃ© de MÃ©dine oÃ¹ elle dispose dâ€™une place et table. Elle est beaucoup sollicitÃ©e de sa clientÃ¨le pour la qualitÃ© de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientÃ¨le de plus en plus croissante, elle dÃ©cide de rejoindre lâ€™institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ cinq mois. Ainsi, elle sollicite son premier crÃ©dit qui lui permettra dâ€™augmenter son fonds de commerce pour pouvoir acheter 15 sacs de pomme et de terre et 12 sacs dâ€™oignons de graines diffÃ©rentes. Ses marchandises sont achetÃ©es dans les localitÃ©s environnantes de la ville de Sikasso pour Ãªtre vendues en dÃ©tail au comptant les jours de foire Ã une clientÃ¨le composÃ©e essentiellement de forains. Elle envisage rÃ©aliser avec ce prÃªt un bÃ©nÃ©fice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisÃ© essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dÃ©penses familiales et payer les intÃ©rÃªts de son prÃªt.
texts.en:
Born around 1977 in Sikasso, Ms. Salimata is a married mother of five children. She resides with her husband and their children in a nuclear family in MÃ©dine-Sikasso. After having run several businesses without success, Salimata became familiar with the domain of commerce by selling vegetables. She makes her sales at the new market of MÃ©dine, where she has a spot for her table. She is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her goods.
To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, Salimata decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about five months ago. Thus, she is requesting her first loan that will enable her to increase her business capital for buying 15 sacks of potatoes and 12 sacks of onion of various types. Her merchandise is purchased in towns surrounding Sikasso City and then sold retail for cash on market days. Her customers are composed essentially of vendors.
Salimata envisions using this loan to make a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her business capital, to help with family expenses, and to cover the loan interest.

loan.use: to buy onions and potatoes

loan.name: Phenny

texts.en:
Phenny is 46 years old and a retail shop proprietor in Voi. She is a widowed mother of four. She has been running her shop for the past seven years and the business is doing great.
This is her fifth business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to buy more sugar, cooking oil, washing powders and tooth paste to add to her stock.
She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and buy a piece of land to construct a permanent house. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loan.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, washing powders and tooth paste.

loan.name: Zoubairou

texts.fr: NÃ© en Novembre 1974 Ã Sikasso, Monsieur Zoubairou est mariÃ© et pÃ¨re des trois enfants. Il rÃ©side avec sa famille dans une grande famille traditionnelle Ã©largie Ã Wayerma I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. Monsieur Zoubairou est dans ce domaine du commerce dâ€™engrais et semences, pesticides et insecticides depuis sa tendre enfance. Cette activitÃ© est le seul mÃ©tier de la famille depuis au temps de son pÃ¨re, donc il connaÃ®t le domaine en dÃ©tail mais les moyens lui font dÃ©faut pour pouvoir satisfaire ainsi sa clientÃ¨le qui ne cesse dâ€™augmenter. Il dÃ©cide alors de rejoindre lâ€™institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est Ã son premier crÃ©dit qui lui permettra dâ€™acheter 3 cartons de semences PV, 5 cartons de semences tropical, 50 sacs dâ€™engrais 13 boÃ®te pesticides et insecticides. Il sâ€™approvisionne au Ghana et en CÃ´te dâ€™Ivoire avant de les revendre en gros et en dÃ©tail dans sa boutique Ã une clientÃ¨le composÃ©e gÃ©nÃ©ralement dâ€™agriculteurs, de jardiniers, etc. Certains de ses clients payent au comptant, dâ€™autre Ã crÃ©dit. Il envisage rÃ©aliser avec ce prÃªt un bÃ©nÃ©fice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisÃ© essentiellement pour contribuer aux dÃ©penses familiales, payer les intÃ©rÃªts de son prÃªt et investir le reste dans son activitÃ©.
texts.en:
Born on November 1974 in Sikasso, Mr. Zoubairou is a married father of three children. He resides with his family in a large traditional extended family in Wayerma I, a working-class district of Sikasso City. Mr. Zoubairou has been in the business of selling fertilizer, seeds, pesticides, and insecticides since he was very young. This business has been the family's only trade since his father's time, so he has a detailed knowledge of the sector.
But he is short on funds for satisfying his ever-growing customer base. He has therefore decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first loan, which will enable him to buy 3 boxes of PV seeds, 5 boxes of tropical seeds, 50 sacks of fertilizer, and 13 containers of pesticides et insecticides.
He gets his supplies from Ghana and from Cote d'Ivoire and then sells them wholesale and retail in his shop. His customers are composed generally of farmers, gardeners, etc. Some of his customers pay in cash, others on credit.
With this loan, Mr. Zoubairou envisions making a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to help with family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in his business.

loan.use: to buy various farming supplies

loan.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena, a mother of one child, is married to Emmanuel who helps her support the family. She has a cyber business which she wants to expand. The business earns her a monthly income of about Kshs 3,000 and she has been in this business for three years.
She has requested a loan of Kshs 5,000 that would help her expand her business. Philomenaâ€™s big dream is to open a computer college of her own.

loan.use: To expand her business.

loan.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a father of 4 children between the ages of 12 and 5 years, with all schooling. He has been producing maize, vegetables and tomatoes for the local market in his home area of Kitale town for the last 10 years.
Simon has requested a loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants to diversify his farming so that he can get milk for family consumption as well as for retail, in order to generate more income to meet other basic needs like the education of the children.
He concurs with other farmers on the poor infrastructure and price fluctuation as the major challenges in the farming business. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their loan services.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 31 years old and married with two children, aged 1 and 10. He does quarrying to earn a living and he has been in the business for 11 years. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to rent a productive quarry.

loan.use: To rent a productive quarry.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a forty-four-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of eight children. Mary runs a green grocery in Oloitoktok. She has been in the business for one year now and gets a monthly income of about eleven thousand five hundred shillings.
This will be Maryâ€™s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more foodstuffs for her grocery shop. With the profit that she will get she wants to expand her greengrocer shop. In future she wants to continue to expand her shop and invest in farming practices.

loan.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her grocery shop.

loan.name: Meliyo

texts.en:
Meliyo is fifty-three years old. He is married and has eight children. Meliyo is a livestock farmer in Loitoktok. He has been in the business for twenty years now and gets a monthly income of about twelve thousand five hundred shillings.
This will be Meliyoâ€™s first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more cows and goats for resale. With the profit that he will get he wants to expand his livestock business. In future he wants to be able to do well in the livestock and farming industry.

loan.use: To buy more cows and goats for resale.

loan.name: Ta-Kilie-Su Group

texts.en:
Fatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni city thirty-two years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Fatu sells market food: onions, tomatoes, salt, rice, palm oil, etc. She has been a businesswoman for four years now.
With the help of this loan, she and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Fatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her business.

loan.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, salt, rice, palm oil, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loan.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 50-year-old retail shop proprietor in Bamburi, Mombasa. She also runs a salon to supplement her income. She has been running the retail shop for the last ten years and she is doing great.
This is Christineâ€™s second business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and rice to add to the stock in her shop. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her salon business. She hopes to have many businesses.

loan.use: to purchase more sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and rice.

loan.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is a 36-year-old poultry keeper in Mikindani, Mombasa. She is a married mother of two. She has been successfully selling chickens and eggs to her customers for the past three years.
This is Clementinaâ€™s third business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to construct a bigger poultry house and purchase more chicks for raising. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have a well established business.

loan.use: to construct a bigger poultry house and purchase more chicks.

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 2 children, ages 9 and 15 years. She describes herself to be honest and God-fearing. She operates a a farm where she sells tree seedlings. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located at a strategic place and her primary sales are to passers-by and repeat customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be irrigation problems when it's dry. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more tree seeds. Elizabeth's business goal is to make the best nursery bed and venture into a retail shop within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more trees seeds.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loan.name: Damarys

texts.en:
Damarys is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya where she has practiced farming for six years, with her farm currently being run with the help of two farmhands and producing milk, maize and beans for the local market. She runs a motorcycle transport business besides farming. She is married with three children all above one year and below 7 years.
Damarys has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her purchase and insure a dairy cow. She wants to boost her dairy farming so as to get adequate milk for family consumption as well as for resale to generate income which she intends to use in paying for the education of her children.
She laments the fluctuation in milk prices as a major challenge.

loan.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a fifty-four-year-old woman. A widow and a mother of four children, she sells clothes in Oloitoktok. Elizabeth has been in the business for five years now and gets a monthly income of seven thousand two hundred and fifty shillings.
This will be Elizabethâ€™s first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more clothes for sale. With the profit that she will get she wants to expand her clothes business. In future she wants to expand her business into a boutique.

loan.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loan.name: Kamuyu Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the â€œKamuyuâ€ group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan this group of entrepreneurs has accessed from Kiva lenders. Previous loans have helped a lot in improving the businesses and lives of these borrowers. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again seeking a new loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to further expand their businesses.
The leader of this group is Memuna. Memuna was born in Makeni city, where she is currently residing, together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a diamond miner and two of her children are attending primary school. Memuna has been a businesswoman for twenty years now. She is currently selling dried/smoked fish. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy baskets full of dried fish for sale.

loan.use: to buy baskets full of dried fish for sale.

loan.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is forty-four years old. She is single and a mother of two children, and she sells clothes in Oloitoktok. Nancy has been in the business for eleven years now and gets a monthly income of eight thousand shillings.
This will be Nancyâ€™s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more clothes for sale, and with the profit that she will get, she wants to expand her clothes shop.
In future she wants to expand her business into a boutique.

loan.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loan.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is 41 years old and a single lady. Her family are known for making rugs from older generations, but they all used to make them by hand and at their houses.
Ibtisam has always helped her family since she was young, which gives her the experience to start a business out of them and improve the process of making them. so six years ago she bought special machines for making those rugs and sells them in the market. And through these six years, Ibtisam was able to expand the business and make a medium-sized workshop, employing people to support their families.
She also started participating in showrooms and exhibitions to show her products that were not only limited to rugs used on floors, but she also created wall hanging rugs, and also recently started taking special orders to make a specific picture on the rug using wool.
Now Ibtisam has applied for a loan so start working on expanding her business and build a bigger workshop or a factory for making rugs where she will be able to help more families, and she also wants to start conducting training courses to teach rug-making for youths.

loan.use: to start working on expanding her business and build a bigger workshop.

loan.name: YvotykuÃ©ra Omba'apÃ³va OÃ±ondivepa Group

texts.es: 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Villa Elisa vieron una gran forma de superarse por medio del trabajo en equipo y con la ayuda de la fundaciÃ³n paraguaya y por medio de su programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Ellas desean salir adelante ya ayudar a sus familias con el dÃ­a a dÃ­a. Una de las integrantes es la seÃ±ora Sadi, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas, como ser cervezas, vinos, gaseosas, whiskys, y demÃ¡s. Por medio de sus ventas puede ayudar a su familia y tambiÃ©n mantener su hogar. Ella es una mujer luchadora, que no se cansa de trabajar, pues de esa forma ayuda a todos los suyos. Ella solicita la ayuda de kiva y fundaciÃ³n para la compra de las bebidas que vende, de esa forma podrÃ¡ estar abastecida para los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de estas instituciones.
texts.en: 12 women from the city of Villa Elisa saw a great way of excelling by means of teamwork and the help of the Paraguayan Foundation and through their program for women entrepreneurs. They want to succeed in helping their families with the day to day. On of the members is Sadi, who sells all types of beverages for a living, like beer, wine, soda, whiskeys and more. By means of her sales, she can help her family and also maintain her home. She is a fighter, she never tires of working, since in that way she helps her own. She is requesting the assistance of kiva and the foundation in order to purchase the drinks that she sells. That way, she will be able to be stocked for her client orders. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving from these institutions.

loan.use: to purchase beer, wine, soda, whiskey and more.

loan.name: Yervand

texts.en: Yervand was born in 1948 in the Aghvani village of the Syunik region. He was accepted to the Yerevan Zoo Veterinary Institute after finishing a village secondary school. Yervand is married and has two sons. Both of his sons live in Yerevan and work as rescuers for the MES (Ministry of Emergency Situations). Yervand's wife works as an Armenian language teacher at a secondary school, and Yervand works as a secretary at the village administration office. Yervand has been involved in agriculture in the Aghvani village since 1998. He grows potatoes and beans for sale on his plot of land. He also keeps bees and sells honey in the city of Kapan. Yervand says that beekeeping is a fairly difficult business, but it brings in a good income, and this is why he wants to increase the quantity of beehives. Thanks to his agricultural business, Yervand supports his family because salaries are often not large enough to provide the family with all of the necessities. Yervand needs a loan in the sum of 300,000 dram to purchase 6 new beehives and also to purchase frames for honey, wax and new speciality clothing for the beekeeping business.

loan.use: to purchase 6 new beehives and also to purchase frames for honey, wax and new speciality clothing

loan.name: Eileen

texts.en:
Eileen is aged 44 and married with six children with two still attending school. She has been in farming for 20 years and currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. Her produce of milk, maize and beans is all sold within the local market.
Eileen has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow to boost her milk production and enable her to provide her family with basic needs.She aspires to have a farm of more and better breeds of cows in the future. She says she will use the income mainly to ensure her children get good education by paying school fees.
She reckons the fluctuation in market prices in a great challenge to farmers.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 30-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He is a mason and provides construction services. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a busy and viable place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business.
In addition to this work, David increases his income by operating a charcoal retail store. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal for his charcoal retail store. His business goals and dream are to be a supplier of charcoal and best mason within his area within the next five years.

loan.use: To buy more charcoal for his retail charcoal business.

loan.name: DjiguÃ©ne Bakhna 40 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crÃ©dit DjiguÃ¨ne Bakhna 40 composÃ© de 5 femmes habitent dans un village situÃ© Ã environ 16 km de la ville principale. Elles font du commerce de fruits et lÃ©gumes. Leur prÃ©sidente madame Astou possÃ¨de une expÃ©rience de plus de dix ans. MariÃ©e, madame Astou participe Ã la dÃ©pense quotidienne de la famille. Elle aimerait ouvrir un magasin pour diminuer ses dÃ©placements.
texts.en: The "DjiguÃ¨ne Bakhna 40" group comprises five women who live in the same town, located about 16 km from the main city. They sell fruits and vegetables. The group president, Ms. Astou, has more than ten years' experience in this field. A married woman, Ms. Astou participates in providing for the family. She would like to open a store to reduce her need to travel.

loan.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale at the local market.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase better manure to apply in his farms.

loan.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a resident and a farmer in her home area of Kitale in Western Kenya, where she lives with her family of three children, all doing their post-primary education. She is age 44 and has been farming for 20 years.
Susan has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more poultry birds at 20,000 KES and build a bigger poultry housing unit for her growing number of birds (including the ones she has yet to acquire.) She adds that she wants to expand her poultry farming operation since she has enough knowledge to counter the inherent challenges, like bird diseases. She says her main aim is to grow the business well enough to ensure that her children are all schooled.
She says her challenge is seasonal fluctuations in market price.

loan.use: to build a poultry housing unit and buy more birds

loan.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman. She has a son who is 5 years old. She describes herself to be determined and ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of clothes. She will use the 10,000-Kenyan-shilling loan to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to be a clothes supplier to retailers within five years.

loan.use: to buy more clothes for selling

loan.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es: El ComitÃ© â€œMujeres al Poderâ€ cuenta con 16 integrantes todas de un asentamiento de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Este comitÃ© es antiguo y a pesar de tener algunas dificultades siempre supieron salir adelante y hoy en dÃ­a son mujeres muy trabajadora , activas y responsables. Una de estas mujeres es la seÃ±ora Gloria, quien nos cuenta que tiene una pequeÃ±a despensa bien surtida. Gracias a su negocio ella puede ayudar a su familia y mantener la casa. DÃ­a a dÃ­a ella empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano y termina ya muy noche. Cuenta que le gusta mucho su negocio y le gustarÃ­a, algÃºn dÃ­a, poder ampliarlo. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra bebidas, comestibles, enlatados, azÃºcar, fideos y demÃ¡s artÃ­culos de primera necesidad. Agradece a la fundaciÃ³n y a kiva por la oportunidad que le dan a ella y a su grupo.
texts.en: The committee â€œMujeres al Poderâ€ consists of 16 members, all from a settlement of the city of Villa Elisa. This committee is long-standing and in spite of having some difficulties were always able to overcome, and today are very hardworking, active and responsible women. One of these women is Gloria, who tell us that she has a small, well stocked pantry. Thanks to her business she is able to help her family and maintain the house. Day to day she begins work very early and finishes very late. She says that she likes her business very much, and she would like to some day expand it. She is requesting a loan in order to buy drinks, groceries, canned goods, sugar, noodles and other basic necessities. She is thankful to the foundation and to kiva for the opportunity they are giving her and her group.

loan.use: to buy drinks, groceries, canned goods, sugar, noodles and other items.

loan.name: Scott

texts.en:
Scott is 22 years old now, and his business is doing well, and his monthly income has gone up to 6,500 Kenyan shillings.
He has applied for a second loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for sale. With the profit that he will get he wants to expand his curio shop.
In the future he wants to be able to expand his curio shop into a bigger one.

loan.use: to buy handcrafts for sale

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more goats to resell

loan.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has been in mixed farming in his hometown of Kitale for four years with his farm produce of milk, maize and beans all being sold to the local market. His farm is run with the help of one farmhand and he also operates a clothes-selling business besides farming. He is married and has five children between 12 and one year old.
Andrew has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him make a venture into poultry farming as well. He is optimistic that he will generate enough income to repay the loan owing to the good market for poultry products.
He hopes also to expand his farming acreage by buying more land. He says his farming will enable him to improve the living standards of his children.
Andrew's challenge is poultry diseases, which he says need great management to surmount.

loan.use: To buy poultry birds.

loan.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman. She has five children ranging from 27 to 38 years old. She describes herself as honest and innovative.
She operates a retail store where she sells airtime vouchers and cards. She is an agent of Safaricom company. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at a viable area.
She describes her biggest business challenge as sometimes getting insufficient float for customers from Safaricom company. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more airtime vouchers and cards. Lucy's business goal is to venture into and run a tailoring shop within five years.

loan.use: To buy more airtime and safaricom cards.

loan.name: DjiguÃ¨ne B Akhna 41 Group

texts.fr: DjiguÃ¨ne Bakhna 41 est le nom dâ€™un groupe de crÃ©dit qui rassemble cinq femmes habitant dans un petit village situÃ© Ã environ 17 km de la ville principale. Ces femmes ont pour activitÃ© la vente de fruits et lÃ©gumes .Elles sâ€™approvisionnent dans le village mÃªme et Ã©coule sa marchandise vers la capitale. Leur prÃ©sidente, la dame Racky est mariÃ©e et responsable puisse quâ€™elle participe Ã la dÃ©pense quotidienne de son foyer. Elle achÃ¨te et revend des fruits et lÃ©gumes .Dans lâ€™avenir elle aimerait avoir sa propre autonomie financiÃ¨re. .
texts.en: "DjiguÃ¨ne Bakhna 41" is the name of a loan group comprising five women who live in a small town located about 17 km from the main city. These women run businesses selling fruits and vegetables. They get their supplies in the town itself and sell their merchandise towards the capital. The group president, Ms. Racky, is married and responsible, since she participates in providing for her household's daily expenses. She buys and re-sells fruits and vegetables. In the future, she would like to be financially independent.

loan.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loan.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is now 26 years old. He used his previous loan well and the business has grown with a good income of about 15,000 KES in a month.
This will be Edwinâ€™s second loan with KADET Ltd. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for sale. With the profit that he will get he wants to expand his curio shop.
In the future, he wants to be able to invest more in other business ventures.

loan.use: To buy handicrafts for sale.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to purchase lingerie for sale.

loan.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is a widowed woman. She has two children, age 24 and 28 years. She describes herself as focused and quiet.
She operates a retail business where she sells cows for slaughtering. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a viable and busy area and her primary customers are butchers.
She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a cow to sell for slaughter.
Within the next five years, Philomena hopes to own a slaughterhouse.

loan.use: To buy a cow to sell for slaughter.

loan.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 46 years old, married, and has four children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 15 years.
He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a registered client in his abode.
This is his third loan, with which he has planned to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals and also animals for fattening.
He intends to use part of the return from the loan to plow back into farming and part to repay the loan.
His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to higher levels of education. He an industrious man who struggles to achieve if funded.

loan.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals.

loan.name: Nohemy

texts.es: Nohemy ha sido reconocida en su sector por ser una persona que siempre ha querido brindarles bienestar a las otras personas con quien convive. Es por esto que Nohemy ha creado un taller de confecciÃ³n a terceros y logrÃ³ que este creciera hasta el punto en el que tuviese que contratar a una gran cantidad de madres solteras cabezas de familia. A Nohemy siempre le ha interesado impactar en la vida de las demÃ¡s personas, y gracias a su taller ha logrado mejorarle la calidad de vida a un muy buen grupo de ellas. Los habitantes de su sector la tienen como una persona que siempre ha buscado ayudar a los demÃ¡s, y gracias a ella manifiestan que hoy pueden gozar de un trabajo que les permita acceder a un salario que sostenga los gastos del hogar. Nohemy, con 56 aÃ±os de edad, y un esposo que siempre la ha apoyado, quiere que su taller de confecciÃ³n siempre siga creciendo para poder contratar a mÃ¡s personas que requieran con gran necesidad de un salario, por lo que cada vez le llegan mÃ¡s contratos por parte de sus clientes. En la actualidad, el taller de Nohemy requiere de unos espacios mÃ¡s grandes, pues las personas trabajan a menudo incÃ³modas por la falta de espacios. Es por esto que Nohemy requiere de realizar mejoras locativas a su local, sin embargo, en la actualidad no cuenta con el capital suficiente para hacerlo, pues en la temporada de fin de aÃ±o hizo grandes donaciones. Nohemy aspira a que un prÃ©stamo le permita acceder a realizar dichas mejoras locativas, y sus empleados tengan un sitio de trabajo mas confortable que el actual.
texts.en:
Nohemy has been recognized in her area as being a person who has always wished to bring wellbeing to the other people with whom she associates. For that reason Nohemy has created a dressmaking workshop for others, and managed to make it grow to the point at which she had to hire a great number of single mothers who are heads of families. Nohemy has always been interested in impacting the lives of other people and thanks to her workshop she has successfully improved the quality of life for a good number of them. The residents in her area consider her to be a person who has always looked for a way to help others, and thanks to her, they say that today they may enjoy work that allows them to receive a salary which covers household expenses.
Nohemy, with her 56 years of age and a husband who has always supported her, wants her dressmaking workshop to grow continually in order to hire more persons who are very much in need of a salary, and so more and more contracts keep arriving from her customers. Currently Nohemy's workshop requires larger areas since the people who work there are often uncomfortable because of the lack of space. Therefore Nohemy must make structural improvements to her location but currently does not have sufficient capital to do it since she made large donations during the end-of-the-year season.
Nohemy aspires to receive a loan that will allow her to carry out said structural improvements, in order that her employees will have a workplace which is more comfortable than the current one.

loan.use: to make structural improvements to her dressmaking workshop, since there are many people working in a very small space.

loan.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny es socia del Banco Comunal Rubi, tiene 33 aÃ±os, se dedica a la venta de carne en el Mercado, es madre de 4 hijos, es casada y socia de Finca PerÃº desde hace 1 aÃ±o, le encanta las capacitaciones, y todo lo que aprende lo pone en prÃ¡ctica en su negocio y en su familia, los prÃ©stamos que saco le ayudaron a poder terminar de hacer su casa y le ayudaron en los estudios de sus hijos. Ahora el prÃ©stamo que esta solicitando lo invertirÃ¡ en la compra de reces.
texts.en:
Marleny is a member of a the Rubi communal bank. She is 33 years old and devotes herself to selling meat at the market. She is the mother of four children, married, and has been a member of Finca PerÃº for one year. She is delighted with the trainings and puts everything she learns to practice in her business and in her family. The loans she took out helped her complete the construction of her house and with her children's education.
Now the loan she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of cattle.

loan.use: to purchase cattle for slaughter and sale.

loan.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon is age 35 and has been in active farming in his hometown of Kitale for five years. He is married with four children aged between 12 and 6 years. He says his family livelihood relies fully on farming.
Nixon has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow to help him boost his dairy income. He adds that dairy farming has been of great help to his family by providing milk for their daily consumption as well as income to meet other basic requirements.
Nixon says the major challenge of poor feed remains, especially during droughts.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Qais

texts.en:
Qais is 25 years old and single. He has two sisters and a younger brother.
He is a business administration student at one the Jordanian universities and he wants to graduate as soon as possible so he can start working, help his family and save for his future.
He has applied for this loan to pay for his upcoming semesterâ€™s fees.

loan.use: to pay for his upcoming semesterâ€™s fees

loan.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 27-year-old single woman. She has no children yet. She describes herself to be honest and faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells items such as Cutex, earrings, braids, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a viable and busy area and her primary customers are residents. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more braids, Cutex, earrings, etc.
Hellen's business goal is to run at least five more such retail stores within five years.

loan.use: To buy more braids, Cutex, earrings, etc.

loan.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, tiene 42 aÃ±os, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en Yanama, es madre de 4 hijos, es socia de Finca PerÃº desde hace 5 aÃ±os, recuerda que siempre trabajÃ³, pero los prÃ©stamos que ha recibido en estos Ãºltimos aÃ±os le ayudÃ³ mucho a poder cumplir sus metas y sus sueÃ±os, uno de ellos era poder ampliar su casa, las capacitaciones que le brindan le ayudan a poder tener una base para tener un buen negocio y tener una buena familia, con el prÃ©stamo comprarÃ¡ azÃºcar, arroz, fideos.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the La Paz communal bank. She is 42 years old and has a general store in Yanama. She is the mother of four children and has been a member of Finca PerÃº for five years. She recalls that she has always worked, but the loans she has received in recent years have helped her a lot in being able to meet her goals and realize her dreams, one of which was to expand her home. The trainings that they offer her allow her to have a good foundation on which to have a good business and a good family.
With the loan she will purchase sugar, rice and beans.

loan.use: to purchase sugar, rice and beans wholesale.

loan.name: El ComitÃ© Inmaculada ConcepciÃ³n De MarÃ­a Group

texts.es: El comitÃ© Inmaculada ConcepciÃ³n de MarÃ­a se formÃ³ con la uniÃ³n de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comitÃ© desarrollan actividades independientes, pero tambiÃ©n realizan conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compaÃ±erismo. Ellas estÃ¡n muy contentas por formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundaciÃ³n paraguaya y desean llegar al mÃ¡ximo nivel del programa. La SeÃ±ora MarÃ­a es una de las integrantes del comitÃ©, ella es Docente y tambiÃ©n se dedica confeccionar sabanas , almohadas , y fundas, los cuales vende mucho, pues siempre tiene muy buena calidad los productos que ella hace. Cuenta que estÃ¡ casada y que su marido es guardia de seguridad, y de esa forma ambos se ayudan con los gastos de la casa, juntos tienen 2 hijas quienes son el motivo de lucha de MarÃ­a y de su marido, ya que quieren darles una vida cÃ³moda y sin privaciones. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de telas de diversos tipos, hilos, agujas, y demÃ¡s insumos necesarios para elaborar sus sabanas, fundas y demÃ¡s. Ella al igual que sus amigas agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad que les dan.
texts.en:
The Inmaculada ConcepciÃ³n de MarÃ­a committee was formed by the union of a number of neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All the members of the committee have their own independent businesses, but they also carry out activities jointly, which strengthens group bonding. They are very happy to make up part of the program for enterprising women of the FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya and would like to reach the program's maximum level.
Ms. MarÃ­a is one of the committee's members. She is a teacher and also devotes herself to making sheets, pillows and pillowcases of which she sells a lot, since the products she makes have always been of very high quality. She says she is married and that her husband is a security guard, and thus they both help with household expenses. Together they have two children who are the motive for MarÃ­a and her husband's struggles, since they wish to give them a comfortable life without deprivations.
She is requesting the loan for the purchase of various kinds of cloth, thread, needs and other supplies needed to make her sheets, pillowcases and other items. She along with her friends gives thanks to Kiva for the opportunity they are being given.

loan.use: to purchase various types of cloth, thread, needs and other supplies.

loan.name: Clotilde Isabel

texts.es:
Clotilde es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella vive en ica, una ciudad caracterizada por su clima cÃ¡lido en cualquier Ã©poca del aÃ±o y conocida tambiÃ©n por la laguna de Huacachina, considerada el Oasis de AmÃ©rica; Clotilde aprendiÃ³ lo que es ganarse el pan con le sudor de la frente desde muy joven ya que tuvo que trabajar desde niÃ±a para ayudar a sus padres porque tenÃ­an pocos recursos econÃ³micos.
Clotilde se dedica actualmente a la venta de gaseosas, golosinas, abarrotes, ella trabaja muy duro le dedica a su labor alrededor de 8 horas diarias, ella considera que le va bien en su negocio debido a que atiende a sus clientes con mucho respeto y amabilidad, por ello siempre regresan a su negocio.
Clotilde estÃ¡ muy feliz con la ayuda brindada por los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrÃ¡ comprar mas mercaderÃ­a para su negocio (abarrotes, golosinas y con ello mejorara mucho ya que tendrÃ¡ mas ingresos, mejorando su calidad de vida y permitiÃ©ndole seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su sueÃ±o mÃ¡s grande: â€œTerminar de construir su viviendaâ€
texts.en:
Clotilde is a very hardworking woman. She lives in Ica, a city characterized by its year-round warm climate and which is also known for Huacachina Lake, considered to be America's Oasis. Clotilde learned from a very early age what it is to earn one's daily bread by the sweat of one's brow, since she had to work as a child helping her parents as they had very few economic resources.
Clotilde currently devotes herself to selling soft drinks, sweets and groceries. She works very hard and devotes herself to her labors around eight hours a day. She believes things are going well for her in her business because she serves her customers with a great deal of respect and kindness, and so they always return to her business.
Clotilde is very happy with the help provided by the Kiva lenders since, thanks to their support, she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business (groceries and sweets). Thus she will much improve her income, improving her quality of life and allowing her to continue saving in order to achieve her greatest dream: To finish building her home.

loan.use: to purchase more merchandise (groceries, sweets, and soft drinks among other items)

loan.name: Johnny Alfredo

texts.es:
Jonny Alfredo tiene 25 aÃ±os de edad de estado civil actual casado no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el cantÃ³n Ventanas provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Jonny se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z, frÃ©jol, ademÃ¡s tiene animales como las vacas, pollos. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrÃ­colas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, lÃ­quido para plagas.Con el apoyo del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ comprar terreno y los abonos para la siembra, Enfrentar desafÃ­os como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima.
El sueÃ±o es comprarse un carro.En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Jonny Alfredo, 25, is currently married and has no children; he lives with his wife in Ventanas Canton, Los RÃ­os Province.
The â€œLa UniÃ³nâ€ communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as which belongs to Ventanas Canton. Itâ€™s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.
Jonny is a corn and bean farmer and also has animals like cows and chickens. His purchases and sales of farming products take place in Ventanas.
Heâ€™s asking for the loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and liquids for infestations. With support from the loan heâ€™ll be able to buy land and manure for the plants. The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.
His dream is to buy a car and in his free time he enjoys playing ball.

loan.name: Lucila Giralda

texts.es:
Lucila Geralda tiene 53 aÃ±os de edad es soltera, tiene 3 hijos vive con los hijos de 36, 26 y 18 aÃ±os de edad en el CantÃ³n Ventanas provincia de los RÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Lucila se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z, frÃ©jol. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrÃ­colas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para comprar semillas, urea, lÃ­quidos, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podra arrendar mÃ¡s terrenos para poder sembrar y no tener inconvenientes. El sueÃ±o es poder comprar una casa.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear por el campo.

Lucila Giralda, 53, is single and has three children; she lives with her children who are 36, 26 and 18 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los RÃ­os Province.
She is a member of the â€œLa UniÃ³nâ€ communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as which belongs to Ventanas Canton. Itâ€™s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.
Lucila is a corn and bean farmer. Her purchases and sales of farming products take place in Ventanas.
Sheâ€™s asking for the loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizer and liquids. With support from the loan heâ€™ll be able to lease more land to farm problem-free. Her dream is to be able to buy a house. In her free time she enjoys going out into the countryside.

loan.name: Endrina Solanye

texts.es:
Solanye es una joven de 20 aÃ±os muy carismÃ¡tica y sobre todo trabajadora, es madre de un hermoso pequeÃ±o de 1 aÃ±ito al cual crÃ­a y saca adelante sola por circunstancias ajenas , ella trabaja muy duro dÃ­a a dÃ­a para poder solventa a su pequeÃ±o y darle lo que el necesita, en el poco tiempo libre que ella dispone trata de darle mucho cariÃ±o a su bebe y se relaja junto a el escuchando mÃºsica, en especial la relajante para que su bebe tambiÃ©n se relaje junto a ella, Solanye solo estudio hasta quinto grado de secundaria, debido a que sus padres no tenÃ­an los medios econÃ³micos necesarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar contabilidad.
Solanye trabaja en la venta de ropa, trabaja 8 horas diarias y atiende a muchos clientes, en ocasiones cuando no tiene quien pueda cuidar de su pequeÃ±o mientras trabaja ella, lo lleva junto a ella a donde valla, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene la mejor motivaciÃ³n que cualquier persona pueda tener, su Hijo ya que por el darÃ­a la vida y por el es que se sacrifica tanto por salir adelante para que nada le falte.
Solanye estÃ¡ muy feliz y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrÃ¡ comprar mucha mÃ¡s mercaderÃ­a (ropa)de temporada de verano, con ello mejorara sus ingresos y asÃ­ podrÃ¡ seguir ahorrando para poder realizar su gran sueÃ±o: â€œDarle una profesiÃ³n a su pequeÃ±oâ€
texts.en:
Solanye, 20, is a very charismatic and above all hardworking young woman. Sheâ€™s the mother of a beautiful little one-year-old who she raises and cares for alone because of circumstances beyond her control. She works very hard day by day to support her little one and to give him what he needs. In the little free time she has she tries to give her baby much love and she relaxes with him listening to music especially relaxing music so that her baby can relax alongside her. Solanye only finished fifth year of secondary school because her parents lacked the necessary economic means but she would have liked to study Accounting.
Solanye works selling clothes. She works 8 hours daily and tends to many customers. On those occasions when no one is available to care for her baby while she works, she takes him with her wherever she goes. She believes that she does well in her business because she has more motivation than anyone else: her son for whom sheâ€™d give her life. This is why she sacrifices so much to get ahead so that he will lack nothing.
Solanye is very happy and grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy much merchandise (clothes) for the summer season with which sheâ€™ll improve her income to continue saving toward her great dream: â€œTo give her little one a profession.â€

loan.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loan.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
MarÃ­a tiene 44 aÃ±os de edad pero ella tiene el espÃ­ritu de una joven de 20 aÃ±os, ella vive en la ciudad de mala, ubicado al sur de nuestra capital, ella como buena peruana le gusta mucho su comida y por ello uno de los platos que mas le agrada es el Arroz con pollo, MarÃ­a solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria porque sus padre no tenÃ­an los suficientes medios econÃ³micos y es por ello que ella aprendiÃ³ desde muy joven lo que es ganarse el pan con el sudor de su frente. Tiene 3 hijos de los cuales el menor aun estudia y cursa el tercer grado de secundaria.
MarÃ­a tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes y a su vez a la venta de bebidas gaseosas, cerveza y salchipollo, trabaja alrededor de 14 horas diarias ya que la venta de abarrotes y bebidas lo realiza durante el dÃ­a y la tarde y en la noche elabora los platillos de salchipollo, puede atender hasta 20 clientes diarios, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que es muy amable en la atenciÃ³n.
MarÃ­a estÃ¡ muy feliz y agradecida con el apoyo de los prestatarios Kiva porque gracias a su ayuda ella podrÃ¡ comprar mÃ¡s mercaderÃ­a para su negocio ( abarrotes, bebidas y insumos para la elaboracion de sus platillos) ya que aumentara la variedad de los productos para ofrecer y con ello aumentaran sus ingresos y podrÃ¡ seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su gran sueÃ±o:â€ Tener una bodega mÃ¡s ampliaâ€
texts.en:
MarÃ­a, 44, has the spirit of a twenty-year-old. She lives in the city of Mala located south of the capital. Like all good Peruvians, she enjoys our cuisine very much and one of her favorite dishes is â€œArroz con Polloâ€ [chicken with rice]. MarÃ­a only finished fifth year of secondary school because her parents did not have sufficient economic resources and this is why she learned how to earn her daily bread with the sweat of her brow since she was very young. She has three children; the youngest still attends school and is in third grade of secondary school.
MarÃ­a has a business selling groceries but at the same time she also sells soft-drinks, beer and â€œsalchipolloâ€ [fast food consisting of fried potatoes with fried chicken]. She works around 14 hours per day since she does the grocery and beverage sales during the day and then in the evening and night she makes the salchipollo. She can tend to up to 20 customers daily and she believes that she does well in business because she provides very pleasant service.
MarÃ­a is very happy and grateful for the support from Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business (groceries, beverages and ingredients to make her dishes) thus increasing the variety of her products on offer leading to higher income to continue saving to reach her great dream: â€œTo have a much bigger store.â€

loan.use: to buy clothes, groceries, beer and others.

loan.name: Maria Auxiliadora

MarÃ­a Auxiliadora tiene 34 aÃ±os de edad de estado civil actual casada tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 14, 12, 7 y 4 aÃ±os de edad en el CantÃ³n Ventanas Provincia de los rÃ­os.

Solicita el crÃ©dito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, abonos. Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ arrendar terrenos. El sueÃ±o es comprarse una casa grande. No se le ha presentado ningÃºn tipo de problema en la producciÃ³n. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
MarÃ­a Auxiliadora, 34, is married and has four children; she lives with her husband and children who are 14, 12, 7 and 4 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los RÃ­os Province.
She is a member of the â€œLa UniÃ³nâ€ communal bank is located in Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as which belongs to Ventanas Canton. Itâ€™s dedicated to short cycle corn, rice and bean farming.

loan.name: Virginia Griselda

Virginia Griselda tiene 53 aÃ±os de edad es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos, vive con los hijos de 29, 13 y 12 aÃ±os de edad en el CantÃ³n Ventanas provincia de los RÃ­os.

Virginia Griselda, 53, is a single mother of three children; she lives with her children who are 29, 13 and 12 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los RÃ­os Province.

loan.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 22 years old, is single and the youngest child among his five brothers and sisters.
Ahmad is a student at the University, majoring in English. He still has two semesters left until graduation. After that, he is planning on working in the field and registering to get a masters degree at the same time.
Today he has applied for a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loan.name: Edisson Rolando

Edison Rolando tiene 29 aÃ±os de edad vive en uniÃ³n libre, tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 9, 6 y 5 aÃ±os de edad en el cantÃ³n Ventanas provincia de los RÃ­os.

Solicita el crÃ©dito para la siembra de maÃ­z comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, lÃ­quidos. Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ arrendar mÃ¡s terreno para poder sembrar mÃ¡s maÃ­z.

Edisson Rolando, 29, lives in a common law relationship and has three children; he lives with his wife and children who are 9, 6 and 5 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los RÃ­os Province.

loan.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es: Este comitÃ© es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes del comitÃ© fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ella, por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Todas ellas son conocidas en el barrio por su uniÃ³n y por su trabajo en equipo. La Sra. Nelia, presidenta del grupo, estÃ¡ casada, tiene 3 hijos, es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora. Comenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas, con lo cual puede mantener a su familia y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en el hogar. Su sueÃ±o es poder tener un local bien surtido donde ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de prendas variadas, con lo cual podrÃ¡ surtirse y cumplir con unos pedidos que tiene.
