This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo. The group members set each of their growth through group work as their main goal. They are all well known in their neighborhood for their unity and teamwork.
Nelia is group President. Sheâ€™s married and has three children. Sheâ€™s a very enterprising, innovative woman. She comments that she sells clothes that she can support her children with and cover daily household expenses that arise. Her dream is to have a well-stocked store where she can offer more comfort to her customers.
She asks for the loan to by assorted clothes to stock up and fill pending orders she has.

loan.use: to buy clothes for subsequent resale.

loan.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is a 26-year-old single man, the oldest among his two brothers and sister.
Bashar is a student at Middle East University majoring in engineering. After graduation he wants to find a job in the field so he can start building for his future.
He has applied for a loan today to pay for this semester's fees.

loan.use: to pay for this semesterâ€™s fees

loan.name: Aydee Filonila

texts.es: Aydee es social del Banco Comunal Rikchari, tiene 57 aÃ±os, es dueÃ±a de un hostal en la provincia de Sucre, tiene 4 hectÃ¡reas de tierra donde siembra quinua y papa, es madre de 4 hijos y socia de Finca PerÃº desde hace 14 aÃ±os, una amiga ahora su comadre, la invitÃ³ y desde la fecha nunca se retirÃ³ de Finca, ha hecho muy buenas amigas en su Banco Comunal. Aydee se dedico a muchas cosas, entre ellas confeccionaba ropas para niÃ±os y polleras, y asÃ­ llegÃ³ a su tierra natal Sucre y con los prÃ©stamos que ha ido recibiendo empezÃ³ a construir su hotel. El prÃ©stamo que solicita ahora le ayudarÃ¡ a comprar un terrero al lado para poder ampliar su hotel. Ella esta muy agradecida por todo lo que le han enseÃ±ado, Aydee lo valora mucho.
texts.en:
Aydee is a member of the Rikchari communal bank. She is 57 years old and a hotel owner in the province of Sucre. She has four hectares of land where she plants quinoa and potatoes. She is the mother of four children and has been a member of Finca PerÃº for 14 years. A friend of hers who is also now co-mother-in-law with her invited her to join and since that time she has never left Finca. She has made very good friends in her communal bank.
Aydee devotes herself to many things, among them making children's clothing and skirts. Thus she arrived at her native land of Sucre and with the loans she has been receiving began to build her hotel.
The loan she is seeking now will help her buy a neighboring plot of land in order to expand her hotel. She is very appreciative of everything she has been taught; Aydee values it highly.

loan.use: to purchase land for expanding her hotel.

loan.name: Dalberto Bayron

texts.es:
Dalberto Bayron tiene 22 aÃ±os de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamÃ¡ y hermano en el cantÃ³n ventanas provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Dalberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z, arroz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para comprar fertilizantes, urea, abonos, lÃ­quidos, Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ comprar los abonos agrÃ­colas.
El sueÃ±o es comprarse una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota en el barrio. Los desafÃ­os que se le han presentado son la falta de agua a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Dalberto Bayron is 22 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his mom and brother in the Ventanas Cnton of the Los RÃ­os province. He is a member of the La UniÃ³n [Union] communal bank, located in the Aguas FrÃ­as region belonging to the Ventanas canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural labors, planting corn, rice and beans.
Dalberto is dedicated to farming corn and rice. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas. He is seeking the loan in order to purchase chemical and natural fertilizers, urea and liquids. With the loan's help he will be able to purchase fertilizers for farming.
His dream is to purchase a house. In his free time he likes to play ball in the neighborhood. The challenges he has faced include the lack of water for the crops.

loan.use: to purchase chemical and natural fertilizers, urea and liquids.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more dairy cows

loan.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is an 18-year-old single girl. She has five brothers and sisters.
After successfully passing her high school exams, Ola registered herself in a college to get a diploma in the English language. After that she is planning on continuing to get a bachelor's degree too.
Now Ola has applied for a loan so she can pay for her school fees.

loan.use: to pay her school fees

loan.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 to 15 years. She describes herself to be honest and innovative. She operates a grocery stall where she sells vegetables, such as kale, tomatoes, etc., and fruits, like mangoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located near a busy road and her primary customers are passengers and residents of the home area.
She describes her biggest business challenge to be that sometimes the prices of vegetables and fruits increase. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to run a well-stocked greengrocer with all kind of fruits and vegetables within five years.

loan.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loan.name: Meliza

texts.es: Meliza es socia del Banco Comunal Rikchari, tiene 20 aÃ±os, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, ella estudia EnfermerÃ­a en un Instituto, a raÃ­z de que sus padres se fueron a vivir a Vilcas ella se tuvo que hacer cargo sus 2 hermanos menores y de la tienda, a su corta edad, aprendiÃ³ como llevar un negocio, ella educa a sus hermanos y sus padres solo vienen a verlos de vez en cuando para verificar si todo marcha bien, ella se siente muy feliz en Finca PerÃº por todo lo que aprendiÃ³, de esa manera tambiÃ©n la relaciÃ³n con sus hermanos es muy buena, aprendiÃ³ a ser solidaria. El prÃ©stamo que solicita lo utilizarÃ¡ en la compra de arroz, azÃºcar al por mayor y lo que falta para su negocio.
texts.en: Meliza is a member of the Rikchari community bank. She is 20 years old and has a grocery store in her home. She is also studying to become a nurse. Her parents went to live in Vilcas and so she had to take care of her two younger siblings and the store. At her young age, she learned how to run a business. She is educating her siblings. Her parents only come to see them from time to time to check that everything is going well. Meliza feels very happy to be a member of Finca Peru because of everything she has learned. Her relationship with her siblings is now very good and she has learned to be supportive. She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy rice and sugar wholesale and other items that she needs for her business.

loan.use: to buy rice and sugar wholesale

loan.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a mother of two children aged five years and two years respectively. She has a hotel business that she has managed for the past six years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 25,000. She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase foodstuff commodities to sell.
She will use the anticipated profit to reach and satisfy her basic needs. Her dream is to become a successful businesswoman.

loan.use: To boost her business by purchasing foodstuff commodities to sell

loan.name: Martin Beranio

texts.es:
Martin Beranio tiene 65 aÃ±os de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y los hijos de 40, 38, 36 y 34 aÃ±os de edad en ventanas Provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
MartÃ­n se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z y arroz las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para el cultivo de maÃ­z, comprar semillas, abonos, urea, lÃ­quidos. Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ seguir trabajando para la familia.
El sueÃ±o es poder ir de paseo con la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Martin Beranio is 65 years old, is married, has 4 children, and lives with his wife and the children that are ages 40, 38, 36, and 34 in Ventanas, a province of Los Rios.
He is a member of "VRC LA UNION", which is located in Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, belonging to the district Ventanas. He does short cycle agricultural work for a living sowing corn, rice and beans.
MartÃ­n purchases, cultivates and sells corn, rice, and bean in Ventanas.
He is requesting a loan in order to cultivate corn. He will allocate the funds to the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, urea, and fluids. With the help of the loan, he will be able to continue working for the family.
The dream is to be able to go on walks with the family. In his spare time, he enjoys sports.

loan.use: for the cultivation of corn; buying seeds, fertilizer, urea, and fluids.

loan.name: Clara Marisol

texts.es:
Clara Marisol tiene 38 aÃ±os de edad es casada tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y los hijos de 1 y 11 aÃ±os de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los RÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Clara se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z. Las compras y las ventanas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para el cultivo de maÃ­z compra de abonos agrÃ­colas, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del prÃ©stamo podrÃ¡ comprar los abonos sin ninguna dificultad por el dinero.
El sueÃ±o es poder comprar terrenos. En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisiÃ³n.
texts.en:
Clara Marisol, 38, is married and has 2 children. She lives with her husband and her two children, aged 1 and 11, in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios.
She is a member of the communal bank "La Union," which is located in Recinto Aguas Frias in the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank are farmers who specialize in short-cycle agriculture, cultivating corn, rice and beans.
Clara is a farmer who cultivates corn. She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.
She is requesting a loan for her corn crops. She will use the loan to buy manure and other fertilizers. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizers without having money problems.
Her dream is to be able to buy some land. In her spare time, she enjoys watching television.

loan.use: to buy manure and other fertilizers for her corn crops

loan.name: Jimmy Omar

texts.es:
Jimmy Omar tiene 19 aÃ±os de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con el hermano y la madre en Ventanas provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Jimmy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z y ademÃ¡s crÃ­a animales como pollos y cerdos para despuÃ©s venderlos, Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrÃ­colas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para poder arrendar terrenos para sembrar un poco mÃ¡s y comprar semillas, abonos agrÃ­colas y lÃ­quidos para la maleza. Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ comprar productos agrÃ­colas. El sueÃ±o es seguir trabajando para tener mÃ¡s.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Jimmy Omar, 19, is single and has no children. He lives with his brother and his mother in Ventanas in Los Rios province.
He is a member of the communal bank "La Union," which is located in Recinto Aguas Frias in the canton of Ventanas. The members of this communal bank are farmers who specialize in short-cycle agriculture, cultivating corn, rice and beans.
Jimmy is a farmer who cultivates corn and also raises animals to later sell, such as chickens and pigs. He purchases his supplies and sells his agricultural products in Ventanas.
He is requesting a loan to rent some land so that he can cultivate more crops, and also to buy seeds, organic fertilizer and liquid weed-killer. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy these agricultural supplies. His dream is to continue to work so that he can have more.
In his spare time, Jimmy likes to go out for a walk.

loan.use: to rent some land so that he can cultivate more crops, and also to buy seeds, organic fertilizer and liquid weed-killer

loan.name: Rosa

texts.es: La socia Rosa, continua con su negocio de compra y venta de condimentos en el mercado, la socia ahora desea invertir el nuevo credito en la compra de especias para implementar su negocio y para ello comprara todos los condimentos como hierbas para molerlas, ajo, kion, comino, pimienta, sal, palillo entre otros productos. La socia desea seguir creciendo e implementar su negocio para seguir teniendo ganancias y pueda continuar educando y dandole una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosa continues working in her business buying and selling herbs and spices in the market. She would like to invest her new loan in buying spices so that she can stock her business. She will buy seasonings such as: herbs to grind, garlic, ginger, cumin, pepper, salt, turmeric, etc. She would like to continue growing her business and stocking it so that she can continue making profits, educate her children and provide them with a good quality of life.

loan.use: to invest in buying herbs and spices

loan.name: Mutua

texts.en:
Mutua is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be quiet. He operates a retail stall where he sells shoes. He has been in this business for 19 years. His business is located near a busy road and his primary customers are both repeat and new.
He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather problems, as the place he operates from is open-air. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy sport shoes.
Mutua's business goal is to venture into transportation by buying a motorbike within five years.

loan.use: To buy sport shoes for selling.

loan.name: Yeny Nancy

texts.es:
Yeny es una mujer muy trabajadora tiene 42 aÃ±os de edad pero se siente como una joven de 20 aÃ±os, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus playas preciosas y sobre todo por la pesca, yeny como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida, pero el palto que le gusta mas que cualquiera es el riquisimo Caucau, no se cansaria de comer este platillo a diario nos comenta; Yeny solo estudio hasta el quinto aÃ±o de secundaria debido a que sus padres no tenian los suficientes medios economicos, ella desde joven tuvo que trabajar porque tenia la necesidad de aportar en casa.
Yeny trabaja actualmente en su propio negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 40 clientes por dia; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazon para la preparacion de sus platillos, asi como tambien por la amabilidad con la que trata a loa clientes.
Yeny esta muy feliz y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda proporcionada ella podra comprar mesas, sillas, ventiladores para su negocio, con esta mejora sus clientes tendran mas mesas para poder disfrutar de la comida que vende Yeny y estaran mucho mas comodos, con ello podra tener mayores ingresos para asi seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su gran sueÃ±o: "tener su local propio de comida"
texts.en:
Yeny is a very hardworking woman who is 42 years old, but feels like a youth of 20. She lives in the city of Pisco, which is known for its beautiful beaches, and most of all, its fish. Yeny, like a good Peruvian, enjoys food very much, but the dish that she likes the most is the delicious "Caucau" (tripe stew), which she would never get tired of even if she ate it every day. She tells us that she has only a 5th grade education, because her parents did not have sufficient resources for her to study more. Ever since she was young, she had to work in order to contribute to the household.
Now Yeny works in her own business selling food. She works about 8 hours a day, and she is able to serve up to 40 customers a day. She believes that her business is doing well because she makes really delicious food, and also because she provides very friendly service to her customers.
Yeny is very happy and appreciative of the Kiva lenders, because with the help that they provide, she will be able to buy tables, chairs, and fans for her business. With this improvement, her customers will have more tables where they can enjoy the food that Yeny sells, and they will be much more comfortable. As a result, she will have better earnings so that she can continue to save for her biggest dream - which is to have her own restaurant.

loan.use: to buy tables, chairs and fans

loan.name: Minh

texts.en: Ms. Minh is taking out a loan for her daughter, Hue. Hue is a student at Hanoi Agricultural University. She is a second-year student. After graduation in 2014, she will be an officer for ground management and work for the ground management department of Dong Anh district or commune. Currently, she wants to have money to buy supplies for her studies. Her mother is requesting a loan of 10,206,000 VND for that.

loan.use: to buy supplies for her child's education

loan.name: Christian Robert

texts.es:
Christian Robert tiene 20 aÃ±os de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la tÃ­a en ventanas Provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Cristian se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z ademÃ¡s tiene animales para poder criarlos. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrÃ­colas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para arrendar mÃ¡s terrenos y poder sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mejores ingresos.
Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ comprar abonos y arrendar mÃ¡s terrenos. El sueÃ±o es poder comprar una casa y un carro.
En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar villa y pelota.
texts.en:
Christian Robert is 20 years old. He is single and doesn't have any children. He lives with an aunt in Ventanas, in los RÃ­os province.
Christian is a member of "LA UNION" community bank which is located in Aguas FrÃ­as, in Ventanas canton. The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.
Christian is a farmer who grows corn. He also raises animals. He makes his sales and purchases in Ventanas.
Christian is requesting this loan to rent more land and to grow his crops in larger quantities so that he can make better income. The help of this loan will enable him to buy fertilizers and rent more land. His dream is to buy a house and a car.
In his free time, Christian enjoys playing pool and soccer.

loan.use: to rent more land and grow crops in larger quantities

loan.name: Thom

texts.en: Ms. Thom is taking out a loan for her daughter Thuy who is a student at Bac Ha Technology College. She is a second-year student. With the hope to be an accountant, she is studying accounting. After graduation in 2012, she hopes to works for a company near her house. Currently, her tuition fees are due. Therefore, Ms. Thom wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay the tuition.

loan.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition

loan.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as jovial. He operates a business where he provides motorcycle transportation. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located near a busy tarmac road, and his primary customers are residents in the business area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be climatic conditions; when it rains some roads are impassable. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike. His business goal is to own many motorbikes within five years.

loan.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loan.name: Lan

texts.en: Ms Lan is taking a loan out for her son, student Giang, who is attending Economic Technology and Industry College. This years is his first year. With the hope to be a financial banker, he is studying with the financial and banking faculty. He hopes to find a good job in a famous company or a local bank. Currently, Ms Lan wants a loan of 14,580,000 Vietnam dong to pay for tuition fees and other expenses.

loan.use: to pay for tuition fees and other expenses.

loan.name: Teofilo Cesario

texts.es:
Teofilio Cesario tiene 42 aÃ±os de edad es casado tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y los dos hijos de 21 y 22 aÃ±os de edad en ventanas provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Teofilio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z, frejol. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para arrendar mÃ¡s terreno y comprar abonos agrÃ­colas, fertilizantes, urea. Con la ayuda del prÃ©stamo podrÃ¡ arrendar mÃ¡s terreno. El sueÃ±o es comprarse una camioneta para poder transportar los productos y poder venderlos.
En el tiempo libre le gusta ver televisiÃ³n.
texts.en:
Teofilio Cesario is 42 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and his two children, who are 21 and 22 years old, in Ventanas, in los RÃ­os province.
Teofilio is a member of "LA UNION" community bank which is located in Aguas FrÃ­as, in Ventanas canton. The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.
Teofilio is a farmer who grows corn and beans. He makes his sales and purchases in Ventanas.
Teofilio is requesting this loan to rent more land and to buy manure, fertilizers and urea. This loan will enable him to rent more land. His dream is to buy a truck so that he can transport and sell his produce.
In his free time, Teofilio enjoys watching television.

loan.use: to rent more land and to buy fertilizers, manure and urea

loan.name: Benigna

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Benigna es una cliente antigua de la instituciÃ³n, es una persona responsable y emprendedora tiene una tienda de barrio-ferreterÃ­a la cual esta ubicada en la zona de MarÃ­a auxiliadora, en su mismo domicilio que es casa propia, tambiÃ©n vende comida por las maÃ±anas en la misma zona en la parada de trufis, su familia esta conformada por su hija que se encuentra estudiando, La Sra. Benigna es separada de su esposo, por lo que ella es la Ãºnica persona que sustenta su familia y con la educacion de su hija quien es su razon de vivir como dice la Sra. Benigna, el crÃ©dito solicitado le permitirÃ¡ comprar abarrotes para surtir su tienda y continuar desarrollando su actividad econÃ³mica.
texts.en:
Benigna has had previous loans with Emprender, and is a responsible and enterprising person. She has a neighborhood and hardware store, located on the periphery of the MarÃ­a district, in her home, which she owns. She also sells food in the morning at the bus stop in the same district.
She has a daughter who is in school, and Benigna says her daughter is her reason for living. Benigna is separated from her husband, so she is the only person to support her family and the education of her daughter.
The money from the requested loan will allow her to purchase goods to stock her store and continue developing her business.

loan.use: to have the working capital to purchase goods for her store

loan.name: Cruz Rocio

texts.es:
Cruz Rocio tiene 27 aÃ±os de estado civil actual casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 11, 9 y 4 meses de edad en Ventanas Provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Cruz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z ademÃ¡s crÃ­a animales como pollos, ganado. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrÃ­colas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para arrendar mÃ¡s terrenos y comprar abonos, fertilizantes, lÃ­quidos. Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ comprar los abonos agrÃ­colas y arrendar terrenos.
El sueÃ±o es comprar terrenos para ya no arrendar y sembrar en terrenos propios. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer libros de historias.
texts.en:
Cruz Rocio, 27, lives with her husband and their three children--11-years, 9-years and 4-months old, respectively--in Ventanas, a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.
Cruz is a member of the LA UNION community bank in the rural Ventanas town of Aguas Frias. The members of the community bank farm for a living. They grow maize, rice, beans, etc.
Cruz, too, has a farming business. She grows maize and raises livestock--cattle and chickens, for example. She buys what she needs in Ventanas and sells whatever she has to sell there, too.
Cruz is applying for a loan to rent more farmland and buy the supplies--manure, fertilizers, etc.--she needs for the farm. Your help will allow her to continue her business.
Cruz would like to buy land so she can farm her own fields instead of renting. In her spare time, she enjoys reading.

loan.use: to rent more farmland and buy supplies for her farming business.

loan.name: Gloria Narcisa

texts.es:
Gloria Narcisa tiene 42 aÃ±os de edad es viuda tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos y los nietos en ventanas Provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Gloria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z de ciclo corto. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. Solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de abonos, lÃ­quidos, urea, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ comprar los abonos agrÃ­colas sin ningÃºn tipo de problema.
El sueÃ±o es poder comprarse un carro. No se le ha presentado ningÃºn tipo de problema hasta el momento.
En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Gloria Narcisa, 42, is a widow with three children. She lives in Ventanas--a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios--with her children and grandchildren.
Gloria is a member of the LA UNION community bank in the rural Ventanas town of Aguas Frias. The members of the community bank operate farming businesses. They grow maize, rice, beans, etc.
Gloria grows maize for a living. She buys what she needs in Ventanas and sells whatever she has to sell there, too. Gloria is applying for a loan to buy the supplies--manure, fertilizers, insecticides, etc..--she needs for the farm. Your help will allow her to continue her business.
Gloria would like to buy a "carro" [probably a cart, but not clear].
When she can spare time for them, she likes long walks.

loan.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loan.name: Jahir Wladimir

texts.es:
Jahir Wladimir tiene 19 aÃ±os de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamÃ¡ y el papÃ¡ en ventanas provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Jahir se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z y frÃ©jol, ademÃ¡s tiene animales como pollos de campo. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrÃ­colas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos para poder trabajar mejor en el campo. Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ comprar los abonos para tratar la tierra.
El sueÃ±o es poder comprar tierras para poder trabajar en la siembra de maÃ­z. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Jahir Wladimir, 19, is single. He lives with his parents in Ventanas, a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.
Jahir is a member of the LA UNION community bank in the rural Ventanas town of Aguas Frias. The members of the community bank operate farming businesses. They grow maize, rice, beans, etc.
Jahir grows maize and beans for a living. He also raises animals--chickens, for example. He buys what he needs in Ventanas and sells whatever he has to sell there, too.
Jahir is applying for a loan to buy the supplies--seeds, fertilizers, urea, etc..--he needs for the farm. Your help will allow him to continue his business.
Jahir would like to buy farmland of his own. In his spare time, he likes to play football.

loan.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loan.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a single woman. She has no children yet. She describes herself to be friendly and caring. She operates a tailor shop where she sells dresses and school uniforms. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located near a school and her primary customers are ladies and students. She describes her biggest business challenge to be customers delaying their payments. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy school uniforms materials. Fatuma's business goal is to run a fully stocked clothes materials retail store within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy school uniform materials.

loan.name: Thu

texts.en: Ms Thu is asking for a loan for her daughter, Duong, who is attending the Hai Phong Medical Univerysity. Duong is a first year student at the faculty for general medicine. Her tuition duration will last 6 years and she will graduate in 2017. After graduation, she hopes to find a job in a local general hospital. To achieve her future career goal, she is studying very hard. Currently, she has difficulty in paying for fees and other expenses. Therefore, her mother wants to borrow 10,206,000 Vietnam dong to solve this problem.

loan.use: to pay for her child's tuition fee and other expenses

loan.name: Doris Gabriela

texts.es:
Doris Gabriela tiene 20 aÃ±os vive en uniÃ³n libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la compaÃ±era y los hijos de 4 y dos aÃ±os de edad en ventanas provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Doris se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z y frÃ©jol. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas. Solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, lÃ­quido para maleza. Con la ayuda del prÃ©stamo podrÃ¡ trabajar y comprar los abonos.
Los desafÃ­os a los que se enfrenta son las plagas como la langosta y la cogollera. El sueÃ±o es comprar tierra. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con los hijos.
texts.en:
Doris Gabriela is 20 years old. She is in a relationship and lives with her partner and two children, ages 4 and 2, in Ventanas Canton, Los RÃ­os Province.
She is a member of "La UniÃ³n" [Unity] Communal Bank, located in Aguas FrÃ­as which belongs to Ventanas Canton. The members of this communal bank are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers. Doris is a corn and pigeon pea farmer. She buys and sells in Ventanas.
She is asking for the loan to purchase manure and other fertilizers, and weedkiller. With the help of this loan she will be able to buy the fertilizers and continue working. The challenges she faces are plagues of locusts and corn-eating caterpillars. Her dream is to buy land.
In her free time she enjoys going for walks with her children.

loan.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers, and weed killer

loan.name: Darwin Stalin

texts.es:
Darwin Stalin tiene 24 aÃ±os de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los papÃ¡s en Ventanas provincia de los RÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Darwin se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maÃ­z ademÃ¡s trabaja desojado maÃ­z de otrs personas. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para arrendar terrenos, comprar abonos, lÃ­quido para maleza. Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ comprar los lÃ­quidos para las plagas.
Los desafÃ­os a los que se enfrenta son las plagas como la alangosta y el cogollera. El sueÃ±lo es poder comprar terrenos y seguir trabajando.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Darwin Stalin, 24, is single. He lives with his parents in Ventanas, a canton in the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.
Darwin is a member of the LA UNION community bank in the rural Ventanas town of Aguas Frias. The members of the community bank operate farming businesses. They grow maize, rice, beans, etc.
Darwin grows maize for a living. He also works as a laborer for other farmers. He buys what he needs in Ventanas and sells whatever he has to sell there, too.
Darwin is applying for a loan to rent fields and buy supplies--seeds, fertilizers, weed-killer, etc..--that he needs for the business.
Darwin particularly wants to buy supplies for killing the insects--alangosta and cogollera--that destroy his maize crop. Your help will allow him to buy the supplies he needs. His hope for the future is to buy his own land.
In his spare time, he enjoys walks.

loan.use: to rent farmland and buy supplies for his farming business.

loan.name: Renad

texts.en:
Renad is a years old married woman from Marka, Amman; Jordan and a mother of four children.
Renad sews bags and operates from her home. Renad is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase fabrics and materials needed in producing bags.
Renad's home based project is at the beginning stage and she is looking to expand it through opening a shop.

loan.use: to purchase fabrics and materials needed in sewing bags

loan.name: Aydee

texts.es: La Sra. Aydee vive en una zona Peri urbana - Villa Israel ubicada al sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba. La cliente tiene como actividad econÃ³mica el servicio de Internet y cabinas telefÃ³nicas cuenta con 12 maquinas y tres cabinas la atenciÃ³n que realiza es todos los dÃ­as de la semana ya que es una zona alejada y no existen servicios en el lugar acorde a lo que la cliente brinda a su vecindario. La seÃ±ora es casada y tiene 3 hijitos, el esposo trabaja como chofer, el crÃ©dito que se le otorga ayudara a la seÃ±ora a ampliar y mejorar los ambientes de su internet asÃ­ ofrecerÃ¡ una mejor atenciÃ³n a sus clientes, es una persona muy trabajadora ya que tiene que Lidiar con su negocio y con la educaciÃ³n de sus hijos, se siente muy feliz y agradecida con la instituciÃ³n por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Aydee lives in Villa Israel, a neighborhood on the outskirts of the city of Cochabamba that is just south of the city. She has an internet cafe where she also has telephone booths. She has 12 computers and 3 phone booths. She provides these services every day of the week, because this is an area that is far enough away from the city that these services are not widely available. Aydee is married and has 3 small children, and her husband works as a driver. This loan that is being granted to Aydee will help her to expand and improve her internet cafe, so that she can provide better service to her customers. She is a very hardworking person, because she must deal with her business and also the education of her children. She feels very happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loan.use: to expand and make repairs to her internet cafe

loan.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: Las integrantes del comitÃ© mujeres unidas se dedican a variadas actividades, pero siempre realizan actividades en conjunto como forma de poder mantener su uniÃ³n. Actualmente se encuentran en 5to.ciclo en donde se puede mencionar la responsabilidad y uniÃ³n entre ellas. Elizabeth es una de las integrantes, ella comenta que tiene una pequeÃ±a peluquerÃ­a bien equipada, donde atiende a todos los clientes que tiene. Comenta que empezÃ³ con una modesta peluquerÃ­a y que gracias a su esfuerzo ya tiene muy buena clientela y ha podido mejorar un poco su negocio. Este es el medio con que puede mantener a su familia y desea poder seguir con el. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, tintes, esmaltes y demÃ¡s productos con los cuales puede seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the "Mujeres Unidas" ["United Women"] communal bank work in a variety of fields, but they always take part in activities together as a way of keeping their unity. Currently they are in their fifth lending cycle, and they mention the responsibility and unity that exists between the members.
Elizabeth is one of the members. She comments that she has a small, well-equipped beauty salon, where she tends to all her customers. She comments that she began with a modest beauty salon, and that thanks to her efforts she now has a good customer base, and has been able to grow her business a little. It is the means with which she is able to support her family, and she wants to be able to continue with it. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of shampoo, rinses, dyes, nail enamel, and other products with which she can continue her business.

loan.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, dyes, nail enamel, and other products.

loan.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 39-year-old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and has two children.
Mayson started her business with only one sewing machine with sales limited to friends and neighbors. But with her exceptional talent and her hard work, Mayson could expand her business into a small workshop where she has more than one sewing machine and sell her items to shops not only to individuals.
Now, Mayson is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to purchase fabrics for designing and sewing clothes with the aspiration of purchasing her own house and financing her children's education.

loan.use: To purchase fabrics for designing and sewing clothes

loan.name: Silvia Magdalena

texts.es:
Silvia Magdalena tiene 18 aÃ±os de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en ventanas provincia de los rÃ­os.
Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas FrÃ­as, Perteneciente al cantÃ³n Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores AgrÃ­colas de ciclo corto siembra de maÃ­z, arroz, frejol.
Siva se dedica a la siembra de maÃ­z ademÃ¡s tiene pollos y ganado. Las compras de los productos agrÃ­colas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crÃ©dito para arrendar terrenos y comprar fertilizantes, lÃ­quidos para la langosta. Con la ayuda del crÃ©dito podrÃ¡ comprar los fertilizantes, lÃ­quidos para maleza.
Los desafÃ­os a los que se enfrenta son la langosta. El sueÃ±o es poder tener una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar mÃºsica.
texts.en:
Silvia Magdalena, age 18, is single and does not have children. She lives with her parents in Ventantas in the Los Rios Province.
She is a member of the La Union communal bank in the Aguas FrÃ­as precinct of the Ventanas canton. This communal bank devotes itself to agriculture, and they grow short cycle corn, rice, and beans.
Silvia grows corn and has chickens and livestock. She buys her agricultural products in Ventanas. She is requesting the loan to lease land and to buy fertilizers and liquids for the locusts. With the help of the loan she will be able to buy fertilizers and weed killers. The challenges she faces are the locust.
Her dream is to be able to have a house. In her free time she likes to listen to music.

loan.use: to lease land and to buy fertilizers and liquids for the locusts.

loan.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a 34 year-old married man. He has 2 children who are 1 and 2 years old. He describes himself to be aggressive. He operates a retail store where he sells grains, like beans and maize. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in the town centre and his primary customers are local people. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy five bags of maize. Nicholas's business goal and hope is to expand his business to be stocked with at least five hundred bags of maize.

loan.use: To buy 5 bags of maize.

loan.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es: Luz Adriana siempre ha tenido la vocaciÃ³n de servirles a las personas, y es por esto que decidiÃ³ estudiar enfermerÃ­a. Anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa, pero a Luz Adriana no le gustÃ³ mucho trabajar para esta empresa puesto que allÃ­ no sentÃ­a la vocaciÃ³n de servirle completamente a las personas, pues interesaban mÃ¡s los fines comerciales que el servicio a las personas. Es por esto que decidiÃ³ retirarse y seguir trabajando como independiente. Luz Adriana actualmente ofrece el servicio de enfermerÃ­a a domicilio, y asÃ­ siente que les ayuda mÃ¡s a las personas. Sus clientes manifiestan que sus servicios son excelentes comparado a los servicios de los hospitales, por esto siempre acuden a ella en vez de acudir al hospital. Luz Adriana siempre ha tenido el sueÃ±o de poder impactar en la vida de las demÃ¡s personas, y por esto quiere llegar a mÃ¡s personas con sus servicios de enfermerÃ­a, pues muchas veces requieren de sus servicios y por la dificultad de su desplazamiento no puede aceptar el trabajo. Es por esto que Luz Adriana aspira a comprar una moto para utilizarla como medio de transporte para su trabajo, sin embargo, la moto cuesta COP $3.000.000 y solo tiene COP $1.000.000; por esto, Luz Adriana espera que un prÃ©stamo le permita acceder al dinero que le hace falta para comprar la moto y poder asÃ­ seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de mÃ¡s personas que adquieren su servicio.
texts.en: Luz Adriana has always felt a calling to serve people, and for this reason she decided to study to become a nurse. Previously, she worked for a company, but Luz Adriana didn't really like working for this company, because she did not feel that she was able to serve people as she would like. In the company, they were more about making profit than serving people. For this reason, she decided to leave this position and continue to work independently. Now, Luz Adriana offers nursing services in people's homes, and in this way she feels that she can help more people. Her customers state that her services are excellent compared to the services offered in the hospitals, and so they always seek out her services instead of going to the hospital. Luz Adriana has always had the dream of being able to impact the lives of other people, and for this reason, she wants more people to be able to take advantage of her nursing services. The problem is that many times people need her services, but because of their location she is not able to accept the work. For this reason, Luz Adriana wants to buy a motorcycle to use to get around for her job. However, the motorcycle costs 3,000,000 Colombian pesos, and she has only 1,000,000 pesos available for this purchase. Therefore, Luz Adriana hopes that with a loan, she will have access to the money she lacks to buy the motorcycle, and in this way she will be able to continue to improve the quality of life of the people who need her services.

loan.use: to buy a motorcycle so that she can offer her nursing services to more people

loan.name: Yesenia Paulina

texts.es: La socia Yesenia; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de venta de cosmÃ©ticos de Esika y Oriflame, la socia requiere con el nuevo prestamo comprar nuevos productos para tenerlos en stock como por ejemplo productos de belleza como lapices labiales, cremas, perfumes, maquillajes de ojos, cejas, rimel y todo lo que sale frecuentemente, la socia tambien debera pagar su ultima campaÃ±a para sacar nuevos productos para seguir haciendo su capital y ahorrando para continuar con sus estudios y de este modo ser mejor cada dia.
texts.en:
The communal bank's member Yesenia is continuing with her business buying and selling Esika and Oriflame cosmetics. With this new loan that the member is requesting, she will purchase new products to keep in stock, for example beauty products such as lip pencils, creams, perfumes, make up for eyes and eyebrows, Rimmel makeup, and everything that she sells on a regular basis.
The member also needs to pay for her efforts to search for new products, in order to continue building her capital and to save for continuing her education, and in this way improving every day.

loan.use: to stock up her business with beauty products

loan.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 29-year-old, married man. He has two children aged 3 and 8 years old. He operates a pool table where people can play games. Paul has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in an area with business potential and his primary customers are local people. In addition, Paul increases his income through farming. His biggest business challenge is disturbance by the police.
Paul will use the 10,000 KES loan to purchase another pool table. His business goal is to increase his customer size to over one hundred people within five years.

loan.use: To buy another pool table for his business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase childrenâ€™s clothing to sell.

loan.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 39-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.
Eman is working in hand with her husband at their grocery store and she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to purchase more goods needed for the store.
Eman is looking to improve her family's living conditions and increase their income.

loan.use: To purchase goods for the grocery store

loan.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man with one daughter who is 1 year old. He describes himself as hardworking. Josphat operates a retail store where he sells milk. He has been involved in this business for five years. Josphatâ€™s business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are the area residents. His biggest business challenge is insufficient funding.
Josphat will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more milk to sell. His business goal is to begin selling charcoal within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy milk to sell.

loan.name: Nevys Johanna

texts.es: Nevys aunque es una joven de 19 aÃ±os de edad ya tiene su propio negocio, pues desde los 14 decidiÃ³ ser comerciante y en esta Ã©poca tuvo sus primeras experiencias, la cual la llevaron a que emprendiera su aventura de negocio llamada tienda. Hoy vende en su punto comercial ranchos, vÃ­veres, Ãºtiles de aseo personal y en general todos los artÃ­culos de la canasta familiar al detalle a amas de casa que se reÃºnen, conversan y compran en la tienda de Nevys. Nevys es una joven emprendedora que con su iniciativa generadora de ingreso, ha logrado salir adelante, pese a su condiciÃ³n de huÃ©rfana de padre y asÃ­ mismo apoya a su familia y logra sostener su negocio. Ella planea verlo crecer permanentemente y por eso trabaja cada dÃ­a con el mayor empeÃ±o. Esta es la razÃ³n por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprarÃ¡ en mayor cantidad, vÃ­veres, refrescos, Ãºtiles de aseo y papelerÃ­a, que es lo que usualmente solicitan sus clientes en esta primera temporada escolar del aÃ±o. Su meta es tener una casa para adecuar su negocio con toda la tecnologÃ­a y modernidad de su juventud. Mientras esto ocurre se esmera trabajando y con ello obtiene una rentabilidad promedia sobre las ventas, no menor del 28%, sus inventarios rotan cada 14 dÃ­as y sus cuentas por cobrar cada 5 dÃ­as, porque la mayor cantidad de artÃ­culos los vende de contado y maneja unos pocos crÃ©ditos con clientes rentables, con los cuales sostiene buenas relaciones.
texts.en:
Nevys, while still a young woman of 19, already has her own business. When she was 14, she decided to become a retailer, and had two initial experiences which led her to undertake her business venture of a store. Today her store sells food, personal grooming products, and in general all the specific items a family needs. She sells to housewives who meet together, chat and make their purchases at Nevys' store.
Nevys is an entrepreneurial young woman who generates income through her initiative. She has managed to move ahead in life in spite of being orphaned, and so has supported her family and managed to keep her business going. She plans to see it grow permanently, and for this reason she works on a daily basis with maximum determination.
This is the reason why she has come for a Kiva loan; her first financing through FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, she will purchase a greater quantity of food, beverages, personal grooming products, and paper goods, which are what her customers normally look for at this first school season of the year.
Her goal is to have a house where she can use all the technology and modernity of her youth in her business. In the meantime, she strives to work, and with her work she earns an average profit on her sales of not less than 28%, her inventory turns over every two weeks. and her accounts receivables is at 5 days. This is because she sells the great majority of items for cash, and provides credit to only a few, profitable customers with whom she has good relations.

loan.use: to purchase a greater quantity of food, beverages, personal grooming products and paper goods.

loan.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He owns a retail shop that has been in open for ten years. Fredrick obtained a small amount of money from his uncle, $12 at the time, to start this business. The shop now has a substantial amount of stock.
Fredrick is applying for a 40,000 KES loan to purchase more electronics, such as watches. His main business challenges are finding customers and inflation. In spite of these issues, Fredrick would like to own an electronics supply shop in the future. He also plans to save the extra income obtained from this loan and finally purchase a parcel of land.

loan.use: To purchase more electronics to sell at his retail shop.

loan.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her two late sistersâ€™ children. Fatuma lives in a rental home with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. Fatuma has a business selling plastic products in a retail shop. She has been in this business for 10 years and works 6 days a week.
Fatuma has requested a 1,500,000 UGX loan from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more plastic for resale. She generates additional income by selling piped water. Her main business challenges include customers who default on payment and thieves. Fatumaâ€™s aspirations are to become wholesaler and to build rental rooms.

loan.use: To buy more plastic products for resale

loan.name: Adela Paulina

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Adela es cliente antigua de nuestra instituciÃ³n, viene trabajando con bancos de emprendimiento desde el aÃ±o 2006 en el grupo PIO XII, es una de las integrantes mas responsables del grupo, la seÃ±ora Adela vive en la zona de barrio municipal, su familia la integran de tres integrantes con sus dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y ella, hace mas de un aÃ±o se separÃ³ de su pareja ella tiene su pensiÃ³n donde cocina almuerzos y por las noches vende silpanchos de miÃ©rcoles a domingo y los dÃ­as lunes y martes trabaja de limpieza en una empresa donde tiene un buen ingreso por los dos dÃ­as que solo son por la maÃ±ana. Ella en este momento quiere el dinero para la compra de heladera y otros artÃ­culos para su negocio y compra de insumos por mayor motivo por el cual se solicita el crÃ©dito y se siente muy feliz y agradecida con la instituciÃ³n por brindarle un apoyo cuando mas lo necesita.
texts.en: Adela is a long time client of our institution. She has been working with 'Bancos de Emprendimiento' since 2006, in the group PIO XII. She is one of the most responsible members of her group. Adela lives in the area of the municipal district. In her family there are three members, her two school aged children and herself. More than a year ago she separated from her partner. She has a small restaurant out of her home where she cooks lunch and on Wednesday thru Sunday nights she makes 'silpanchos' [a traditional Bolivian dish that consists of rice, boiled potatoes, a thin schnitzel-style meat, chopped tomato, onion and parsley and topped with a fried egg]. Monday and Tuesday mornings she provides cleaning service to a business, and for the small amount of time makes a good income. Right now she wants the money to buy a refrigerator and other items for her business and to buy supplies at wholesale. This is why she has asked for the loan and she is very happy and grateful to the institution for providing support when she needs it the most.

loan.use: to purchase appliances (refrigerator) and supplies at wholesale

loan.name: Edilia Del Socorro

texts.es: Edilia del Socorro es una persona que se ha caracterizado entre sus familiares, amigos y clientes como una trabajadora que siempre se quiere superar. Edilia del Socorro montÃ³ su taller de confecciÃ³n con su esposo desde hace 6 aÃ±os aproximadamente, y gracias a este obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y con su hijo. Anteriormente Edilia del Socorro trabajaba en una empresa de confecciÃ³n y su esposo era sastre, por lo que un dÃ­a tomaron la decisiÃ³n de montar su propio taller de confecciÃ³n y ofrecer el servicio de confecciÃ³n a terceros y tambiÃ©n sacar su lÃ­nea propia. Edilia del Socorro siempre ha querido ofrecer trabajo a las personas mÃ¡s necesitadas, por lo que siempre aspira a que su negocio crezca y se consolide para poder contratar cada vez a mÃ¡s personas. Los empleados de su taller de confecciÃ³n, tiene a Edilia del Socorro y a su esposo como unas personas muy interesadas en el bienestar de los demÃ¡s, y gracias a esto, su taller de confecciÃ³n se ha ganado una gran reputaciÃ³n en su sector, pues ademÃ¡s de vender productos de muy buena calidad, las personas lo tienen como un taller donde las personas pueden construir un futuro mejor. Edilia del Socorro siempre ha querido confeccionar todo el proceso en su taller, sin embargo, por falta de una mÃ¡quina recubridora esto no ha sido posible, y debe contratar este servicio con otro taller de confecciÃ³n. Edilia del Socorro aspira a comprar esta mÃ¡quina recubridora y poder brindarle este puesto de trabajo a una persona que necesite de un ingreso, por lo que aspira a que un prÃ©stamo le permita acceder a la compra de la mÃ¡quina recubridora y pueda asÃ­ seguir impactando y mejorando la calidad de vida de mÃ¡s personas.
texts.en:
Edilia del Socorro has been described by her family, friends and customers as a hard worker that is always working to succeed. Edilia del Socorro started her tailoring workshop with her husband approximately six years ago and thanks to this business has sufficient income to cover the household expenses, where she lives with her husband and her son. Previously Edilia del Socorro worked in a tailoring business and her husband was a tailor; so one day they decided to open their own tailor workshop, offer tailoring service to others and also start their own line. Edilia de Socorro always wanted to offer work to people in most need, so she also wanted her business to strengthen and grow so she could hire more and more people. Edilia de Socorro and her husband are people who are interested in the well-being of others, and thanks to this their business has earned a good reputation in the local industry, as well as selling good quality products, they are known for being a place where the employees can build a better future.
Edilia del Socorro has always wanted to do every step of the process in her workshop, however, for lack of a particular sewing machine, this has not been possible and she has had to contract part of the work out to a different tailor. Edilia del Socorro aspires to buy this sewing machine, and to be able to provide another job to a person in need of income. It is for this reason that she hopes to get the loan, to be able to buy the sewing machine and continue impacting and improving the quality of life for other people.

loan.use: to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring workshop.

loan.name: Vriginia

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora Virginia es una mujer muy joven de 32 aÃ±os que se encuentra casada con el seÃ±or JosÃ© Luis RamÃ­rez con el que procreÃ³ 4 hjos, el mayor tiene 12 aÃ±os va en la secundaria, el que le sigue tiene 11 aÃ±os, otro tiene 9 aÃ±os y el mÃ¡s pequeÃ±o tiene 6 aÃ±os los Ãºltimos 3 asisten aÃºn a la primaria.
Desde hace ya 5 aÃ±os la seÃ±ora Virginia y su esposo se dedican a la fabricaciÃ³n y venta de fibras de alambre, que les ha ayudado en gran medida al sustento de su familia. La forma en que ellos elaboran las fibras es la siguiente:
1Â° Compran la fibra por kilogramo, compran alambre con el que amarraran la fibra, los kg segÃºn la cantidad de fibras que vayan a elaborar, hacen un cÃ¡lculo muy riguroso.
2Â° Cortan la fibra
3Â° Amarran la fibra con el alambre, obteniÃ©ndo asÃ­ las fibras que despuÃ©s servirÃ¡n para uso domÃ©stico (en lavara los trastes)
La seÃ±ora Virginia comenta que esta actividad es una gran ayuda, ya que gracias a ella puede cubrir los gastos de su casa y de su negocio, ella tiene muchos sueÃ±os y metas, uno de ellos es llegar a poner su propio negocio ya que actualmente la venta de fibras las lleva a cabo en su casa de una forma informal, a ella le gustarÃ­a poner un local en el que se dedique especialmente a comercializar sus productos y asÃ­ mejorar su vida y la de su familia, es por eso que ella se acercÃ³ a los prÃ©stamos de FundaciÃ³n Realidad para asÃ­ tener mÃ¡s y mejores opciones de ingresos
texts.en:
Virgina is a young woman who is 32 years-old. She is married to JosÃ© Luis RamÃ­rez, with whom she has four children. Their oldest child is 12 years-old and is studying in middle school. The other children are 11 years old, 9 years old and 6 years-old and all attend primary school.
For the past five years Virgina and her husband have made a living manufacturing and selling wire fibers. This business has helped greatly to sustain their family. The way they make the wire fibers is as follows:
1. Buy the fiber (by the kilogram) and wire to tie the fiber. The number of kilograms they buy depends on the quantity of products they are going to make, so they calculate their purchases precisely.
2. Cut the fibers
3. Tie the fibers with the wire, in this form they can be used for household use (to wash dishes)
Virgina told us that this activity is very helpful because it helps her to cover household expenses and business expenses. She has many dreams and goals, one of which is to be able to have her business outside of her home. Now she is selling informally from her home, but she would like to open a location that is specifically dedicated to the sale of her products. In this way she hopes to better her life and the life of her family. It is for this reason that she came to request a loan from 'FundaciÃ³n Realidad' in order to have better income options.

loan.use: to manufacture wire fiber cleaning products.

loan.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married woman with five children between the ages of 4 and 18 years old. She describes herself as innovative. Mwanaidi operates a retail business where she sells sand; she has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are masons. In addition, Mwanaidi provides rental housing services. She describes her biggest business challenge as low purchasing power at certain times, especially during rainy season.
Mwanaidi will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more sand to sell. Her business goal is to run similar retail outlets that will help increase her income within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more sand to sell.

loan.name: Dina Group

texts.es: El grupo Dina lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Candida de 48 aÃ±os quien es comerciante ambulante de frutas, verduras y pan entre otros productos. Ella tiene tres hijos de 15, 14 y 10 aÃ±os los cuales estudian y en su tiempo libre le ayudan en el negocio. Ella invertirÃ¡ el crÃ©dito en la crianza de animales de patio gallinas, cerdoâ€¦etc. Las otras integrantes son Iliana de 24 aÃ±os quien vende comida desde hace 3 aÃ±os y Jennifer de 28 aÃ±os tiene una pulperÃ­a.
texts.en:
The Dina group is comprised of three hard-working and enterprising women.
Candida, age 48, is one of them. She sells fruit, vegetables, bread, and other products in an itinerant manner. She has three children, ages 15, 14, and 10. The children go to school, and in their free time they help her with the business.
She will use the loan for raising small animals like chickens and pigs, etc.
The other members are 24 year old Iliana who has been selling food for three years and 28 year old Jennifer who has a grocery store.

loan.use: to buy small animals like chickens and pigs.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy lipsticks, nail polish, powders, creams, perfumes and treatments

loan.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with five children between the ages of 10 and 22 years old. She describes herself as determined and hardworking. Amina operates a retail business where she sells juice; she has been involved in this business for three years. Aminaâ€™s business is located near a school and her primary customers are students. Her biggest business challenge is the low purchasing power during cold season.
Amina will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy passion fruit to make juice. Amina's business goal is to run several similar retail juice outlets within five years.

loan.use: To purchase passion fruit to make juice to sell.

loan.name: Liz Narcisa

texts.es: Liz nunca pensÃ³ que en lo que vio a su madre trabajar, se convertirÃ­a en su principal fuente de autonomÃ­a personal y econÃ³mica y esto lo logrÃ³ por su espÃ­ritu libre e independiente, generado por su propia creatividad. Ella inicialmente trabajaba empleada en una empresa importante de la ciudad y para generar mÃ¡s ingresos les fabricaba a sus compaÃ±eras de trabajo, ropa tomando sus medidas, ayudÃ¡ndole a comprar la tela apropiada, asÃ­ como tambiÃ©n los insumos y con las herramientas de trabajo de su madre. En el aÃ±o 1998 decidiÃ³ generar su propia empresa y renunciÃ³ de ser empleada, asÃ­ fue como con sus ahorros y el producto de su liquidaciÃ³n lo logrÃ³, gestionando mÃ¡s clientes entre los referidos de sus compradoras hasta ese momento. Hoy no solo confecciona sobre medidas, de contado y a crÃ©dito a sus mejores clientes, sino tambiÃ©n tiene contratos con escuelas y colegios, sino tambiÃ©n tiene clientela en el norte de la ciudad que le reconoce la calidad con que trabaja las prendas de vestir y su delicado diseÃ±o. En la actualidad estÃ¡ aplicando a su primer credikiva, tambiÃ©n primer financiamiento, que hace a la FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual planea comprar telas al por mayor porque tiene un contrato con un colegio a quien le confeccionarÃ¡ uniformes. Con ello continua en su propÃ³sito de crecimiento y de aumento de su capital de trabajo, para seguir generando mayor bienestar a su familia conformada por su hijo de 14 aÃ±os de edad.
texts.en: Liz never thought that what she saw her mother do for work would turn into her main source of personal and economic autonomy. She achieved this through her free and independent spirit, generated by her own creativity. She initially worked for an important city company. To make more money, she made clothes for her coworkers with her mother's working tools, taking their measurements, and helping them to buy the right fabric as well as supplies. In the year 1998, she decided to create her own company and resign from her job. This is how it has gone, with her savings and the sales of her products she has managed to negotiate more customers from the ones referred by purchasers until this moment. Today, she not only makes things from measurements, from contracts on credit for her best customers, but also has contracts with elementary and high schools. She also has customers in the north of the city that recognize the quality with which she works the clothing garments and her delicate design. She is currently applying for her first Kiva credit, and also her first financing through FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to buy wholesale fabrics with it, because she has a contract with a high school to make uniforms. With the loan, she will continue in her goal of growing and enlarging the capital of her work, so that she can continue generating a better wellbeing for her family, made up by her 14 year old son.

loan.use: buy wholesale fabrics

loan.name: Mercedes Del

texts.es: Mercedes, vive en casa propia junto a su nieta de 17 aÃ±os de edad, ella hace 15 aÃ±os se dedica a la venta de zapatos, ropa y venta de oro el negocio lo comenzÃ³ por iniciativa propia no tiene un horario establecido. El prÃ©stamo lo necesita porque es la Ã©poca de los Ãºtiles escolares y quiere comprar mercaderÃ­a como: mochilas y zapatos el cual le permitirÃ¡ comprar por mayor de esa manera lograr mejores ganancias y tener variedad para ofrecerles a los clientes. La aspiraciÃ³n de Mercedes es tener el negocio en su casa ya que por el momento no tienen un lugar establecido y seguir trabajando con nuestra instituciÃ³n para tener un buen recot crediticio.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in her own home together with her 17-year-old granddaughter. She has been selling shoes, clothes and gold jewelry for 15 years. She started the business on her own initiative and does not work regular hours.
Mercedes needs this loan because it is the back-to-school season and she would like to buy merchandise such as backpacks and shoes. The loan will allow her to buy wholesale which means she will make better profits and have a good variety of products to offer her customers.
Mercedes' aspiration is to have her business at home because right now they don't have a stable place. She would also like to continue working with our institution so that she can build up a good credit record.

loan.use: to buy backpacks, shoes and clothes

loan.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Nuru also takes care of her elderly parents. She lives in a home that she own with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family. Nuru has a retail pharmacy shop, a business that she has been involved in for 10 years. She works 7 days a week. Nuru also generates additional income through selling piped water. Her main business challenges include defaulters, thieves and seasonality.
Nuru requested a 1,500,000 UGX loan from Kiva partner Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy additional boxes of syrup and drugs to sell. Her business aspirations are to own a fully stocked pharmacy shop and build rental rooms.

loan.use: To buy additional boxes of syrup and drugs to sell at her pharmacy shop.

loan.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Ana tiene como actividad la marroquinerÃ­a (artesanÃ­a en cuero), actividad que realiza durante la semana fabricando maletines de cuero para su posterior venta en las distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, la mencionada actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia, el trabajo en cuero lo realiza hace varios aÃ±os, es un trabajo muy duro pero la Sra. Ana trabaja junto a su esposo quien le ayuda, juntos trabajan por el bienestar de su familia puesto que tienen hijos, el destino del crÃ©dito es para la compra de materia prima en cuero para realizar su trabajo, tiene muy buena venta ya que los maletÃ­n es que realiza son muy lindos y de buena calidad y con el tiempo desea poder vender sus productos en los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: SeÃ±ora Ana's business activity is doing leatherwork. She does this work during the week, making leather bags to sell later in the various fairs in the city of El Alto. This activity is the principal source of income for her and her family. She has been doing leatherwork for a number of years. It is very hard work, but SeÃ±ora Ana works together with her husband, who helps her. Together they work for the well-being of their family, since they have children. The loan is destined for the purchase of basic leather materials so that they can do their work. She has very good sales, since the bags that she makes are very pretty and of good quality. In the future, she wants to be able to sell her products in the various markets in the city of La Paz.

loan.use: to buy basic materials to work in leather.

loan.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man with two children. He describes himself to be a loyal man. Joel operates a retail business where he provides electronics repairs services. He has been involved in this business for seven years. Joelâ€™s business is located near a chiefâ€™s compound and his primary customers are the local residents in his home area.
Joel will use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase spare parts to use in his business. His business goal is to run an electronics shop within five years.

loan.use: To buy more spare parts to use for electronics' repair.

loan.name: Fabiola Margarita

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Fabiola Margarita es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien ha hecho de todo un poco desde vender artesanÃ­as, cosa de horno, frutas, cerdoâ€¦etc. Ella invierte segÃºn la temporada desde hace 15 aÃ±os. Ella con su negocio a lo grado comprar y mejorar su hogar lo Ãºltimo que adquiriÃ³ fue su cama y una DVD. En la actualidad estÃ¡ realizando tortillas en lo que invertirÃ¡ el crÃ©dito con la compra de materia prima que serÃ­a maÃ­z, leÃ±a y cal.
texts.en:
Fabiola Margarita is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who has done a bit of everything, from selling handicrafts to cooking, selling fruit, pigs, etc. She has been investing according to the season for 15 years. Through her business, she has managed to buy and improve her home. The latest things she acquired were a bed and a DVD player.
She is currently working making tortillas. She will invest her loan in buying raw materials (corn, firewood and lime).

loan.use: to buy corn and firewood

loan.name: Luisa Morena

texts.es: Luisa, se dedica a la venta de cosmÃ©ticos y lociones por catalogo, ella vive en una casa alquilada, con su hija, el negocio de Luisa naciÃ³ por la necesidad de tener ingresos, ya que tiene la obligaciÃ³n del hogar, inicio con la empresa Avon, pero hoy en dÃ­a distribuye de otros proveedores adicionales. Actualmente estÃ¡ solicitando un prÃ©stamo para la compra de un pedido de cosmÃ©ticos, harÃ¡ el pedido a las empresas para poder revenderlo con los clientes, los productos que desea obtener son maquillajes, labiales, lociones y cremas. Espera que con este aporte su negocio sea mejor, el sueÃ±o de ella es mejorar cada dÃ­a para tener mayor estabilidad con su hija
texts.en:
Luisa has a business selling cosmetics and lotions through a catalog. She lives in a rented home with her daughter. Luisa started this business because she needed an income, given that she must cover the expenses for her household. She started out selling Avon products, but now she is distributing products from other suppliers as well.
She is requesting a loan now to make a purchase for an order of cosmetics. She will make an order from the companies for products that she will then re-sell to her customers. The products that she wants to buy are: makeup, lipstick, lotions and creams.
She hopes that with this loan, her business will improve. Luisa's dream is to improve every day so that she can have greater financial stability for her daughter.

loan.use: to buy makeup, lipstick, lotions and creams.

loan.name: Santa Lucia 2 Group

texts.es: Las mujeres del presente comitÃ© son de la cuidad de CaacupÃ©. EstÃ¡ integrado por 20 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundaciÃ³n Paraguaya. Todas las integrantes del comitÃ© estÃ¡n muy agradecidas con la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya y Kiva por el valioso apoyo que les brinda para poder mejorar sus vidas. Nancy es una de las integrantes de este numeroso grupo, ella trabaja todos los dÃ­as en su local de venta de bebidas, este ha sido su trabajo desde hace ya un tiempo, y comenta que gracias a este trabajo ha podido mantener a su familia y darles una vida digna. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, gaseosas y otras bebidas, con lo cual podrÃ¡ abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
The women who belong to this committee are from the city of CaacupÃ©. The group has 20 female members who are all friends and neighbors from this city. They are currently in their second cycle of FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya's 'Entrepreneurial Women' program. All the members of the committee are grateful to FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya and Kiva for the valuable support that they give them as it enables them to improve their lives.
Nancy is a member of this large group. She works every day in her business selling drinks. This has been her work for some time and she says that, thanks to this work, she has been able to support her family and provide them with a decent life.
Nancy is requesting this loan to buy wine, beer and other drinks so that she can stock her business.

loan.use: to buy beer, wine, soda and other drinks for her store

loan.name: Natalya

texts.en: Natalya, her husband and their two adult sons live in the Vodyanoye village. She is an agricultural farmer and is involved in growing vegetables for wholesale sales. Natalya has six built greenhouses plus two greenhouses for seedlings, and 150,000 hryvnia invested in the business. She has been involved in agriculture for 15 years. She spends up to 38,000 hryvnia on seeds and plastic every year. Natalya needs a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnia to purchase a protective plastic for greenhouses for 7,000 hryvnia, seeds for 8,000 hryvnia and fertilizers for 5,000 hryvnia. Obtaining these funds will provide Natalya with an ability to sow tomato seeds on-time. She hopes to use the resulting profit to cover her son's university education expenses.

loan.use: to purchase a protective plastic for greenhouses for 7,000 hryvnia, seeds for 8,000 hryvnia and fertilizers for 5,000 hryvnia

loan.name: Alla

texts.en: Alla used her previous loan from Kiva to invest in construction materials for building an additional greenhouse. Due to the construction of this greenhouse, Alla was able to increase the quantity of planted vegetables and, thus, earn an additional income. She needs a loan in the sum of 15,000 hryvnia this time because she does not have enough money to expand her greenhouse business. Because Alla always strives to increase the volume of growing early vegetables, she wants to continue investing additional funds into developing her business in the future.

loan.use: to expand her greenhouse business

loan.name: Rhonah

texts.en:
Rhonah lives in Uganda. She is married with two children, both of whom are in school. Rhonah also takes care of two of her sistersâ€™ children. She lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.
Rhonah has a sells charcoal at the market, a business that she has been involved in for over ten years. Rhonah works six days a week. She generates additional income by renting rooms. Her main business challenges include seasonality and thieves.
Rhonah requested a 1,000,000 UGX loan from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of charcoal. Her business aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to build more rental rooms.

loan.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell in the market.

loan.name: Jenny Patricia

texts.es: Jenny, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, vive con su esposo, tienen dos hijos de 6 y 8 aÃ±os de edad, ella es la responsable del hogar, tiene el negocio desde hace 4 aÃ±os, este surgiÃ³ por iniciativa propia, ha adquirido experiencia, trabaja todos los dÃ­as de las 4:00pm a las 7:00pm. Ella estÃ¡ solicitando un prÃ©stamo para la compra de materiales de construcciÃ³n como cemento, arena, piedra y pago de mano de obra para realizar la pavimentaciÃ³n del piso de la vivienda, este prÃ©stamo le ayudara para mejorar la vivienda y tener mejor condiciÃ³n de vida con sus hijos. El objetivo de Jenny es mantener su hogar, que sus hijas sientan su apoyo, que no les falte lo mÃ¡s necesario para subsistir y que puedan estudiar.
texts.en: Jenny, who sells pupusas [a traditional meal made with thick tortillas], lives with her husband. They have two children who are 6 and 8 years old. She is responsible for the home. She has had the business for 4 years, which developed through her own initiative. She has acquired experience. She works every day from 4 pm to 7 pm. She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, wood, and to pay for labor in order to pave the floor of her home. This loan will help her to improve her home and to have a better way of life with her children. Jenny's goal is to maintain her home, that her children feel her support, that they do not lack what is most necessary to survive, and that they can study.

loan.use: to buy cement, sand, wood, and pay for labor.

loan.name: Ludmila
