texts.en: Ludmila is a farmer from the Vodyanoye village. She is involved in agriculture by growing early vegetables in greenhouses. She is married and, together with her husband, is raising a son and a daughter. Ludmila has three large greenhouses and two more for seedlings. She has 70,000 hryvnia invested in her business. Ludmila has been involved in farming for 20 years. Her annual expenses for seeds and plastic amount to 25,000 hryvnia. Ludmila plans to invest this Kiva loan in the sum of 12,000 hryvnia to purchase plastic for 5,000 hryvnia, seeds for sowing for 3,000 hryvnia, and also to remodel the heating system in the seedlings greenhouses (4,000 hryvnia). Ludmila plans to use the resulting profit to improve her home, rebuild a temporary structure and build a garage.

loan.use: to purchase plastic for 5,000 hryvnia, seeds for sowing for 3,000 hryvnia, and also to remodel the heating system in the seedlings greenhouses (4,000 hryvnia)

loan.name: Heriberto Salvador

texts.es: Heriberto de 22 aÃ±os, soltero, tiene un hijo de 1 aÃ±o de edad, vive en la Colonia Sandoval, zona perifÃ©rica de San Pedro Sula junto a sus padres y su hermano. Heriberto desde muy pequeÃ±o aprendiÃ³ junto a su padre a realizar trabajos de soldadura. Y ahora lo desempeÃ±a independientemente. Este taller de soldadura era de su padre, pero por condiciones de salud fue heredado a Heriberto quien desde hace tres aÃ±os lo administra y ofrece los servicios de soldadura en la fabricaciÃ³n de balcones, verjas, portones, y cualquier trabajo en metal y acero inoxidable. El le dedica 10 horas diarias, empezando desde las 7.00 am. Es su primer prÃ©stamo con Odef, el cual lo invertirÃ¡ en compra de una maquina de soldadura, un taladro y materiales para soldadura, ya que la demanda de trabajo ha aumentado. Con la compra de esta maquina el podrÃ¡ ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio y rapidez, para que su negocio pueda generar buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Heriberto, 22, is single and has a one-year-old son; he lives in Colonia Sandoval, an outlying area of San Pedro Sula with his parents and his brother.
Since a very young age, Heriberto learned welding from his father. Now he works as a welder independently. His welding shop was his fatherâ€™s but due to health reasons it was passed down to Heriberto who has been running it for the last three years. He offers all welding services related to the construction of balconies, grilles, gates and any other metal and stainless steel work. He spends ten hours daily starting at 7am.
This is his first loan with Odef that he will use to buy a welding machine, a drill and welding supplies because demand at work has increased. With the purchase of this machine he will be able to offer his customers better and quicker service so that his business will generate good profits.

loan.use: to buy a welding machine, a drill and welding supplies.

loan.name: Evelyn Jeaneth

texts.es: Evelyn, vive con su esposo y tienen un hijo de 18 aÃ±os de edad, ella se dedica al comercio, vendiendo frutas frescas, con este negocio Evelyn ayuda a su esposo a cubrir los gastos familiares, ademÃ¡s que es un ingreso que tambien le ayuda a mantenerse por sÃ­ sola. Actualmente solicita un prÃ©stamo para la compra de banabas, fresas, manzanas, zapotes, papayas, para mantener en el negocio, esta compra la realizara con la intenciÃ³n de mejorar su negocio y que los clientes encuentren en ella los frutos de calidad. La aspiraciÃ³n de Evelyn es trabajar con su esposo, ahorrar y poderse comprar un lugar donde construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Evelyn lives with her husband. They have a son who is 18 years old. She is in business, selling fresh fruit. With this business, Evelyn helps her husband cover the family's expenses. It is also a source of income that helps her support herself through her own work.
Currently she is asking for a loan to purchase bananas, strawberries, apples, zapotes, and papayas in order to maintain her business. She will make this purchase with the intention of improving her business so that her customers will find her with quality fruit.
Evelyn's aspiration is to work with her husband, to save, and to be able to buy a property where they can build their own house.

loan.use: to purchase bananas, berries, apples, zapotes, and papayas

loan.name: Maximo

texts.es: El seÃ±or MÃ¡ximo tiene como actividad la fabricaciÃ³n de carteras y mochilas de cuero, esta actividad la realiza comercializando sus productos en el exterior del paÃ­s, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia. El destino del crÃ©dito es para el aumento de capital para su trabajo con la compra de materia prima en cuero ya que tiene que entregar un pedido para el cumplimiento de un contrato que suscribiÃ³ recientemente, es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante en la vida, se siente feliz ya que sus productos se venden en el exterior y esto le genera buenos ingresos, pero tambiÃ©n desea que todos sus productos se vendan en todo el paÃ­s, es una persona muy emprendedora con ganas de crecer mucho en su negocio y asÃ­ de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad e vida.
texts.en: MÃ¡ximo makes leather wallets and backpacks and sells these products in other countries. This is the main source of income for himself and his family. He will use the loan to increase the working capital for his work and will buy the basic materials for leather since he has to fill an order for a contract that he received recently. He is a very hardworking person with great desire to get ahead in life. He is happy that his products sell internationally because this gives him good income but he also wants to sell his items in his own country. He is a very entrepreneurial person with hopes to have his business grow and thus increase his earnings and improve his quality of life.

loan.use: to buy supplies for leather crafts

loan.name: Karla Maria

texts.es: Karla, se dedica a la venta de artesanÃ­as, estÃ¡ soltera, no tiene hijos, es independiente de sus padres, ella vende en la afueras de las escuelas de los cantones y pueblos, se dedica a ofrecerles a los alumnos collares, pulseras, juguetes, juegos, calcomanÃ­as, para el uso de los jÃ³venes. Actualmente solicita un prÃ©stamo para la compra de mercaderÃ­a, ya que estÃ¡ por iniciar las clases y es su temporada de venta, con este prÃ©stamo estarÃ¡ retomando su negocio y ofreciendo collares, pulseras, aretes, juguetes, juegos, calcomanÃ­as, muÃ±ecos. El objetivo de Karla es iniciar un aÃ±o con el negocio bien surtido, ganÃ¡ndose mÃ¡s clientes, y mejorando sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Karla sells crafts. Sheâ€™s single and has no children. Sheâ€™s independent from her parents. She sells outside schools in cantons and towns. She offers necklaces, bracelets, toys, games and decals to the students for their use.
She is asking for a loan at present to buy merchandise since classes are about to start and this is her season of high sales. With the loan she will be taking up her business again offering necklaces, bracelets, earrings, toys, games, decals and dolls.
Karlaâ€™s objective is to start the year with a good stock, to secure more customers and improve profits.

loan.use: to buy necklaces, bracelets, earrings, toys, games, decals and dolls.

loan.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is married and has an adult son and daughter. Svetlana lives in the Vodyanoye village. This is largely an agricultural region of Ukraine, where many people are involved in growing early vegetables. Svetlana has three greenhouses for seedlings, one large greenhouse (70 meters x 9 meters x 3.5 meters) and 15 six-meter greenhouses. She has 35,000 hryvnia invested into the business. Svetlana has been involved in growing vegetables for 20 years. Her expenses for seeds and plastic amount up to 25,000 hryvnia. Svetlana needs a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to purchase necessary materials for building an additional large and spacious greenhouse. Svetlana has enough land, but it is being taken by small greenhouses, and it is uncomfortable to work there. In the future, Svetlana wants to continue expanding and put more greenhouses on unused land.

loan.use: to purchase necessary materials for building an additional large and spacious greenhouse

loan.name: Maria Milagro

texts.es: MarÃ­a, vive con su madre y una hermana de 12 aÃ±os de edad, administra una tienda y pupuseria, tiene 7 aÃ±os de experiencia, anteriormente su madre lo administraba pero lo heredo para que fuera MarÃ­a quien continuara brindando servicio. Ella solicita un prÃ©stamo para la compra de aceite, manteca, arroz, azÃºcar, frijoles, huevos, pan, toda esta mercaderÃ­a para la tienda, ya que quiere que el inventario crezca, dÃ¡ndole mayor facilidad para atender a los clientes. MarÃ­a, tiene por objetivo el mantener los negocios, dÃ¡ndoles vida para que sus padres consideren la administraciÃ³n de ella, ademÃ¡s que sus ingresos sean mejores para apoyarles.
texts.en:
MarÃ­a lives with her mother and a 12-year-old sister. She runs a store and a grocery store. She has 7 yearsâ€™ experience. Previously her mother ran it but she passed it down to MarÃ­a so that sheâ€™d continue providing service.
She requests a loan to buy oil, lard, rice, sugar, beans, eggs and bread. All of this merchandise is for the store because she wants her inventory to grow to have more ease in taking care of customers.
MarÃ­aâ€™s goal is to maintain the businesses giving them life so that her parents will be proud of the way sheâ€™s running them in addition to her income being higher to help them out.

loan.use: to buy oil, lard, rice, sugar, beans, eggs and bread.

loan.name: Elvia

texts.es: Elvia de 52 aÃ±os de edad vive al sur de la ciudad y se dedica a la confecciÃ³n de traperos y limpiones, negocio que iniciÃ³ con su cÃ³nyuge desde hace 11 aÃ±os, cuando este Ãºltimo quedÃ³ sin empleo y tomaron su liquidaciÃ³n para conjuntamente generar ingresos que beneficiaran a su hogar, especialmente a su hijo de 15 aÃ±os de edad, que gradualmente requiere condiciones educativas superiores. En su negocio tienen relaciones comerciales con panificadoras y empresas importantes, a quienes les vende limpiones industriales fabricados en su propio negocio y los cuales les pagan quincenal y mensualmente. Su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente cuando estas empresas incrementan sus pedidos y esta es justamente la razÃ³n por la cual acude a capital de prÃ©stamo, como el que estÃ¡ aplicando con su credikiva, quinto financiamiento que hace a la FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo, organizaciÃ³n con la cual ha logrado crecer y generar ingresos importantes para su familia mediante su trabajo y el de su cÃ³nyuge. En la actualidad planea comprar materias primas para elaborar traperos y limpiones en telas de franelas, para despuÃ©s de someterlos a un proceso productivo vender a nuevas empresas que le han encargado
texts.en:
Elvia, 52, lives in the south of the city and works making mops and cleaning cloths, a business she started with her spouse 11 years ago when he lost his job and they used his severance pay to work together generating income that would benefit their home, especially their 15 year old son who gradually needs higher educational conditions.
In her business they have commercial relationships with bakeries and important firms that they sell industrial cleaning cloths made in her own business to and that they are paid for either every two weeks or monthly.
Her working capital becomes insufficient when these firms increase their orders and this is precisely the reason behind her seeking capital from a loan like the Kiva one sheâ€™s applying for, her fifth loan from FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo, an organization sheâ€™s grown with and managed to generate important income for her family through her and her spouseâ€™s work. She plans now to buy raw materials to make the mops and cleaning cloths out of flannel that is put into a productive process to then sell to new firms that have placed orders.

loan.use: to buy supplies.

loan.name: Vasiliy

texts.en:
Vasiliy is from the village of Vodyanoe. He lives there with his wife and two adult children. Vasiliy grows early vegetables, tomatoes and radishes. He has a large plot of land which holds three large greenhouses and two hothouses for transplanting. Vasiliy has been growing vegetables for 25 years. He invested 65,000 hryvna in his business. Every year the expenses on seeds and plastic film are 30,000 hryvna.
Vasiliy plans to invest the 8,000 hryvna loan from Kiva to purchase polyethylene film using 3,500 hryvna, seeds for 3,000 hryvna and he also plans to buy gas at 1,500 hryvna to keep warmth during the cold winter in each of their greenhouses. Vasiliy gladly channels the financial means towards development of his business. He seeks to develop further and has a promising potential for this.

loan.use: buy plastic sheeting using 3,500 hryvnas, seeds for 3,000 hryvnas and also buy gas at 1,500 hryvnas to keep warmth in greenhouses during the cold winter.

loan.name: Susana

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora Susana es una mujer joven de 33 aÃ±os de edad que se encuentra casada desde hace 10 aÃ±os con el seÃ±or Federico RamÃ­rez Rafael, el cual es ayudante de albaÃ±il, es decir se dedica a la construcciÃ³n de casas, juntos procrearon 3 hijos de las siguientes edades, uno de 9 aÃ±os, otro de 8 aÃ±os, y el mÃ¡s pequeÃ±o de ellos de 6 aÃ±os, todos ellos se encuentran actualmente estudiando en la primaria.
Este es el quinto ciclo que la seÃ±ora Susana entra a un prÃ©stamo y estÃ¡ conforme con los resultados que ha obtenido, en esta ocasiÃ³n ella solicita el prÃ©stamo para invertirlo, la mitad en la compra de 3 borregos para crÃ­a y pastura; y la otra mitad para comprar: estambres, agujas, ganchos, etc. para la elaboraciÃ³n de manteles, chalecos, carpetas, sueteres y otros productos tejidos. Las borregas las criarÃ¡ en su casa es la primera vez que ella experimentarÃ¡ como criadora de ovejas, le llama la atenciÃ³n invertirlo en las ovejas ya que sabe que si las cuida las puede hacer engordar y posteriormente las puede vender. "Lo importante es invertir tu dinero en algo y cuando lo necesites vender tus bienes y asÃ­ recuperas tu inversiÃ³n" dice Susana.
En cuanto a los tejidos, ella lleva 2 aÃ±os de experiencia, este es su negocio de Ã©xito ya que dice que lo sabe hacer muy bien y que mejor que seguir poniÃ©ndolo en prÃ¡ctica, la forma en que ella elabora los tejidos es la siguiente: Con un gancho, "Como en toda actividad, el tejido tambiÃ©n requiere de mucha paciencia y dedicaciÃ³n. El ganchillo es un mÃ©todo para tejer con lana o hilo, usando un ganchillo y un ovillo de lana. El ganchillo generalmente se sujeta en la mano derecha Incluso los zurdos pueden aprender a hacer ganchillo de este modo o tambiÃ©n pueden invertir las instrucciones" Para empezar haga un nudo corredizo (deslizado) "Tira de la hebra de lana en el centro del ovillo. Se hace una lazada a una distancia de 12 a 15 cm del extremo, colocando dicho extremo delante del ovillo de lana y a continuaciÃ³n dejamos que el resto del extremo de lana caiga ligeramente por detrÃ¡s de la lazada. Se introduce el ganchillo por la lazada. Se recoge la lana de detrÃ¡s de la lazada con la punta del ganchillo. La pasamos a travÃ©s de la parte delantera de la lazada. Con cuidado, tiramos del extremo de la lana para que quede la lazada tirante alrededor del ganchillo. Ya estÃ¡ el primer punto" dice Susana y de esta manera nos compartiÃ³ sÃ³lo la forma de cÃ³mo iniciar un tejido, ya que como nos menciona para hacerlo se requiere gran paciencia, ella en un futuro espera seguir creciendo en su negocio ya que lo sabe hacer y lo quiere seguir poniendo en prÃ¡ctica, "Quiero seguir ayudando a mis hijos a estudiar y ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos" dice Susana.
Con las ganancias de su negocio a ella le gustarÃ­a mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Susana is a 33-year-old woman who has been married to Federico RamÃ­rez Rafael for the last 10 years. Heâ€™s a bricklayerâ€™s assistant, that is to say, he works building houses. They had three children together who are 9, 8 and 6 years old. All of them are attending elementary school.
This is the fifth cycle Susana has taken a loan out in and sheâ€™s satisfied with the results sheâ€™s gotten. On this occasion sheâ€™s asking for the loan to invest half of it in the purchase of three sheep to raise and put out to pasture and the other half to buy yarn, needles, hooks, etc. to make tablecloths, vests, mats, sweaters and other knitted items. This is the first time sheâ€™s going to experiment with raising sheep at home. Sheâ€™s attracted to this because she knows that if she takes care of them and causes them to fatten up she can sell them later on. â€œWhatâ€™s important is to invest your money in something so that when you need to sell your assets you recover your investment,â€ says Susana.
With respect to the textiles, she has two yearsâ€™ experience. This is her successful business because she says that she knows how to do it very well and what better thing to do than to put it into practice. The way she makes these textiles is the following: With a knitting needle. â€œLike any activity, knitting also requires much patience and dedication. The â€œganchilloâ€ is a method for knitting with yarn or thread using a hook and a ball of yarn. One usually holds the hook in the right hand but even left handed people can learn to use the hook by just inverting the instructions.â€
To begin, make a slipknot. â€œPull on the thread of yarn in the center of the ball. You pull a bow of about 12 to 15 centimeters from the end placing said end in front of the ball of yarn and then we let the rest of the end of the yarn to fall slightly behind the bow. The hook is introduced through the bow. The yarn is gathered behind the bow with the tip of the hook. We pass it through the front of the bow. Carefully we pull on the end of the yarn so that the bow is taught around the hook. Thatâ€™s the first purl,â€ says Susana. She shared with us the way to knit because as she mentions to do so requires great patience.
In the future sheâ€™d like to continue to grow in her business because she knows how to do it and wants to continue putting it into practice. â€œI want to continue to help my children to go to school and to help my husband with expenses,â€ says Susana. With profits from her business sheâ€™d like to do some home improvements.

loan.use: to buy sheep to raise and to buy embroidery supplies.

loan.name: Ruth Meri

texts.es: La socia Ruth Meri continua con su negocio de compra y venta de frutas ella sigue con el negocio porque le ha ido muy bien y sigue llevando a Puerto Maldonado, la socia trabaja arduamente para seguir creciendo economicamente; la socia solicita en esta ocasiÃ³n el prestamo para invertir en la compra de fruta e incrementar su mercado.
texts.en: Ruth Meri continues with her business buying and selling fruit. She continues with it because sheâ€™s done very well and continues taking to Puerto Maldonado. She works hard to continue growing economically. On this occasion sheâ€™s asking for the loan to buy fruit and increase her market.

loan.use: to buy fruit.

loan.name: Dionicia Yesenia

texts.es: Dionisia, vive con su familia, con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella administra un comedor el cual comenzÃ³ por iniciativa propia por la necesidad de tener ingresos, este negocio lo tiene en el mercado municipal, su horario es de 11:00am a 2:00pm, en este horario realiza la venta de comida, ella ya posee experiencia en esta actividad. Actualmente estÃ¡ solicitando un prÃ©stamo para la compra de materiales para hacer comida como carnes de pollo y res, verduras, aceite, condimentos, algunos utensilios de cocina como ollas, cucharas, para el cocimiento de los alimentos; Este prÃ©stamo le permitirÃ¡ mejorar su negocio, con nuevas herramientas para que el sabor de las comidas sea mejor. La aspiraciÃ³n de Dionisia es tener un negocio estable, mÃ¡s capaz para atender a los clientes y con mayor estabilidad econÃ³mica para su familia.
texts.en:
Dionisia lives with her family, with her husband and three children. She runs an eatery that she started with her own initiative needing to have income. The business is in the municipal market and her schedule is 11am to 2pm. During this shift she sells food and she has experience in this line of work.
She is currently asking for a loan to buy supplies she needs to prepare the food like chicken, beef, vegetables, oil and condiments and a few kitchen utensils like pots and spoons to cook the food. This loan will allow her to improve her business with new tools so that the flavor of the food will be better.
Dionisiaâ€™s hope is to have a stable business which is more capable of tending to customers and to have more economic stability for her family.

loan.use: to buy chicken, beef, vegetables, oil and contiments.

loan.name: Teofila

texts.es: TeÃ³fila, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 6 y 10 aÃ±os de edad, ella tiene una experiencia en el negocio de 15 aÃ±os, lo tiene en el mercado municipal, naciÃ³ por su propia iniciativa. Actualmente estÃ¡ solicitando un prÃ©stamo para la compra de blusas, short, ropa interior, para surtir el negocio, esta inversiÃ³n le ayudara a TeÃ³fila a mantener sus ventas y agradar a los clientes. Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio, para atraer a mÃ¡s personas, ademÃ¡s de que tendrÃ¡ la oportunidad de generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
TeÃ³filaâ€™s a clothes merchant. She lives with her husband and two children who are 6 and 10 years old. She has 15 yearsâ€™ experience in business which is in the municipal market and arose from her own initiative.
She is requesting the loan to buy blouses, shorts and underwear to stock the business. This investment will help TeÃ³fila keep up her sales and please customers.
Her objective is to strengthen the business to attract more people as well as will have an opportunity to earn greater profits.

loan.use: to buy blouses, shorts and underwear.

loan.name: Jeaqueline Del Carmen

texts.es: Jacqueline, vive con su esposo y un hijo, tienen casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de meriendas y licuados, este negocio naciÃ³ por el interÃ©s de tener ingresos que le permitieran a ella cubrir alguna necesidad familiar, en apoyo con su esposo, este negocio tiene 4 aÃ±os de existir, es muy rentable por la ubicaciÃ³n que transitan estudiantes. Ella estÃ¡ solicitando un prÃ©stamo para la compra de frutas frescas para la preparaciÃ³n y extracciÃ³n de jugos, ademÃ¡s para hacer licuados, tambien comprara un extractor de jugo y una licuadora. Con estas herramientas nuevas podrÃ¡ mejorar la capacidad de su venta y generar mayor y mejor atenciÃ³n a los clientes. La aspiraciÃ³n de Jacqueline es que su negocio crezca, tambien adquirir mayores conocimientos para mejorar la preparaciÃ³n de los productos.
texts.en:
Jacqueline lives with her husband and one child. They have their own house. She works selling snacks and fruit smoothies. This business arose out of her interest in having income which allows her to cover some of the family's needs, in support of her husband. This business has existed for 4 years, and it is quite profitable thanks to its location in an area where students pass by.
She is requesting a loan to buy fresh fruits to extract and prepare juices, and also to make smoothies. She will also buy a juicer and a blender. With this new equipment, she will be able to expand her sales capacity and provide more and better service to her customers.
Jacqueline's aspiration is that her business will grow, and she also wants to acquire better knowledge to improve the preparation of her products.

loan.use: to buy a juicer, a blender and fruit to prepare smoothies.

loan.name: Lilian Estela

texts.es: Lilian, vive con su hijo de 13 aÃ±os de edad en casa propia, ella se dedica a vender comida desayunos, almuerzos y cenas todos los dÃ­as de 5:00 pm a 6:00 pm, desde hace diez aÃ±os, por iniciativa propia de lunes a domingo. El prÃ©stamo lo utilizara para comprar los ingredientes como: pollo, carnes, arroz, frijoles, repollo, tomates y de esa manera lograra mejorar su inventario y obtendrÃ¡ mejores ganancias el cual le ayudara para siempre mantener su negocio estable. La aspiraciÃ³n de Lilian es establecer otro negocio, ayudar a su hijo a estudiar y siempre ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Lilian lives with her 13-year-old son in her own house. She has been working selling food for ten years, breakfast, lunch, and dinner every day from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. on her own from Monday through Sunday.
She will use the loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, meat, rice, beans, cabbage, and tomatoes. In this way she will manage to improve her inventory and will obtain better profits, which will help her to always keep her business stable.
Lilian's goals are to set up another business, help her son to study, and always help with the household expenses.

loan.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, beans, cabbage, and tomatoes.

loan.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana, se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y ropa, vive en casa que heredo de su padre, es madre de dos hijos, por quienes recibe ayuda del padre de estos, ella inicio el negocio por la necesidad de mejorar y obtener ingresos para el sustento de sus hijos, cubrir con los gastos del hogar. Ella estÃ¡ solicitando un prÃ©stamo para la compra de ropa y frutas, blusas, faldas, pantalones y ropa interior; papayas, naranjas, bananas, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar el inventario del negocio, ya que por el momento posee mÃ¡s verduras, pero ella quiere tener igual cantidad de productos. La aspiraciÃ³n de Ana es encontrar la estabilidad en los negocios, que le permita tener mejores oportunidades para sus hijos.
texts.en: Ana, who sells fruits, vegetables, and clothing, lives in a house she inherited from her father. She is the mother of two children, and she receives help from their father. She began the business because she needed to improve and obtain income to support her children, and to cover the costs of the home. She is asking for a loan in order to buy clothing and fruits: shirts, skirts, pants, underwear, papayas, oranges, and bananas. This purchase will help her to improve the inventory of the business. Ana's aspiration is to discover stability in her businesses. This will allow her to have better opportunities for her children.

loan.use: buy clothing and fruits, shirts, skirts, pants, and underwear.

loan.name: Herculano Engelberto

texts.es: Herculano, vive con su madre, su esposa y un hijo de 22 aÃ±os de edad, el trabajo de Herculano es la carpinterÃ­a, este oficio lo inicio hace dos aÃ±os, su hijo le ayuda a realizar los muebles, trabaja por encargo. Por el momento Herculano solicita un prÃ©stamo para la compra de madera de cedro, laurel, aceituno, barniz, masÃ­as, pega y otros materiales necesarios para la carpinterÃ­a, este prÃ©stamo serÃ¡ de gran ayuda para mejorar la productividad del taller. Ã‰l tiene como objetivo crear nuevos diseÃ±os y en un futuro tener la oportunidad con mÃ¡s clientes demandantes de sus muebles.
texts.en:
Herculano lives with his mother, his wife, and a 22-year-old son. Herculano's work is carpentry, a job he began two years ago. His son helps him make the furniture. He works on order.
For the moment Herculano is requesting a loan to buy cedar, laurel, and olive wood, and varnish, mastic, glue, and other materials necessary for carpentry. This loan will be a great help for improving his shop's productivity.
His objective is to create new designs and in the future have the opportunity to have more customers wanting his furniture.

loan.use: to buy cedar, laurel, and olive wood, and varnish, mastic, and glue.

loan.name: Shielenn Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Shielenn; pertenece al banco comunal "MARIA AUXILIADORA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Sebastian perteneciente al departamento de Cusco,
La socia tiene 22 aÃ±os de edad y es soltera, la sociase dedica la compra y venta de productos de belleza, ella vende por catÃ¡logos, la socia tambiÃ©n se dedica a la compra y ventad e ropa, la socia suele viajar a la ciudad de Lima y la ciudad de Trujillo para comprar de las diferentes tiendas y fabricas todo tipo de ropa de temporada y de zapatos para traer a vender a sus amistades y clientes en general. En esta ocasiÃ³n la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ropa y zapatos.
La socia agradece el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner Shielenn belongs to the communal bank "Maria Auxiliadora". The bank is located in the San Sebastian District, which belongs to the department of Cusco.
The parter is 22 years old and is single. She buys and sells beauty products through catalogs. She also buys and sells clothing. She usually travels to the cities of Lima and Trujillo to buy all types of seasonal clothing and shoes from the different stores and factories, in order to sell them to her friends and customers in general. She is asking for a loan on this occasion to invest in the purchase of clothing and shoes.
Shielenn is thankful for the loan, and she promises to follow through with the payment of her dues at the established time.

loan.use: buy clothing and shoes.

loan.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca forma parte del Banco comunal â€œEsmeraldaâ€ perteneciente a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Ella se dedica a preparar variedad de alimentos dependiendo de la temporada. Durante el aÃ±o realiza empanadas, tortas, dulces, entre otras comidas. Actualmente realiza humitas (masa envuelta de hojas de maÃ­z), pastel de choclo (pasta de maÃ­z al horno) y tambiÃ©n mote con huesillo. Se desempeÃ±a en Ã©ste rubro desde hace 12 aÃ±os. Comenta que tuvo un local de comida rÃ¡pida, sin embargo posterior al terremoto del 27 de febrero de 2010, su negocio fue asolado. Por ahora prepara sus comidas en la comodidad de su casa. Hace entregas directas en los domicilios de sus clientes, de acuerdo a los pedidos que realicen. Francisca se dedica a su negocio de lunes a sÃ¡bado con un horario flexible. Sus insumos los compra en la vega monumental (feria libre que abastece comerciantes). Con el crÃ©dito comprarÃ¡ cebollas, choclos (maÃ­z) y huevos, al por mayor. Una de las metas para su negocio es instalarse nuevamente con un local establecido (amasanderÃ­a), para esto debe esperar la reconstrucciÃ³n de su casa. Francisca vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 28 y 18 aÃ±os de edad, el mayor estudia la carrera de pedagogÃ­a en filosofÃ­a y su hija menor comenzarÃ¡ a estudiar en la Universidad Ã©ste aÃ±o. El sueÃ±o de Francisca es que sus hijos sean profesionales. Ella estÃ¡ muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirÃ¡ invertir en su negocio. El grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido, responsable y comprometido. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del Banco comunal, comenta que le han servido para mejorar algunas estrategias de contabilidad. Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la regiÃ³n del BiobÃ­o, al sur de Chile. Es conocida como uno de los principales puertos del paÃ­s. Su nombre en mapudungun (lengua mapuche) significa "cielo tronador". Posee un paisaje natural muy atractivo, debido a la combinaciÃ³n de rÃ­os, mar, planicies fÃ©rtiles, vegas y los cuerpos montaÃ±osos, con una hermosa vegetaciÃ³n. Su economÃ­a gira en torno a su puerto, su Base Naval, y un importante barrio industrial con empresas siderÃºrgicas, refinerÃ­a de petrÃ³leo, petroquÃ­mica, cemento, gas, etc.
texts.en: Francisca is part of the communal bank "Esmeralda", which is in the city of Talchuaho. She prepares a variety of food, depending on the season. During the year, she makes empanadas, cakes, candies, and other foods. She is currently making humitas (dough wrapped in corn leaves), pastel de choclo (baked corn pastry), and a peach and husked wheat drink. She has been working in this way for 12 years. She says that she had a fast food business. However, the earthquake on the 27th of February, 2010, destroyed her business. For now, she prepares her foods in the comfort of her home. She delivers directly to the homes of her customers, according to the orders that they make. Francisca works at her business from Monday through Saturday with a flexible schedule. She buys her ingredients at the large market (an open air fair that the merchants set up). She will buy onions, corn, and eggs at wholesale with the loan. One of her goals for her business is to settle into a new business establishment. She must wait for the reconstruction of her house, though. Francisca lives with her husband and her two children who are 28 and 18 years old. The older one studies philosophy and his younger sister will begin studying at the university this year. Francisa's dream is that her children become professionals. She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza is offering to her, since it will allow her to invest in her business. The communal bank that she is part of is very tight-knit, responsible, and committed. In respect to the training that is given at the communal bank meetings, she says that they have taught her to use better accounting strategies. Talcahuano is a town and city-port in the BiobÃ­o region, in southern Chile. It is know as one of the main ports in the country. It's name, in mapudungun (the mapuche language) means "thundering sky". It has a very attractive, natural passage, due to the combination of rivers, sea, fertile plains, meadows, and the mountainous bodies, with beautiful vegetation. Its economy revolves around the port, its naval base, and an important industrial district with companies of iron and steel, petroleum refinery, petrochemistry, cement, gas, etc.

loan.use: buy onions, corn, and eggs at wholesale.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy watermelon, cantaloupe, apples, grapes, and other types of fruit.

loan.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio Julio Cesar; pertenece al banco comunal "MARIA AUXILIADORA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Sebastian perteneciente al departamento de Cusco,
El socio tiene 23 aÃ±os de edad y es soltero, El socio se dedica a trabajar con su unidad vehicular el presta servicio de taxi a los diferentes clientes, el socio en esta ocasiÃ³n desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de llanatas y en hacerle el mantenimiento de su automovil para tenerlo operativo y seguir prestando el servicio de taxi. El socio solicita el prestamo para comprar llantas y hacer el manteniemiento de sus auto.
El socio agradece el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner Julio Cesar belongs to the communal bank "Maria Auxiliadora". The bank is located in the San Sebastian District, which is part of the Cusco department.
The partner is 23 years old and single. He works with his traffic unit to offer taxi services to different customers. On this occasion, Julio Cesar wants to invest the loan in the purchase of tires and the maintenance of his automobile to have it in working condition and to continue offering his taxi service. He is asking for the loan to buy tires and to do maintenance on his auto.
He is thankful for the loan, and he promises to follow through with the payment of his dues at the established time.

loan.use: buy tires and maintain his car.

loan.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y verduras, vive con su hermana y una tÃ­a, ademÃ¡s es madre soltera de una niÃ±a de 4 aÃ±os, el negocio de Reina es la venta de tortillas y verduras, tiene ademÃ¡s crianza de cerdos en su casa, es una mujer trabajadora, que se esfuerza por mantener ingresos para su familia. Actualmente solicita un prÃ©stamo para la compra de maÃ­z, papas, gÃ¼isquiles, plÃ¡tanos, tomates, cebollas, estos productos para fortalecer el negocio con verdura fresca, con la compra de maÃ­z al por mayor tendrÃ¡ la materia prima necesaria para aumentar la producciÃ³n de las tortillas. La aspiraciÃ³n de Reina es que su negocio crezca, brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
texts.en:
Reina sells tortillas and vegetables. She lives with her sister and an aunt and is also a single mother of a 4 year old daughter. As well as selling tortillas and vegetables she raises pigs in her home. She is a hardworking woman who commits herself to maintain an income for her family.

At the moment she is requesting the loan to buy corn, potatoes, whiskey, bananas, tomatoes, and onions so she can offer fresh products and with the purchase of wholesale corn can make more tortillas. Reina's goal is to grow her business and offer he daughter a better quality of life.

loan.use: buy corn, potatoes, whiskey, bananas, tomatoes, and onions.

loan.name: Elmer Jaime

texts.es: Elmer Jaime es una persona que desde muy joven se ha visto en la necesidad de trabajar. Su padre abandonÃ³ a su madre, hermanas y hermano cuando el tenÃ­a 13 aÃ±os, y debido a que su madre no estaba en condiciones de trabajar, el se vio en la obligaciÃ³n con su hermano de hacerse cargo de las obligaciones de su familia. Desde entonces, Elmer Jaime trabaja en fincas cercanas de su vivienda y poco a poco fue trabajando en su finca en una cosecha de cafÃ©, yuca y plÃ¡tano. Gracias a su buena experiencia en la actividad de la cosecha, adquirida mientras trabajaba en fincas, Elmer Jaime logrÃ³ que su cosecha diera unos productos de excelente calidad, por lo que hoy se dedica por completo a la actividad de la agricultura con su cosecha de cafÃ© principalmente y la complementa con una cosecha de yuca y una de plÃ¡tano. Elmer Jaime, actualmente con 50 aÃ±os de edad, casado y con 2 hijas de 7 y 13 aÃ±os, obtiene los ingresos con los que sostiene a su familia gracias a su trabajo en la agricultura, y sueÃ±a con que sus cosechas sigan creciendo para que en un futuro sus hijos puedan tener una estabilidad econÃ³mica. Elmer Jaime busca que su cosecha de cafÃ©, que es la que mayores ingresos le genera, pueda dar productos de excelente calidad para poder venderlos a un buen precio, sin embargo, la temporada invernal ha hecho que sus cosechas se deterioren un poco y se vea en la necesidad de comprar abono para las mismas. Sin embargo, Elmer Jaime no tiene el capital suficiente en la actualidad para comprar los sacos de abono que requiere, por lo que espera que un prÃ©stamo le permita acceder a comprar los sacos de abono que requiere, y poder asÃ­ obtener grandes ingresos para cumplir el gran sueÃ±o de que sus hijos puedan acceder a la mejor educaciÃ³n posible, y tengan un bienestar mucho mejor que con el que cuentan actualmente.
texts.en:
Elmer Jaime is a person who has needed to work from a very young age. His father abandoned his mother, sisters, and brother when he was 13, and since his mother was in no condition to work, he and his brother felt obliged to take charge of the family obligations. Since then, Elmer Jaime has worked on farms near his home, and little by little he worked on growing coffee, yucca, and bananas on his own farm.
Thanks to his good experience he acquired working on the crops, Elmer Jaime managed for his harvest to produce some products of excellent quality, which is why today he devotes himself completely to farming, principally with his coffee crop, complemented by yucca and banana crops.
Elmer Jaime is currently 50 years old and married, with two daughters, ages 7 and 13. He earns the income with which he supports his family thanks to his work in agriculture. He dreams that his crops will continue growing so in the future his children can have financial stability. Elmer Jaime is looking for his coffee crop, which is the one that generates the most income for him, to give excellent quality products to be able to sell them at a good price. However, the winter season has caused his crops to deteriorate a bit, and made it necessary for him to buy fertilizer for them.
Nevertheless, Elmer Jaime currently does not have the necessary capital to buy the bags of fertilizer he needs. He hopes that a loan will enable him to buy them so he will be able to have lots of income to realize his big dream, for his children to get the best education possible and have greater well-being than they currently have.

loan.use: to buy bags of fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loan.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es propietaria de un taller de confecciones ubicado en el barrio Pinar del Rio, donde confecciona vestidos para damas, caballeros y niÃ±os. Su gran experiencia data desde hace muchos aÃ±os, cuando trabajÃ³ un tiempo importante, como empleada en diversas empresas de confecciones de la ciudad de Barranquilla y como producto de su conocimiento teÃ³rico-prÃ¡ctico adquirido mediante sus estudios tÃ©cnicos en el Sena. Ella tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 37 y 39 aÃ±os, vive con su cÃ³nyuge, quien se dedica a trabajos de ornamentaciÃ³n en aluminio y tambiÃ©n en hierro. Carmen posee los equipos necesarios para su labor, tiene una infraestructura de maquinaria adecuada al tamaÃ±o del negocio y sus clientes disfrutan de la muy buena calidad con que fabrica los jeans, pantalones formales y vestidos femeninos, que son sus principales lÃ­neas de trabajo; con ello sostiene una clientela muy rentable que cada dÃ­a crece y ella vive entusiasmada con incrementarle aun mas la calidad de sus productos. Esta es la razÃ³n por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprarÃ¡ una mÃ¡quina plana para mejorar e incrementar la producciÃ³n y tambiÃ©n comprarÃ¡ materias primas para responder a sus pedidos de principio de aÃ±o. Con su negocio Carmen estÃ¡ muy satisfecha, porque aporta a los gastos del hogar, pues sus ventas mensuales le generan un buen margen de rentabilidad lo que le permite hacerlo.
texts.en: Carmen is the owner of a tailoring workshop located in the Pinar del Rio neighborhood, where clothes for women, men, and children are made. She has had great experience for many years. She worked for a while as an employee at different tailoring companies in the city of Barranquilla. She also has experience as a result of her theoretical-practical knowledge that she acquired through her technical studies in Sena. She has 2 children who are 37 and 39 years old. She lives with her spouse, who works on aluminum and iron ornamentation jobs. Carmen owns the necessary equipment to do her work. She has an infrastructure of adequate machinery for the size of her business, and her customers enjoy the very good quality of the jeans, formal pants, and feminine dresses that she makes. These are her main products of her work. With this, she maintains a very profitable clientele that grows each day. She is excited to increase the quality of her products even more. This is the reason that she is turning to Kiva, the first financing that she is getting from FundaciÃ³n Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy a flat machine to improve and increase her production, and also to buy raw materials to fulfill her orders from the beginning of the year. Carmen is very satisfied with her business, because she contributes to the household costs. Her monthly sales generate a good margin of profit for her, which allows her to do this.

loan.use: to buy a flat machine to improve and increase her production and to buy raw materials to fulfill her orders

loan.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia Yaneth; pertenece al banco comunal "MARIA AUXILIADORA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Sebastian perteneciente al departamento de Cusco,
La socia tiene 22 aÃ±os de edad y es soltera, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de granos secos, la socia tiene su stand en uno d elos mercados de la ciudad y compra al por mayor y menor granos secos como tarwi, moraya, habas, porotos, lentejas, trigo, cebada, maÃ­z, cereales diversos como quinua entre otros productos y los vende en su stand. En esta ocasiÃ³n la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de granos secos y de este modo incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ganancias.
La socia agradece el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner Yaneth belongs to the communal bank "Maria Auxiliadora". The bank is located in the San Sebastian District, which belongs to the department of Cusco.
Yaneth is 22 years old and is single. She buys and sells dry grain products. She has her stand in one of the city markets. She buys seeds, dried potato flour, beans, lentils, wheat, barley, corn, different cereals like quinoa among other products at wholesale and retail, and she sells them at her stand. On this occasion, the partner is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of dry grains, and in this way increase her sales and improve her earnings.
Yaneth is thankful for the loan, and she promises to follow through with the payment of her dues at the established time.

loan.use: to buy dry grains, and to increase her sales and improve her earnings.

loan.name: Silvia Maritza

texts.es: Silvia, vive en casa propia junto con sus dos hijas de 12 y 17 aÃ±os de edad, ella se dedica a vender ropa para niÃ±os, damas y caballeros y Ãºtiles escolares el negocio lo inicio hace 10 aÃ±os no tiene un horario establecido. El prÃ©stamo lo utilizara para comprar Ãºtiles escolares para esta Ã©poca de inicio de aÃ±o para las escuelas y comprar mercaderÃ­a como: mochilas, lÃ¡piz, sacapuntas, cuadernos, lapiceros y otros Ãºtiles necesarios de esa forma lograra tener mÃ¡s clientes y mejorar en sus ganancias. El sueÃ±o de Silvia es siempre mantener estable su negocio y vivir bien con sus hijas y darles el estudio para que sean profesionales y salgan adelante.
texts.en: Silvia lives in her own home with her two daughters who are 12 and 17 years old. She sells clothing for children, women, and men, along with school supplies. She began the business 10 years ago. She does not have a set schedule. She will use the loan to buy school supplies for this beginning of the school year season and to buy merchandise like: book-bags, pencils, pencil sharpeners, notebooks, pens, and other necessary items of this kind. She will obtain more customers and improve her earnings. Silvia's dream is to always keep her business stable. She wants to live well with her children, and to give them the opportunity to study so that they can become professional and move ahead.

loan.use: buy book-bags, pencils, pencil sharpeners, notebooks, and pens.

loan.name: Magda Yojana

texts.es:
Magda Yojana tiene 28 aÃ±os de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos con edades de 11, 5 y 3 aÃ±os de edad. Magda era empleada de una maquila, pero el poco tiempo que le dedicaba a su familia la llevo a tomar la decisiÃ³n de establecer su propio Foto estudio, donde ofrece los servicios de Fotos instantÃ¡neas, ampliaciones fotogrÃ¡ficas, fotos con diseÃ±o y restauraciÃ³n de fotografÃ­as daÃ±adas, tambiÃ©n ofrece a los colegios y escuelas, diseÃ±os de folletos para cada ocasiÃ³n con fotografÃ­as para graduaciones, cumpleaÃ±os etc. Inicio en su casa hace 10 aÃ±os, pero ahora tiene un local mÃ¡s amplio donde su esposo le apoya. Ella le dedica 8 horas diarias y tambiÃ©n el tiempo necesario a su familia.
Ha solicitado varios prÃ©stamos para ampliar el Negocio actualmente esta solicitado L.10, 000.00 el cual lo invertirÃ¡ en compra de papelerÃ­a para fotos, cambiar el cielo falso y hacerle divisiones al negocio, para poder dar un mejor servicio profesional al cliente, ya que su negocio ha crecido y sus ventas han aumentado.
texts.en:
Magda Yojana, age 28, is married and has three children, ages 11, 5, and 3. Magda worked in a factory. However, the small amount of time she devoted to her family caused her to make the decision to establish her own business. It is a photo studio where she offers snapshots, photo enlargements, photo design, and restoration of damaged photos. She also offers schools brochure designs for every occasion with graduation and birthday photos, etc.
She started ten years ago in her house, but she now has a larger place where her husband supports her. She works eight hours a day, and she also has the time she needs with her family.
She has requested several loans to expand her business. She is currently requesting 10,000 lempiras to buy photo paper, to change the ceiling, and to make dividers for the business. She will do this to be able to give better professional service to the customers. Her business has grown, and her sales have increased.

loan.use: to buy photo paper, to change the ceiling, and to make dividers for the business.

location.town: Colonia el ParaÃ­so, San Pedro Sula

loan.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Fortaleza es el grupo integrado por 13 mujeres, quienes son amigas y vecinas de uno de los barrios de la ciudad de EncarnaciÃ³n, ellas se unieron pues vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundaciÃ³n paraguaya. Actualmente se encuentran en el ciclo catorce y desean seguir trabajando con la fundaciÃ³n. Rosalina es una de las miembro, ella es una humilde mujer que trabaja sacrificadamente para poder mantener a su familia. Su medio de trabajo es una pequeÃ±a despensa que tiene, gracias a la cual tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Una de sus metas es seguir creciendo como microempresaria. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de fideos, arroz, azÃºcar, harina, aceites y demÃ¡s artÃ­culos de primera necesidad, pues son los que mÃ¡s salida tienen. Tanto ella como sus compaÃ±eras estÃ¡n muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que la fundaciÃ³n y kiva les da.
texts.en:
Fortaleza is a group of 13 women, who are friends and neighbors from a neighborhood in the city of EncarnaciÃ³n. They got together because they saw a great opportunity for progress in the working women's program of Kiva partner FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya. They meet every two weeks and want to keep working with the foundation.
Rosalina is one of the group's members. She is a humble woman who works strenuously in order to maintain her family. She has a little shop, thanks to which she is able to help her family. One of her goals is to keep growing as a microtrader.
She is seeking a loan to buy noodles, rice, sugar, flour, oil, and other basic goods, as these are the items that sell best. Both she and her comrades are very grateful for the assistance that Kiva has given them.

loan.use: to buy noodles, rice, sugar, flour, oil, and other items.

loan.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "MARIA AUXILIADORA"; El banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Sebastian perteneciente al departamento de Cusco,
La socia tiene 27 aÃ±os de edad y es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 1 aÃ±o de edad; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de materiales de construcion en su ferreteria, la socia vende desde clavos, pinturas, carretillas, cemento entre otros materiales, la socia desea invertir el prestamo e la compra de materiales de construccion para implementar su ferreteria.
La socia agradece el prÃ©stamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of "MARIA AUXILIADORA", a communal bank located in San Sebastian, a district of the Cusco department.
The borrower is 27 years old, she lives with her life partner and she has a 1-year-old child. She engages in buying and selling construction materials in her ironmongerâ€™s store. She sells nails, paints, wheelbarrows, cement and other materials. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to stock up her store.
She is thankful for the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to the schedule she has agreed upon.

loan.use: To buy construction materials to stock up her store.

loan.name: Roger David

texts.es:
Roger de 24 aÃ±os, comenzÃ³ aprender musicalmente a los 7 aÃ±os. Como la familia es evangelica cristiana el comenzÃ³ a tener mucho conocimiento de mÃºsica y practicar en la iglesia que sus padres asistÃ­an.
Ahora el trabaja con uno de sus compaÃ±eros que tambiÃ©n es mÃºsico enseÃ±ando todo tipo de instrumentos y teniendo su propio estudio de grabaciÃ³n. Tiene un niÃ±o de un aÃ±o y medio que espera enseÃ±arle todo lo que Roger sabe de mÃºsica.
Para seguir avanzando con la mÃºsica el quiere un prÃ©stamo para comprar mÃ¡s instrumentos musicales y poder tener mÃ¡s alumnos en su clases como guitarras.
texts.en:
Roger is 24 years old, and he started studying music when he was 7. Coming from an Evangelical Christian family, it was in the church his parents went to that he learned a lot about music and started to practice it.
He now works with one of his friends, he himself a musician, teaching all kinds of instruments, and running their own recording studio. He has a child aged 18 months to whom he hopes to teach everything he knows about music.
In order to keep on progressing with his music he is requesting a loan to buy musical instruments such as guitars, in order to attract more students to his classes.

loan.use: To buy guitars for his music school.

loan.name: Judith Gined

texts.es: Judith Gined es una persona que se reconoce por ser muy trabajadora y muy dedicada a su familia. Desde hace algÃºn tiempo su esposo la abandonÃ³ y por tanto quedÃ³ como una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su hijo que actualmente tiene 6 aÃ±os. Judith Gined siempre habÃ­a querido aportar a los ingresos del hogar, por lo que aprendiÃ³ la actividad de la venta de mercancÃ­a y tambiÃ©n la de criar y vender cerdos. En esta segunda actividad es que se viene desempeÃ±ando desde hace aproximadamente 3 aÃ±os, y gracias a la cual genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Judith Gined tiene el gran sueÃ±o de que su hijo pueda acceder a una buena educaciÃ³n, y que ella le pueda brindar todo lo que el necesite, pues actualmente solo genera ingresos suficientes como para cubrir vagamente las necesidades bÃ¡sicas de su hijo. Judith Gined espera que su negocio siga creciendo, por lo que trabaja fuertemente todos los dÃ­as. En vÃ­speras de vender sus prÃ³ximos cerdos, Judith Gined requiere de la compra del cuido para alimentar los cerdos, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de este cuido, por lo que aspira a que un crÃ©dito le permita acceder a la compra de este cuido y seguir obteniendo los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Judith Gined espera que sus ventas aumenten en los prÃ³ximos meses, y con este dinero espera ahorrar para que su hijo pueda gozar en un futuro de una estabilidad econÃ³mica mayor a la que ella le ha podido brindar hasta ahora.
texts.en: Judith Gined is a person who is known for being hardworking and dedicated to her family. A while ago, her husband left her, so she was left to be like a single mother who is the head of her family with her son who is currently 6 years old. Judith Gined has always wanted to contribute to the family income, that is why she learned how to sell merchandise and also to raise and sell pigs. She has been doing this second activity for the approximately 3 years, and thanks to this work, she makes the necessary income to sustain her home. Judith Gined has a big dream that her son will be able to have access to a good education, and that she will be able to offer everything that he needs to him. Right now she only makes enough money to barely cover the basic needs of her son. Judith Gined hopes that her business continues to grow, which is why she works hard everyday. In hopes of selling her next pigs, Judith Gined wants to buy care to feed the pigs. However, she does not have enough money to buy this care. This is why she is hoping that a loan will allow her to buy this care and continue obtaining the necessary income to cover her household costs. Judith Gined hopes that her sales will increase in the following months, and she wants to save this money so that her son can enjoy a more financially secure future compared to the one that she has been able to offer him up until now.

loan.use: buy the necessary care to raise her pigs, so she can later sell them at a good price.

loan.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: El comitÃ© â€œMujeres Trabajadorasâ€ se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya, tiene 15 integrantes, de la zona de AsunciÃ³n; todas las integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas. Todas se esmeran esperanzadas, para poder dar a sus hijos un maÃ±ana distinto del que a ella toco vivir, formÃ¡ndolos para ser hombres y mujeres de provecho para la sociedad. Una de estas mujeres muy trabajadoras es la seÃ±ora Maria, quien nos cuenta que se dedica al reciclado de materiales. Comenta que diariamente se levante a trabajar desde muy temprano. Ella recorre por las calles juntando todo tipo de materiales que puedan ser reciclados. Ella nos cuenta que estÃ¡ muy orgullosa de lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de plÃ¡sticos, pues de esa forma al revenderlos en cantidad tiene mÃ¡s ganancias. Agradece la fundaciÃ³n por la oportunidad que le da, pues no cualquier instituciÃ³n lo harÃ­a.
texts.en:
The â€œMujeres Trabajadorasâ€ (Hard-working Women) communal bank is in their third loan cycle under the Mujeres Emprendadores (Women Entrepreneurs) program of FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya. It has 15 members from the AsunciÃ³n area. All the members are carrying out productive activities.
All are making a great effort, hoping to give their children a different future from the one that they had, and raising them to be men and women who are a benefit to society.
One of these very hard-working women is Maria, who tells us that she collects recyclable materials. She says that every day she gets up to go to work very early.
She goes through the streets collecting all types of materials that can be recycled. She tells us she is very proud of what she does, as it is respectable work, and above all, honest.
She is applying for the loan to buy plastic containers, as by selling them in quantity, she gets more earnings. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity they are giving her, as no other institution would do so.

loan.use: To buy plastic containers to sell.

loan.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es: El presente grupo se formÃ³ gracias a una de las miembros, quiÃ©n invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa ComitÃ© de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ellas son personas personas muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que siempre se esfuerzan por dar lo mejor a sus familias. La sra. Maria es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica a la costura y confiteria, esta casada con el SeÃ±or Marcial hace 23 aÃ±os quien se desempeÃ±a como constructor de obra, tienen dos hijos menores de edad y otro mayor de edad. Maria sueÃ±a con abrir una despensa dentro de su casa para lograr asi brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y demÃ¡s insumos necesarios para poder abastecer su taller de costura y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando. Agradece a la fundacion y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le estan brindando.
texts.en:
This group came together thanks to one of the members who invited and organized her friends to become part of the program Committee of Enterprising Women. They are very hardworking people who work hard to give the best to their families.
Maria is one of the members of the group. She works in sewing and makes sweets. She has been married to Marcial for 23 years. He works in construction. They have two younger children and one child who is grown. Maria dreams of opening a small grocery store in her house so that she can provide a better quality of life to her family.
She is requesting the loan to buy fabrics, threads, needles and other items necessary for stocking her sewing workshop so that she can continue working. She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that they are providing her.

loan.use: to buy fabrics, threads, needles, clasps, buttons, and other items necessary for stocking her sewing workshop

loan.name: G.s. Mujeres Organizadas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mujeres Organizadas lo conformas 3 mujeres emprendedoras que tienen sus negocios y que luchan por salir adelante con ellos, su objetivo es tener bien surtidos sus negocios ofreciÃ©ndole a sus clientes variedad de productos. Este grupo no es su primer crÃ©dito que estÃ¡ solicitando el crÃ©dito anterior era para invertir en el negocio, ellas juntas han superados muchos obstÃ¡culos, ya que tiene bien definido sus objetivos y metas que cumplir todas se apoyan para salir adelante. Matilde que tiene una pulperÃ­a que es parte de este grupo estÃ¡ solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de mercaderÃ­a para pulperÃ­a
texts.en: The solidarity group Mujeres Organizadas (Organized Women) is composed of 3 resourceful women who run their own activities and who strive to keep them running. Their goal is to have well-supplied stores, offering a variety of products to their customers. This is not the first loan for this group: the previous loan was invested in the activities, and together they have overcome many difficulties, as they have a precise idea of the aims and goals they want to achieve and they all support each other to get ahead. Matilde is a member of this group: she runs a grocery store and she is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of products for the grocery store.

loan.use: To buy products for her grocery store.

loan.name: Gotitas De Azul Group

texts.es:
Gotitas de Azul es un grupo solidario formado por 7 mujeres de la ciudad de Monterrey. Ellas son mujeres trabajadoras que iniciaron sus propios negocios para poder proveer a sus familias con un mejor futuro. Ellas se dedican a diversos oficios como a la venta de ropa, cosmÃ©ticos y algunas hasta manejan pequeÃ±as mercerÃ­as y tiendas de abarrotas.
Gelacia es la Presidenta y lÃ­der de este grupo. Ella tiene 45 aÃ±os y esta casada. Tiene tres hijos de 24, 20 y 15 aÃ±os de edad de los cuales dos continuan estudiando y uno ya se encuentra trabajando. Desde hace varios aÃ±os, Gelacia se decidiÃ³ a poner un pequeÃ±o negocio de abarrotes en su casa que poco a poco ha ido creciendo.
Ella decidiÃ³ pedir este crÃ©dito porque esta convencida de que invirtiendo este dinero en su negocio podrÃ­a ofrecerle a sus clientes una variedad mÃ¡s amplia de productos, con lo cual sus ganancias se incrementarÃ¡n y su negocio podrÃ¡ seguir elevandose.
texts.en:
Gotitas de Azul is a group made up of 7 women in the city of Monterrey. They are hard working women who started their own businesses to provide their families with a better future. They have different businesses such as clothing sales and cosmetics. Some even have notions stores and small groceries.
Gelacia is the President and leader of this group. She is 45 years old and married. She has three children, ages 24, 20 and 15. Two are still in school and one is working. Some years ago, Gelacia decided to open a small grocery store in her home and it has grown bit by bit.
She is requesting this loan because she believes that investing this money in her business will enable her to offer her customers a wider variety of products, which will increase her profits and continue to improve her business.

loan.use: to stock her grocery store.

loan.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es: El comitÃ© Virgen del Pilar es de la ciudad de Pilar, todas ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo luchadoras. Las miembros trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sr. Severiana quien se dedica a la venta comidas y remedios yuyos. Ella nos comenta que mediante este negocio su economÃ­a pudo mejorar ya que ella mantiene su casa. SegÃºn la Sra. Severiana (Ã‘a Tana) como la llaman de cariÃ±o las compaÃ±eras , mencionÃ³ que las actividades que realizan con la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya es muy importante ya que mediante ella pudieron desarrollar sus capacidades de trabajo y autoestima. Ella soliciata el crÃ©dito para la compra de carne, condimentos, hortalizas y demÃ¡s insumos con los cuales prepara sus comidas.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Pilar committee is located in the city of Pilar. All of the women are very hardworking and fighters. The members work together in solidarity in this program.
A very moving story is that of Severiana who sells meals and natural remedies. She tells us that through this business she has improved her finances so she can maintain her household. According to Severiana, Ã‘a Tana, as her friends call her, her activities with FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya are very important because she can develop her business skills and self-esteem.
She is requesting a loan to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients to prepare meals.

loan.use: to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables, and other ingredients.

loan.name: Las Merceditas Group

texts.es: El comitÃ© Las Merceditas se conformÃ³ en el aÃ±o 2008, con mucho esfuerzo ya se encuentran en el 7 ciclo, gracias a su trabajo en equipo y la coordinaciÃ³n de sus trabajos. La Sr. Luisa es una de las miembros ella se dedica a la venta de sÃ¡banas , de comida y pescados , como se puede ver ella es una seÃ±or amuy dinÃ¡mica y trabajadora, hace todo lo posible por poder ayudar a su familia y darles una vida digna. Ella empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas del dÃ­a hasta muy tarde en la noche. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de sabanas de diferentes materiales, con lo cual podrÃ¡ surtirse y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Agradece a la fundaciÃ³n y a Kiva por la oportunidad que estÃ¡ recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Merceditas committee was founded in 2008 with a lot of effort. Thanks to their team work and coordination, they are now in their seventh loan cycle.
Luisa is one of the committee's members. Her business is selling sheets, food and fish. As you can see, she is a very dynamic and hard-working woman who does everything she can to help her family and provide them with a decent life. She starts working very early in the morning and keeps going until very late at night.
Luisa is requesting a loan to buy sheets in different materials. This will enable her to stock her business and fill the orders that she has. She is grateful to FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loan.use: to buy sheets to sell

loan.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es: Sonia tiene 38 aÃ±os de edad es casada con 02 hijos en etapa escolar. En el transcurso de su vida Sonia se ha dedicado a diversas actividades comerciales para salir adelante como a la venta de calzados y de ropas. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de bebidas como agua mineral, gaseosas, entre otros. Este negocio naciÃ³ con la idea de obtener mayores ganancias y de esa manera seguir apoyando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. A futuro a Sonia le gustarÃ­a poner unas cabinas de internet, la cual lo pueda alquilar, pues asÃ­ asegura tendrÃ¡ mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicito el crÃ©dito para la compra de bebidas como gaseosas y agua, y tambiÃ©n para algunos gastos familiares. Sonia agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en: Sonia is 38 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. Over the course of her life, Sonia has worked in a number of different sales activities in order to get ahead, such as selling shoes and clothes. She currently sells drinks such as mineral water, soda, etc. She started this business with the idea of making more profits and thereby being able to continue supporting her husband with the household expenses. In the future, Sonia would like to set up some Internet terminals which she will be able to charge people to use. This will make her more profits. On this occasion, she requested her loan to buy drinks such as soda and water. She will also cover some family expenses. Sonia is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people like her.

loan.use: to buy soda and water

loan.name: Mujeres Al Triunfo 3 Group

texts.en:
Constancia is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres al triunfo 3 (Women to victory). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. She is a widow. She says that her biggest challenge was to raise her children after her husband died. She had to take care of everything, house, family and income. This is her 4th loan with Esperanza.
Constancia has had her business for almost five years. Using some savings and taking loans from other places. She started selling some grocery products from a small stall in her house. Now she has a colmado, a grocery store located in the neighborhood, where more of the neighbors buy their daily meals. Constancia will invest in her business by purchasing rice, beans, sugar, canned food, flour, and other goods. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business.
Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo and is composed of 5 people.

loan.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, canned food, flour, and other goods

loan.name: KuÃ±a Katupyry Group

texts.es: El comitÃ© â€œKuÃ±a Katupyry es un grupo mÃ¡s del programa ComitÃ© de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya. Son de la ciudad de Villa Ygatimi. El grupo empezÃ³, demostrando uniÃ³n y solidaridad entre ellas. En este grupo 6 de las integrantes son indÃ­genas que nunca tuvieron acceso a crÃ©ditos en otras entidades. Una de las miembros es la seÃ±ora Serafina, quien se dedica a la crÃ­a de animales, como ser cerdos y gallinas. Ella es una mujer de escasos recursos, pero muy trabajadora. Su sueÃ±o es poder tener una granja donde criar mas animales y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de pollitos y cerdos para la crÃ­a, ya que quiere poder crecer y tener mÃ¡s animales, que dentro de un tiempo le generaran una buena ganancia.
texts.en:
The 'KuÃ±a Katupyry' committee is another group from FundaciÃ³n Paraguaya's 'Entrepreneurial Women' program. They are from the town of Villa Ygatimi. Since the group started out, they have demonstrated unity and solidarity. Six of the group's members are indigenous people who never had access to loans from other companies.
One of the members of this group is Serafina who raises animals such as pigs and hens. She is a woman of limited financial resources but she is very hard-working. Her dream is to own a farm where she can raise more animals and thereby continue helping her family.
Serafina is requesting a loan to buy chicks and pigs to raise as she would like to be able to grow her business and have more animals which will make her good profits.

loan.use: to buy pigs to raise

loan.name: KuÃ±a Guapa Group

texts.es: KuÃ±a Guapa es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Luque, se unieron con la esperanza de un futuro mejor para sus familias. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras que dÃ­a a dÃ­a se esfuerzan por seguir creciendo no solo en lo econÃ³mico sino tambiÃ©n en lo personal. Florinda es una de estas mujeres, ella se dedica a la venta de lencerÃ­as de todo tipo, tanto de hombres como para mujeres.Comenta que gracias a la buena calidad de los productos, y sumado a los buenos precios que tiene, ha podido formarse ya una buena clientela. Este trabajo la ha ayudado a salir adelante y a mantener el dÃ­a a dÃ­a de su hogar. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de lencerÃ­as, con lo cual podrÃ¡ surtirse para tener una mayor cantidad de prendas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
KuÃ±a Guapa is the name of the group formed in the city of Luque. They got together in the hope of a better future for their families. They are very hardworking people who work day to day to keep growing, not only financially but personally.
Florinda is one of these women. She sells underwear of all types, for women and for men. She remarks that thanks to the good quality of the products, together with the prices she has, she has been able to form a good clientele. This job has helped her get ahead and support her home day to day.
She is asking for the loan to buy underwear to be able to stock up and have a larger quantity of items to offer her customers.

loan.use: to buy underwear to later sell

loan.name: KuÃ±a Joaju Group

texts.es: El comitÃ© KuÃ±a Joaju tiene el total de 10 integrantes, todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, de escasos recursos que formaron su grupo entre vecinas y amigas, actualmente ya estÃ¡n en el tercer ciclo. Irene es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la crÃ­a de animales, como ser pollos y chanchos. Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que requiere de mucho esfuerzo, no solo fÃ­sico, sino tambiÃ©n mental. Debe de estar pendiente las 24 hs. De los animales que tiene para que no les pase nada. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y con eso poder seguir ayudando a su familia. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de cerdos pequeÃ±os y alimentos para estos y los demÃ¡s animales que tiene. Agradece a la fundaciÃ³n y a kiva por la oportunidad que estÃ¡n recibiendo, pues muchas de ellas en otras instituciones jamÃ¡s la habrÃ­an recibido.
texts.en:
The KuÃ±a Joaju committee has a total of 10 members. All of them are very hardworking and enterprising women with few resources. They started the group among neighbors and friends, and now they are in their third cycle.
Irene is one of the members. She raises animals such as chickens and pigs. She remarks that her work is very hard, since it requires a lot of physical and mental effort. She has to be on call 24 hours a day so nothing will happen to her animals. Her goal is to keep working and thus keep being able to help her family.
She is asking for the loan to buy small pigs and feed for them and the other animals she has. She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving, as many of them wouldn't have received these opportunities in other institutions.

loan.use: to buy small pigs to raise and also to buy feed for the animals.

loan.name: Primitiva Susy

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Primitiva tiene su tienda de barrio en la zona de Alto Llojeta, en su tienda vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad y tambiÃ©n vende toda clase de juguetes refrescos y variedad de productos, ya que tiene un atienda muy surtida, tiene una hija que se encuentra estudiando, es separada ya no vive con su esposo hace aÃ±os, ella sola mantiene a su hija se encarga de sus educaciÃ³n y de los gastos de su hogar, siempre trabajo con ese negocio de la tienda de barrio, el crÃ©dito serÃ¡ destinado para compra de mercaderÃ­a para seguir surtiendo su tienda ya que las fiestas de fin de aÃ±o tiene mucha venta y de esta manera quiere ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientela, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Primitiva has her local store in the area of Alto Llojeta. She sells a variety of everyday products along with toys, beverages, and other products in her well-stocked store. She has a daughter who currently studies. Primitiva separated from her husband a few years ago. She is solely responsible for the well-being of her daughter, her education, and their house expenses. She's always worked in her local store business.
The loan will be used to buy merchandise to continue stocking her store because she sells a lot during the end-of-year celebrations. With the new merchandise, she will be able to offer product variety to her customers. She is thankful for the opportunity to continue growing her business.

loan.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy plastic packaging

loan.name: KuÃ±y Aty Pyahu Mbaapora Group

texts.es: KuÃ±y Aty Pyahu Mbaapora es el grupo formado por 11 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Ellas se unieron con el propÃ³sito de trabajar juntas y por medio de este trabajo poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Su meta principal es poder mejorar el estilo de vida de sus hijos y darles un futuro mejor al que ellas tuvieron. Un ejemplo de lucha es Pablina, quien trabaja en la crÃ­a de animales, cuenta que su trabajo es muy agotador, pero que pese a ello no se cansa, pues sabe que por medio de su sacrificio estÃ¡ ayudando a su familia. Desea crecer con su trabajo y el dÃ­a de maÃ±ana poder tener una granja con muchos animales. Ella solicita el crÃ©dito para la compra de pollitos, patitos para la crÃ­a, ya que desea tener mÃ¡s animales. Agradece a la fundaciÃ³n y a kiva por la oportunidad que estÃ¡ recibiendo.
texts.en:
KuÃ±y Aty Pyahu Mbaapora is the group formed by 11 women in the city of Curuguaty. They got together with the goal of working together and through this work being able to help each other. Their principal goal is to be able to improve their children's lifestyle and give them a better future than the one they had.
Pablina, who works raising animals, is an example of struggle. She says her work is very exhausting, but despite this she never tires because she knows that through her sacrifice she is helping her family. She wants to grow with her work and in the future be able to have a farm with lots of animals.
She is requesting the loan to buy young chickens and ducks to raise because she wants to have more animals. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she is getting.

loan.use: to buy young chickens and ducks to raise and sell.

loan.name: Darwin Oswaldo

texts.es:
