Gracias al apoyo que le a brindado Afodenic Atraves de los fondo Kiva su negocio a crecido y ahora se sustenta el propio negocio .Ella necesita un financiamiento para mejorar de su humilde vivienda ya que si ella invierte el dinero de la su negocio se quedarÃ­a sin capital de trabajo , lo cual solicita c$ 5,000.00 para comprar piedras , hierro y cemento para iniciar a construir y quitar esas laminas de zinc que le han servido durante muchos aÃ±os como refugio .
texts.en: SeÃ±ora Josefa is a businesswoman with a little store where she sells groceries, soft drinks, candies, and fast food, among other products. Thanks to the support that Afodenic offers her through Kiva funds, her business has grown, and now her own business sustains itself. She needs a loan to improve her humble residence, since if she invests the money from her business, she will be without working capital. She is applying for a loan of 5000 CÃ³rdobas to buy stones, iron, and cement to begin the construction and to do away with the zinc sheets that have served her for many years as a shelter.

loan.use: to buy construction materials

loan.name: Faaolo

texts.en:
"Faaolo is forty five years old and is married. She has seven children. Faaolo owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Faaolo needs a loan of WST $1,500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to supplement her family's income.
In 2009, Faaolo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Faaolo's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loan.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga is 30 years old. She is married and has three children.
Aiga owns and operates a business venture, raising pigs to sell. She has three years of experience in this business. Aiga is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 WST to purchase additional small piggies to raise and to buy animal feeds such as manure. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas per week) to improve and/or expand the business.
In 2009, Aiga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Aiga's second loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase additional small piggies to raise and animal feeds such as manure

loan.name: Ena

texts.en:
Ena is 21 years of old. She is married and has one child.
Ena owns and operates a business venture, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Ena is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 WST to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST or $125 per week) to improve and/or expand the business.
In 2011, Ena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Ena's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loan.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Don Pedro, es un humilde agricultor de zona de Ticuantepe, durante muchÃ­simos aÃ±os se ha dedicado al cultivo de piÃ±a, la mayor afectaciÃ³n que se le presento fue causa de los desastres naturales, lo cual de tanto lluvia el cultivo se perdiÃ³ gran totalidad, en estos momentos no cuenta con capital para poder salvar lo poco que se salvo y necesita abono, herbicidas y otros productos necesarios para la inducciÃ³n. Su esposa es comerciante de frutas y verduras en un mercado de capital , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar siempre en sus estudio a su hijo menor .
texts.en: Pedro is a humble farmer who lives in the area of Ticuantepe. For many years he has made a living growing pineapple. The thing which has affected him most recently has been natural disasters; because of so much rain he lost most of his crop. Now he doesn't have enough capital to be able to purchase fertilizer, herbicides and other products that will allow him to save what little crop he has left. His wife sells fruits and vegetables in a market in the capital. His plans for his family are to improve their quality of life and as always support his youngest son in his studies.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and other products for the care of his pineapple crop.

loan.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 18 aÃ±os es un mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora. Convive con su pareja con quien tiene una hija llamada Ros de 2 aÃ±os. Juntos habitan en su casa propia desde donde a diario comparte con su familia la alegrÃ­a de dar educaciÃ³n y mejor calidad de vida a su hija. El trabajo de Yolanda consiste en la venta de comida, desde muy temprano comienza con su labor cuando se va al mercado en busca de los mejores productos para poder preparar sus platillos. A partir de las 4 de la tarde comienza su venta en la vereda de su casa, ofrece solo platos regionales. Hace ya tres aÃ±os que comenzÃ³ con este negocio el cual ahora le permite tener sus propios ingresos y asÃ­ colabora en la economÃ­a de su hogar. Al principio tuvo que aprender bien con muchos errores pero ahora con la experiencia ganada le va mucho mejor, espera poder seguir progresando y saliendo adelante para asÃ­ poder ver crecer su negocio. Este serÃ¡ el crÃ©dito nÃºmero 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboraciÃ³n para continuar con sus objetivos, ademÃ¡s esta muy comprometida en pagar una vez mas con las cutoas a tiempo y de manera responsable. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprarÃ¡ ingredientes para continuar con su venta diaria, ademÃ¡s comprarÃ¡ algunos materiales para mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
texts.en:
18-year-old Yolanda is a nice, friendly and very hard-working young woman. She lives with her partner and the couple have a 2-year-old daughter called Ros. They live together in their own home and every day Yolanda shares with her family the joy of providing her daughter with an education and a better quality of life. Yolanda's business is selling food. She works from very early in the morning, going to the market to find the best produce with which to prepare her meals. At 4.00pm she starts selling from the sidewalk outside her house. She offers her customers regional dishes. She started this business three years ago and it now enables her to make her own income and contribute financially towards her household expenses. At first she had to learn through her mistakes but she has gained experience and now things are going much better. She hopes to be able to continue making progress and getting ahead so that she can grow her business.
This will be Yolanda's second loan from MFP. She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals. She is very committed, once again, to making her repayments on time, in a responsible manner. She will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy ingredients so that she can continue making her daily sales. She will also buy some materials to improve the infrastructure of her sales location.

loan.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food and to buy materials to improve the infrastructure of her business

loan.name: Ake

texts.en:
Ake is 57 years old. She is married and has six children.
Ake owns and operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish. She has three years of experience in this business. Ake is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 WST to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 WST or $146 per week) to improve and/or expand the business.
Ake joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Ake's second loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loan.name: Arquimides

texts.es: Arquimides, de 49 aÃ±os, es un hombre bueno y trabajador, estÃ¡ casado con MarÃ­a de 51 aÃ±os con quien tiene cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro ya son mayores e independientes, y solo Carolina de 15 aÃ±os vive a su lado. Juntos habian en su casa propia, en donde trabaja mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Arquimides consiste en la agricultura, sembrando plÃ¡tano, arroz, yuca y otros, para ello posee una chacra propia en donde labra la tierra y lo prepara para tener los mejores frutos y productos en la temporada de cosecha. Lleva 15 aÃ±os trabajando con este negocio y aÃºn recuerda que al principio padeciÃ³ mucho al iniciar su negocio ya que necesitaba de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, al final lo logrÃ³ y siente que es mucho mejor trabajar de manera independiente que hacerlo para otros como lo hacia antes. En los momentos que va a su chacra tiene la ayuda de algunas personas que contrata y de otras que lo ayudan de manera incondiocinal por lo cual se siente muy agradecido. Ahora se preparara para realizar nuevos proyectos y asÃ­ agrandar poco a poco su chacra. Este serÃ¡ el crÃ©dito nÃºmero 13 con MFP, Por tanto espera de su colaboraciÃ³n, para continuar con sus objetivos. AdemÃ¡s se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores crÃ©ditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado comprarÃ¡ abono, para fertilizar sus tierras, ademÃ¡s de comprar palos de yuca para poder sembrar y asÃ­ iniciar con una nueva producciÃ³n.
texts.en:
49-year-old Arquimides is a kind, hard-working man. He is married to 51-year-old MarÃ­a and has five children, four of whom are grown up and live independently. Only 15-year-old Carolina still lives with them. The family live together in their own home and Arquimides works hard to provide them with a better quality of life. Arquimides' business is farming. He grows bananas, rice, cassava and other crops. He owns his own farm where he works the soil and prepares it well so that he can obtain better fruit and produce at harvest time. He has been in this business for 15 years and he still recalls that he suffered a lot when he first started his business because he needed to put in a lot of effort and hard work. Eventually he was successful and he feels that it is much better to work for yourself than to work for other people as he did in the past. When he works on his farm, Arquimides has the help of people that he hires and others who help him unconditionally, for which he is very grateful. He is preparing to carry out new projects and gradually expand his farm.
This will be Arquimides' 13th loan from MFP. He hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can continue achieving his goals. He pledges, once again, to make his repayments on time as he has done with his previous loans. He will use the sum that he has requested to buy manure, to fertilize his land. He will also buy cassava root so that he can sow his crops and thereby start a new production cycle.

loan.use: to buy cassava root and sacks of fertilizer

loan.name: Siatunuu

texts.en:
Siatunuu is 22 years old. She is married and has two children.
Siatunuu owns and operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean-caught fish. She has two years of experience in this business. Siatunuu is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 WST to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 WST or $125 per week) to improve and/or expand the business.
In 2011, Siatunuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Siatunuu's first loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loan.name: Darwin

texts.es: Darwin, de 36 aÃ±os, es un hombre que le gusta mucho estar a lado de su familia y trabajar mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad vida, es padre de tres hijos Robinson de 15, Rubi de 8 y Gisel de 4. JUntos habitan en su casa propia en donde tambiÃ©n comparte su vida a lado de su esposa Nelly de 25 aÃ±os. Darwin es un hombre que le gusta mucho ser precavido y en su trabajo es importante tener siempre calma y sobre todo buen tino para hacer las cosas. Pues Ã©l se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y algunas cargas dentro y fuera de la ciudad. Tiene una mototaxi que pudo comprarse en base a esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio ya que antes tenÃ­a que alquilar y asÃ­ no le dejaba mucha ganancia. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 15 aÃ±os y en todo ese tiempo ganÃ³ mucha experiencia y ademÃ¡s aprendiÃ³ que el cliente siempre tienes que llevarlo con paciencia sobre todo con mucha seguridad. Le esta yendo muy bien en lo que hace, tiene muchas personas que lo contratan a veces por horas enteras para transportarlos y asÃ­ obtiene mÃ¡s ganancias, ahora se esta preparando para poder incrementar su trabajo y comprar una mototaxi mÃ¡s para alquilarlo y tener un ingreso adicional. Este serÃ¡ el crÃ©dito nÃºmero 4 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboraciÃ³n para continuar con sus objetivos, ademÃ¡s se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en crÃ©ditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, lo utilizarÃ¡ para poder refaccionar algunas piezas de su mototaxi que por el tiempo y el mal estado de la calles se empezaron a deteriorar.
texts.en:
Darwin, who is 36 years old, is a man who likes to spend time with his family and works hard to be able to provide them with a better quality of life. He is the father of three children: Robinson (15 years old), Rubi (8 years old) and Gisel (4 years old). He lives in his own home with his children and his wife Nelly, who is 25 years old.
Darwin is a man that likes to be cautious and in his work it is important to always be calm and above all have good sense to do things. He makes a living transporting passengers and deliveries inside and outside the city. He has a moto taxi that he was able to buy due to hard work and much sacrifice. Before he was renting a moto taxi and was not left with much profit. He has been in this line of work for 15 years and in all of this time he has gained much experience and has learned that he needs to transport each customer with patience and above all safety.
He is doing well in what he does. He has many customers that hire him to transport them for hours at a time, which gives him more profits. Now he is preparing to be able to increase his business and buy another moto taxi to rent out and have an additional source of income. This is the 4th loan that he has taken out through MFP. It is his hope that with continued support he will be able to continue with his goals. He promises to make his payments on time as he has done with previous loans. With the amount of 1000 soles he will use the money to repair some parts on his moto taxi that as a result of the weather and the bad condition of roads have begun to deteriorate.

loan.use: to pay a mechanic to fix parts on his moto taxi.

loan.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa is 59 years old. She is married and has seven children.
Sa owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro to sell. She has three years of experience in this business. Sa is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 WST to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST or $188 per week) to make improvements to her house.
Sa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Sa's fourth loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives.

loan.name: Tuisfolau

texts.en:
Tusifolau is sixty years old. She is married and has 7 children.
Tusifolau owns & operates a business venture, which involves planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Tusifolau needs a loan of WST 1,000 (Talas) to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 Talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.
Tusifolau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tusifolau's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loan.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is fifty years of age and is married with 7 children.
Salome owns and operates a business venture, which involves planting and harvesting kava plants for sale. She has 4 years of experience in this business. Salome needs a loan of WST 1,500 (Talas) to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 Talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.
Salome joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Salome's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops

loan.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is thirty-six years of age and is married with four children. She sells a variety of different products to the local community and has five years of experience doing so.
Lesina joined SPBD to gain access to its financial services. (Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.) This is her third loan with SPBD.
Lesina needs a loan of 2,000 WST to purchase freezer goods or meat such as mutton flaps, chicken, and sausages to sell. She plans to use the profits which are estimated to be 600 talas per week to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase freezer goods or meat such as mutton flaps, chicken, sausages to sell.

loan.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita es una mujer muy trabajadora, a sus 66 aÃ±os ella se siente muy joven y con mucha fuerza y salud para seguir trabajando y seguir adelante, ella vive en la ciudad de nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima calido y por la majestuosas lineas de nazca por la cual la ciudad recibe gran cantidad de turistas durante todo el aÃ±o, Felicita es madre de 8 hijos los cuales ya son mayores y estan casados, asi mismo como buena peruana el platillo que mas le agrada es el riquisimo "Lomo Saltado", Felicita solo estudio hasta el quinto aÃ±o de educacion secundaria ya que sus padre no tenian muchos recursos economicos pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Secretariado.
Felicita trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, al cual le dedica 12 horas diarias, 12 horas a las cuales le pone mucho empeÃ±o para vender sus productos,en un dia puede atender hasta 30 clientes y es que Felicita cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trata a los clientes con mucho cariÃ±o y sobre todo porque se trata a los demas como quisieramos que nos traten.
Felicita esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda mrindada ella podra comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida y obtener mayores ingresos para poder seguir ahorrando y poder realizar su mas grande sueÃ±o:"Tener una bodega mucho mas grande y exitosa"
texts.en:
Felicita is a very hardworking woman. At 66 years old she feels very young, with the strength and health to continue working and getting ahead. She lives in the city of Nazca, which has a warm climate and the majestic Lineas de Nazca that bring in a great amount of tourists during the entire year.
Felicita is the mother of 8 children who are already grown and are married. As a good Peruvian her favorite dish is the very tasty â€œLomo Saltado.â€ Felicita only studied until the 5th year of secondary school since her parents didnâ€™t have a lot of money, but she would have liked to study in a secretarial course.
Felicita works in her grocery selling business which she does for 12 hours each day, 12 hours during which she works hard to sell her products. In one day she can have about 30 customers. Felicita believes that things are going well in her business because she treats her customers with a lot of care and above all because she treats others how she would like to be treated.
Felicita is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help provided she can buy more merchandise for her business and with that improve her quality of life and get more income to be able to keep on saving and realize her biggest dream: â€œto have a much bigger and more successful store.â€

loan.use: to buy merchandise (groceries)

loan.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El seÃ±or Juan JosÃ© aÃ±os se dedica al transporte escolar desde hace 13 aÃ±os, trasladando a niÃ±os de preescolar, primaria y secundaria en turno matutino y vespertino para esto el tiene varias unidades en la que una maneja el y sus empleados. Para Juan JosÃ© es muy importante tener en perfectas condiciones los camiones ya que de esta manera podrÃ¡ llevar a los alumnos con bien a sus casas. En este momento el quiere comprar una nueva unidad para sustituirla por otra que le estÃ¡ fallando de esta manera podrÃ¡ ofrecer un mejor servicio. Este negocio es de suma importancia ya que es su Ãºnica fuente de ingresos para sostener los gastos de la familia.
texts.en: Juan JosÃ© has provided school transportation for 13 years, bringing kids to preschool, elementary school, and high school in the morning and evening. To do this he has various vehicles that he and his employees operate. To Juan JosÃ© itâ€™s very important to have the vans in perfect condition so he can bring the students to their homes safely. Right now he wants to buy a new vehicle to substitute for another that isnâ€™t working, and in that way he will be able to offer a better service. This business is very importance since itâ€™s his only income stream to pay for the family expenses.

loan.use: to buy a van.

loan.name: Livia Adelina

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora. Livia es socio del Banco comunal UniÃ³n y Prosperidad, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza, su Iglesia se encuentra ubicada en el Centro Parroquial y posee mÃ¡s de doscientos aÃ±os de antigÃ¼edad, la Laguna de Tari se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a unos 5 kilÃ³metros del Centro Parroquial. Su gente es amable, responsable, y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La SeÃ±ora Livia tiene 26 aÃ±os, es madre soltera de un niÃ±o de 6 aÃ±os de edad que estÃ¡ estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
Ella trabaja hace 8 aÃ±os como empleada domestica, labora de lunes a viernes todo el dÃ­a, en su casa se dedica a la crÃ­a de chanchos.
Se encuentra en su segundo crÃ©dito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos.
Su sueÃ±o es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Livia is a member of the UniÃ³n y Prosperidad Communal Bank. She lives in the parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca, where the beauty of nature is everywhere. Her church is located in the Parochial Center and it is more than 200 years old. Tari Lagoon is about 5km from the Parochial Center. Its people are kind, responsible, and keep the cultural and traditions of their people alive.
Livia is 26 years old. She is a single mother with a six-year-old son who attends kindergarten in the city. She doesn't have her own home, so she lives with her parents and shares the household expenses.
She has worked as a housekeeper for eight years. She works all day Monday through Friday and at home she raises pigs.
This is the second loan she is taking out with her communal bank and she is going to use it to buy pigs.
Her dream is to own her own home.

loan.use: to buy pigs

loan.name: MarÃ­a Flora

texts.es:
La SeÃ±ora. MarÃ­a es socio del Banco comunal UniÃ³n y Prosperidad, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar la belleza de la naturaleza, su Iglesia se encuentra ubicada en el Centro Parroquial y posee mÃ¡s de doscientos aÃ±os de antigÃ¼edad, la Laguna de Tari, se encuentra ubicada aproximadamente a unos 5 kilÃ³metros del Centro Parroquial. Su gente es amable, responsable, y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
La SeÃ±ora. MarÃ­a tiene 25 aÃ±os, es casada y fruto de su uniÃ³n conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 9, 7, 6 y 3 aÃ±os de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estÃ¡n estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es aserrador, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
DoÃ±a MarÃ­a labora en una guarderÃ­a, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la maÃ±ana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
Ella estÃ¡ repitiendo el crÃ©dito ya que va a comprar un bosque para el negocio de su esposo, con el crÃ©dito anterior no tuvo ningÃºn problema con los pagos y ya realizo la cancelaciÃ³n total del mismo. EstÃ¡ muy contenta ya que con el crÃ©dito a podido aportar a la economÃ­a de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia.
Le gusta el banco comunal por la facilidad para conseguir los crÃ©ditos y el compaÃ±erismo que hay entre sus compaÃ±eras.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "UniÃ³n y Prosperidad" communal bank, and lives in Zhidmad parish in Cuenca. This is a place where one can admire the beauty of nature. Its church is located in the parish center, and is more than 200 years old. The Laguna de Teri is located approximately five kilometers from the parish center. The people here are friendly, responsible, and maintain the culture and traditions of their peoples.
MarÃ­a is 25, married, and has four children, ages 9, 7, 6, and 3. Her three eldest children go to a small local school. Her husband has a lumber business, and they own the house where they live.
Maria works in a daycare, Monday to Friday, from 8:00 in the morning, until 4:00 in the afternoon. She is taking out another loan to buy a woodlot for her husband's business. She had no problem with the payments on the previous loan, and has already paid it back in full.
She is very happy, because with the loan she has been able to contribute to the household finances, and support her family. She likes the communal bank because it is easy to get loans, and for the comradeship that exists among the members.

loan.use: to buy a woodlot.

loan.name: Rocio Elizabeth

texts.es: RociÃ³ Elizabeth de 47 aÃ±os es divorciada tiene 4 hijos, trabaja en maquiladora como operadora en lÃ­nea haciendo arneses para automÃ³viles desde hace un aÃ±o. Esto con el fin de ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, aparte una de sus hijas que es la mayor aporta dinero para ayudarla con los gastos del hogar. Para RociÃ³ es muy importante tener su casa en buenas condiciones ya que es el patrimonio que les puede ofrecer a sus hijos. La casa es de interÃ©s social y ya hace varios aÃ±os que no le ha hecho mejoras por lo que en algunas de las paredes ya se ven manchadas por la humedad, por tal motivo quiere comprar pintura, brochas para pintarla y que se vea bien.
texts.en:
RociÃ³ Elizabeth is 47, divorced, and has four children. She has been working for a year in a maquiladora (assembly plant), as a line operator making automobile harnesses.
She does this with the aim of providing her children with a better quality of life. In addition, one of her daughters, who is the eldest, contributes money to help her with the household expenses.
For RocÃ­o, it is very important to have a house in good condition, because it is the legacy she can give her children. She lives in subsidized housing, and improvements have not been done for several years; so on some of the walls you can now see moisture stains. For this reason, she wants to buy paint and paintbrushes, so that she can paint it and have it look good.

loan.use: To buy painting supplies.

loan.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de 64 aÃ±os es una mujer muy trabajadora es viuda y vive con alguno de sus hijos, la mayor parte del dÃ­a se la pasa en su trabajo que se trata de elaborar pasteles de diferente estilos y sabores, desde hace 21 aÃ±os, aparte recibe pensiÃ³n por viudez el cual le ayuda a cubrir todos sus gastos. En este momento quiere un prÃ©stamo para comprar pintura y remodelar su casa por dentro ya que con las inclemencias del tiempo las paredes estÃ¡n muy daÃ±adas por lo que quiere preparase antes de que se deterioren aun mas.
texts.en:
Virginia is 64, and a very hard-working woman. She is a widow, and lives with one of her children.
She spends most of her day at her work, making cakes of different designs and flavors, which she has been doing for 21 years. Apart from this, she gets a widow's pension, which helps her cover all her expenses.
At this time, she wants a loan to buy paint and remodel her home on the inside, as with the inclement weather, the walls are quite damaged, so she wants to take steps before they deteriorate even more.

loan.use: To buy paint for her house.

loan.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Ana Cristina es una joven de 22 aÃ±os muy carismÃ¡tica y sobre todo trabajadora, es madre de un hermoso pequeÃ±o de 3 aÃ±itos y junto a su pareja viven en la ciudad de Chincha, ella trabaja muy duro dÃ­a a dÃ­a para poder solventar a su pequeÃ±o y darle lo que el necesita, en el poco tiempo libre que ella dispone trata de darle mucho cariÃ±o a su bebe, junto a su pareja, Ana Cristina solo estudio hasta quinto grado de secundaria, debido a que sus padres no tenÃ­an los medios econÃ³micos necesarios, como buena peruana le gusta mucho nuestra comida, pero el paltillo que mas le agrada es la riquisima "Carapulcra"
Ana Cristina trabaja en la venta de ropa, trabaja 8 horas diarias y atiende alrededor de 20 clientes, en ocasiones cuando no tiene quien pueda cuidar de su pequeÃ±o mientras trabaja ella, lo lleva junto a ella a donde valla, ya que su esposo la apoya trabajando como chofer de una mototaxi, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene la mejor motivaciÃ³n que cualquier persona pueda tener, su Hijo ya que por el darÃ­a la vida y por el es que se sacrifica tanto por salir adelante para que nada le falte.
Ana Cristina estÃ¡ muy feliz y agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella podrÃ¡ comprar mucha mÃ¡s mercaderÃ­a (ropa), con ello mejorara sus ingresos y asÃ­ podrÃ¡ seguir ahorrando para poder realizar su gran sueÃ±o: â€œDarle una profesiÃ³n a su pequeÃ±oâ€
texts.en:
Ana Cristina is a 22-year-old young lady who is charismatic and, above all, hardworking. She is the mother a beautiful three-year-old little boy and she lives with her partner in the city of Chincha. She works very hard day after day to make money for her little one and to give him what he needs. In the little free time she has, she and her partner try to give her son a lot of attention. Ana Cristina only studied up until the fifth grade because her parents didn't have enough money. Like every good Peruvian, she likes the national cuisine a lot, but her favorite dish is the delicious carapulca.
Ana Cristina sells clothing for a living. She works eight hours a day and sees about 20 customers. Sometimes, when she doesn't have anyone to watch her little boy while she works, she takes him with her wherever she goes, since her partner supports her by working as a mototaxi driver. She thinks her business is doing well because she has the best possible motivation, her son, because she would give her life for him and he's the reason she sacrifices so much to get ahead--so that he won't be lacking for anything.
Ana Cristina is very happy and thanks Kiva's lenders because it's thanks to their help that she will be able to buy much more merchandise (clothing). This will improve her earnings and she will be able to keep saving to achieve her greatest dream, which is to offer her little boy a profession.

loan.use: to buy more merchandise (summer clothing)

loan.name: Carlos

texts.es: El seÃ±or Carlos de 33 aÃ±os solicita un prÃ©stamo para impermeabilizar el techo de su casa; porque en las temporadas de lluvias el agua se trasmina por consecuencia el techo se estÃ¡ deteriorando. Carlos quiere prevenir que el problema se agrave y tenga que gastar mÃ¡s de lo previsto. Para poder cubrir los gastos Ã©l y su esposa trabajan en maquiladora de lunes a viernes. Para que pueda realizar su proyecto necesita comprar impermeabilizante para que su casa este mejor protegida en los cambios climÃ¡ticos.
texts.en: Thirty-three-year old Carlos is asking for a loan to waterproof the roof of his home because during the rainy season the water seeps through and it's causing the roof to deteriorate. Carlos wants to keep the problem from getting serious so he doesn't have to spend more than he anticipated. He and his wife work at an assembly plant Monday through Friday to cover their expenses. In order to complete this project, he has to buy waterproofing so his home will be better protected from changes in climate.

loan.use: to buy waterproofing

loan.name: Riza Mae

texts.en:
Riza Mae is twenty years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. For the past two years Riza Mae has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Riza Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more stocks of food for her shop. She hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy more stocks of food for her shop.

loan.name: Oscar

texts.es: El seÃ±or Oscar de 30 aÃ±os es casado y padre de familia, hace 6 adquiriÃ³ su casa de interÃ©s social que es muy pequeÃ±a, con ahorros fue levantando las paredes de una recamara para ampliarla pero por falta de capital aun no lo ha terminado por tal motivo quiere un prÃ©stamo para terminar de levantar las paredes y poner techo y ya comenzar habitarlo. Para poder realizar su proyecto necesita comprar block, cemento, arena y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Thirty-year-old Oscar is married and he is head of his household. Six years ago he got his very small house through public assistance and with his savings he has been putting up the walls for a new bedroom to make it bigger, but he hasn't been able to finish it because he ran out of money. He is asking for this loan to finish putting up the walls an to install a roof so he will finally be able to use the room. To complete his project he needs to buy cinder blocks, cement, and sand and he needs to pay for labor.

loan.use: to buy construction materials

loan.name: Cerina

texts.en:
Cerina is 34 years old, widowed and lives in the Philippines. She has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for the past five years.

Cerina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. She has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of food for her shop. She hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy additional stocks of food for her shop.

loan.name: 9 De Octubre (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal 9 de Octubre estÃ¡ formado por 5 socias y un socio quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten aportar y mejorar la economÃ­a de sus hogares. Viven por la parroquia de Nulti ubicada al noreste de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta parroquia ha conservado su identidad rural tanto en la arquitectura como en las tradiciones y festividades. Existen sitios donde se pueden observar vestigios arqueolÃ³gicos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la SeÃ±ora. Dolores, tiene 53 aÃ±os, es divorciada y en su uniÃ³n conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, dos son casados y viven independientes, su tercera hija tiene 21 aÃ±os de edad, es soltera, trabaja y ayuda econÃ³micamente y su Ãºltimo hijo tiene 10 aÃ±os y estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
DoÃ±a Dolores es comerciante de periÃ³dico, actividad que la desempeÃ±a hace 10 aÃ±os y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la maÃ±ana hasta las 11 de la maÃ±ana. En su casa se dedica a la crÃ­a y venta de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos.
Este es su primer crÃ©dito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcciÃ³n para acabar su casa.
Su meta es terminar su casa y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "9 de Octubre" [October 9th] is made of 5 women and one man who work in different activities. They allow each other to contribute to and improve their home finances. They live by the Nulti church, located to the northeast of the city of Cuenca. This church has conserved its rural identity both in architecture and in the traditions and festivities. Sites where you can observe archeological remains exist.
One of the members of this group is Dolores. She is 53 years old. She is divorced, and has 4 children from her married time. Two are married and live independently. Her third daughter is 21 years old, single, works, and helps out with the finances. Her last child is 10 years old, and he studies in a city school. The house that she lives in is her own property.
Dolores is a newspaper salesperson. She has done this activity for 10 years. She works every day of the week from 6 in the morning to 11 in the morning. At home, she raises and sells chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs.
This is her first loan that she is getting through the communal bank. She is going to invest it in the purchase of construction materials to complete her house.
Her goal is to finish her house and grow in her business.

loan.use: buy construction materials.

loan.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: El seÃ±or Roberto es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo ha podido construir su casa desde poner los cimentos hasta construir las paredes. En este momento quiere levantar los cimientos de una recamara mas para extender la sala comedor, de esta manera el podrÃ¡ ofrecer mayor comodidad a su familia. El trabaja en maquiladora como mecÃ¡nico desde hace 12 aÃ±os ingreso que aporta para poder sustentar los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Roberto is a very responsible and hardworking man who, through a lot of effort, has been able to build his own house, from laying the cement to building the walls. Currently, he wants to lay the foundations for another bedroom so he can extend the dining room. This will allow him to make his family more comfortable. He has worked in an assembly plant as a mechanic for 12 years and he uses his income from this job to cover his household expenses.

loan.use: to buy rods

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy additional stocks of food for her shop.

loan.name: Ana Teresa

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Ana Teresa es madre de familia y es muy responsable con sus obligaciones de casa y trabajo. Tiene 3 hijos un de 6 aÃ±os que estÃ¡ en primaria el cual en este momento le estÃ¡n exigiendo el uniforme de tiempo de frio y algunos Ãºtiles escolares que de acuerdo a la temporada le solicitan. Para Ana es muy importante que su hijo lleve el uniforme ya que lo cubrirÃ¡ del frio y le permitirÃ¡n la entrada a la escuela y no perderÃ¡ clases. De esta manera el podrÃ¡ tener una mejor educaciÃ³n.
texts.en: Ana Teresa is the head of her household and she is very responsible about her home and work obligations. She has three children. Her six-year-old is in primary school and they are requiring that he have the cold-weather school uniform and some school supplies that he will need for this time of year. It is very important to Ana that her son have his uniform because it will protect him from the cold and they will let him go to school so he doesn't miss his classes. This will allow him to get a better education.

loan.use: to buy uniforms

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy additional stocks of food for her shop.

loan.name: Juanita Yadira

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Juanita Yadira de 33 aÃ±os es casada y madre de 2 hijos, de los cuales quiere ofrecerles un mejor patrimonio. Hace 5 aÃ±os adquiriÃ³ su vivienda de interÃ©s social y con ahorros propios fue levantando paredes para una recamara al frente de su vivienda, el capital que tenÃ­a ya se le termino y aun le faltan algunas varillas para construir las dalas, de esta manera tener mÃ¡s reforzada la recamara. Para Juanita es muy importante ampliar su casa ya que de esta manera tendrÃ¡ mÃ¡s espacio.
texts.en: Juanita Yadira, who is 33 years old, is married and the mother of 2 children. She wants to offer them a better wealth. Five years ago, she received her home from a social interest group, and with her own savings, she has put up walls for a bedroom in the front of the house. She has run out of the money that she had, and now she lacks some bars to construct the supports. This way the bedroom will be more reinforced. It is very important to Juanita to increase the size of her house so that she will have more space.

loan.use: buy construction materials.

loan.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 48 years old and married with one child. For the past seven years she has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Noemi has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of food for her shop. With her profits she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy additional stocks of food for her shop.

loan.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is 24 years old and single. For the past two years she has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rio has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. She has requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of food for her shop. She hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy additional stocks of food for her shop.

loan.name: Socorro

texts.es: La seÃ±ora Socorro es una seÃ±ora trabajadora humilde que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como son: enchiladas verdes, enchiladas rojas, sopes, tacos dorados y empanadas. Esta felizmente casada con el seÃ±or Francisco quien la apoya en todo lo que se pueda como barrer y limpiar las mesas. Ella pidiÃ³ el prÃ©stamo para la compra de chiles verdes, chiles secos, pollos, ajos y cebollas. Le da las gracias a fundaciÃ³n por apoyarla en todo y seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Socorro is a hardworking, humble woman who sells traditional Mexican dishes such as green enchiladas, red enchiladas, sopes, hard tacos, and empanadas.
She is happily married to her husband, Francisco, who supports her as much as he can in ways such as sweeping and cleaning tables.
She asked for this loan to buy green chiles, dried, chiles, chicken, garlic, and onions.
She thanks the Foundation for supporting her in everything and helping her get ahead with her business.

loan.use: to buy chiles, onions, garlic, and tomatoes to make food

loan.name: Bobby

texts.en:
Bobby is from Tinacla-an, a neighborhood of Clarin in Misamis Occidental province. He is 54 years old and the father of one child.

Bobby raises livestock, primarily pigs. He has done so for four years and earns 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007 Bobby became a member of GDMPC. He has requested a loan of 8,117 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He hopes to improve his business so as to meet his familyâ€™s daily needs.

loan.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loan.name: Guadalupe Antonio

texts.es: El seÃ±or Guadalupe Antonio estÃ¡ casado, a pesar de que es muy joven siempre ha pensado en el bienestar de su futura familia, hace unos aÃ±os el compro un terreno ir formando su patrimonio, primero pidiÃ³ un prÃ©stamo en esta instituciÃ³n para construir un cuarto pequeÃ±o el cual ya tiene levantado, pero quiere nuevamente un prÃ©stamo para construir el baÃ±o y asÃ­ tener los servicios necesario para habitarla sin ningÃºn problema. Para poder realizar su proyecto necesita comprar material de construcciÃ³n y pagar mano de obra. Para poder sustentar los gastos del hogar el trabaja en un imprenta, de esta manera el ofrece su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Guadalupe Antonio is married. Even though he is very young, he has thought about the wellbeing of his future family. A few years ago, he bought a plot of land and made his home. He first asked for a loan from this institution to build a small room, which he has already built. He wants a new loan to build a bathroom, and therefore have the necessary services to live in his home without a problem. To be able to complete his project, he needs to buy construction materials and pay for labor. To be able to cover the household costs, he work at a printing press. This way, he offers his family a better way of life.

loan.use: buy construction materials.

loan.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 28 years old and married with four children. For the past two years she has had a pigpen from which she has sold grown and matured pigs.

Ailyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed for the pigs. With her profits she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy feed for the pigs.

loan.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun, 57, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She models clay into animal shapes to sell out of her home to generate income for the family. Her husband is a taxi driver. Two of her children are employed in a factory. Due to the children's difficulty in traveling to work, Khun is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loan.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work.

loan.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Zenaida has a retail shop that sells beauty products & clothing like dresses, blouses & shirts. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing to sell.
Zenaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Zenaida hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loan.name: Rocio

texts.es: La seÃ±or Rocio es una mujer muy trabajadora que con la ayuda de su esposo tiene dos negocios uno es de abarrotes y el otro de ropa usada. Pero el que mÃ¡s sustenta los gasto del hogar es el negocio de abarrotes donde ofrece variedad de mercancÃ­a como lo es refrescos, botanas, comida de lata, lÃ¡cteos, dulces y mÃ¡s. En este momento requiere de un prÃ©stamo para surtirlo ya que en la temporada de de Diciembre sus ventas incrementaron por lo que se quedo con muy poco producto.
texts.en: Rocio is a very hard-working woman who, with the help of her husband, runs two businesses. One of her businesses is a grocery store and the other is a used-clothing business. The business that contributes the most towards her household expenses is the grocery store, where she offers a wide range of merchandise such as soft drinks, snacks, canned food, dairy products, sweet treats, etc. Right now, Rocio needs a loan to stock her business because her sales increased during the December season and so she has few products left.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loan.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela is married and has 8 children. She is 56 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Rosela has owned a sari-sari (variety) store for 5 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 5,000 from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more stock for her store. Rosela has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loan.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Evangeline has operated a medicinal shop for 5 years, selling generic medicines such as syrups and tablets. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy more stock of generic medicines. Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy more stock of generic medicines

loan.name: Alfonsa

texts.en: Alfonsa, 77 years old, is a widow with six children. She resides in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Alfonsa used her last loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She's now taking out a new loan which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Alfonsa hopes to reap more during the harvest to sustain the family's needs.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loan.name: Vikie

texts.en: Vikie is 31 years old and lives in Casusan Aloran,Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children. Vikie has a ready-to-wear clothing business, earning approximately PHP 15,000 each month from it. She has a requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes for her business. Vikie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to have a large amount of capital and to own merchandise to earn money for her family's future.

loan.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes

loan.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. Gina has operated a retail shop for 2 years, buying and selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loan.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.
Myla has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines & milk fish. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 10,000 to buy fish to sell.
Myla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Myla hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fish to sell.

loan.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is married with three children. Herminio is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Herminio is operating a service-based business,providing transportation to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years and every month he earns 2,500 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to repair his existing vehicle for better service.
Herminio became a member of GDMPC in the year 2010. In the future, Herminio hopes to see his children finish their studies and to gain double income out from his business.

loan.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loan.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 53 years old and lives in Tuyabang Proper, Oroquieta City. She is married with six children.
Corazon has a cellphone load business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase cell phone load for her business.
Corazon has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Corazon hopes to have a cell phone shop to earn money. Corazon is a business-minded person, a loving mother and hard-working.

loan.use: to purchase cell phone load for her business.

loan.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 57 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married with five children.
Gloria has a hog-raising business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins for her hog-raising business.
Gloria has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gloria hopes to have a meat shop in order to help her husband cover their daily needs and for the future of their five children, because Gloria wants their five children to finish their studies for their future.

loan.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her hog-raising business.

loan.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman who has six children. Anita is 40 years old and resides at Kahayagan West, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.
Anita buys and sells livestock for their living and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.
In 2010, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Anita hopes improve their living conditions further.

loan.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

location.town: Kahayagan West, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur

loan.name: Hickel

texts.en:
Hickel is 31 years old and lives in Tuyabang Proper, Oroquieta City. He is married and has one child. Hickel has a hog raising business, earning approximately PHP 5,000 each month from it. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase pig feed and vitamins for his business.

Hickel has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, he hopes to earn money because he wants to send his child to school until he graduates from college. Hickel is a hardworking father and an honest person.

loan.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loan.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario is 50 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. He is single. Mario has a fish vending business, earning approximately PHP 3,000 each month from it. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell. Mario has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, he hopes to save money to own a fishing boat. Mario is an honest and responsible person and a hardworking son. Mario is an active member of PMPC, willing to particapate in any of PMPC's activities.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loan.name: Melisa

texts.en: Melisa is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Melisa has operated a retail shop for 10 years, buying and selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Melisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loan.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Letecia has operated a retail shop for 10 years, buying and selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Letecia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy clothing to sell

loan.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is 26 years old and lives in Conat Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is single. Artemio has a hog fattening business, earning approximately PHP 10,000 each month from it. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase pig feed and vitamins for his business.

Artemio has been a member of PMPC for 8 months. In the future, he hopes to earn money because he wants to build a new house and is planning to get married. Artemio is a hardworking son and an honest and responsible person.

loan.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loan.name: Lisonia

texts.en: Lisonia, a 49-year-old married woman, lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She used her last loan to purchase farm fertilizers to elevate production, and she is now requesting a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Lisonia expects to earn enough to eventually purchase more farmland to work.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loan.name: Severo

texts.en:
Severo is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married.
Severo has a field to sell corn grains that will be harvested in due time. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for 11,000 Philippines pesos to buy fertilizers for the corn field.
Severo is a member of HSPFI. In the future, Severo hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers for the corn field.

loan.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 51 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children.
Conchita has a used clothing business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more used clothes to sell for her business.
Conchita has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Conchita hopes to build a new house and wants her children to finish their studies.
Conchita is a hardworking mother and has a happy family. She is also a loving wife to her husband and a loving mother to her children.

loan.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell for her business.

loan.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, aged 29, has worked for most often in her farming business than her hog fattening business. She is focused on the production of rice because it brings high income especially when it provides the necessities needed in farming. In this regard, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 pesos in buying agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides and of course rice seeds. This activity enabled her family to bring progress, most especially to the education maintenance of her two children. With the combined great effort of her husband, she could increase their production through her availed loan.

loan.use: buying agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides and of course rice seeds

loan.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is 51 years old and lives in Caticugan, Siquijor, in the Philippines. He is married with nine children. Carlito sells fish every day. He earns approximately 8,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.

Carlito has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for eleven months. He has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. With this loan he hopes to sustain his business.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loan.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang, 28, is married and lives with her husband and two school-age children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has successfully grown and sold rice for over ten years. For over two years her husband has been renting out sound equipment.

In order to improve her husbandâ€™s business, Nang is requesting a loan of 550 USD to purchase a generator for her husbandâ€™s equipment rental business. By expanding his business her husband would be able to earn more money.

Nang would like to refurbish her house and send her children to a good school.

loan.use: to purchase a generator for her husbandâ€™s equipment rental business.

loan.name: Emesalyn

texts.en:
Emesalyn is 25 years old and lives in Oroquieta in Misamis Occidental province. She is married with one child. Emesalyn has a general store and earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month running it.

Emesalyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. She has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her store.

loan.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loan.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 15 children.
Conchita has a food shop that sells boiled duck eggs (or balut) to sell. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy duck eggs for making balu to sell.
Conchita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Conchita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy duck eggs for making balut to sell.

loan.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 43 years old, married and has two children. They live in Water Fall, Aurora, in Zamboanga del Sur province.

For the past six years Sherlita has woven nipa palm fronds into mats that are used as roofing materials. She earns 5,000 PHP a month doing so.

Sherlita became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the materials needed to make more nipa palm roofing. She hopes to improve and expand her business with the anticipated profits.

loan.use: to buy the materials needed to make more nipa palm roofing materials.

location.town: Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loan.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa, 46 years old, is married with six children. For the past ten years she has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy more stock for her store. With the anticipated profits she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loan.name: Miguel

texts.en: Miguel is 49 years old, he is married to Aurea, who is 37 years old. Together they have children. They have their own house where they live happily. Since he was a child his parents taught him to work on the farm, now he is a farmer and he has his own land where he grows crops like corn and rice. He has been working his own land for the past 15 years. During harvest times he has help from his children and other hired laborers to be able to pick the more quickly. What he likes most about his work is harvesting his plants because he can see that his months of hard work have resulted in the reward of good crops. The hardest thing is to transport his products from the farm to the warehouse that is located in the city of Ilagan province of Isabela; this is where he is able to get the best price for his crops. His difficulty is that he does not have enough economic income to be able to cover the advance payments to the hired laborers that help him during the harvest. It is for this reason that he asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seed and payments for hired laborer. Miguel feels that the money from this loan will help him greatly in the progress of his work.

loan.use: to buy corn seed,fertilizer and payments for hired laborers for his farming business

loan.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is 44 years old and married with six children. For the past ten years she has had a shop where she sells dry goods such as blouses, shirts and sandals.
Mona has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more dry goods to sell. With her anticipated profits Mona hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy more dry goods to sell.

loan.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila is 47 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married with four children. Nila has a dried fish business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more kind of dried fish for her business. Nila has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loan.use: to purchase more kind of dried fish for her business

loan.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is from Waterfall, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 51 years old and is married with one child.
Marcelina earns a living raising crops, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.
In 2008, Marcelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

location.town: Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loan.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is 33 years old, married and has three children. He lives in the Philippines. Artemio has a shop that sells firewood and fish such as sardines and trout. He has had this business for 10 years.
Artemio is requesting a loan for 9,000 PHP, which he will use to buy fish and firewood to sell. In the future, Artemio hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to purchase fish and firewood.

loan.name: Mierezel

texts.en: Mierezel is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. Mierezel has a shop that makes and sells home-made longganisa and chorizo. She also buys and sells firewood. She has been running this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy raw ingredients for making home-made sausage, or longganisa. Mierezel has been a member of HSPFI for some time. In the future, Mierezel hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for making home-made sausage, or longganisa.

loan.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 57 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married and has five children. Mila has a snack-vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. Mila has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loan.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 57 years old, involved in agriculture. She has been in rice farming business for over ten years. Within these years, she still enthusiast to work because of poor living that they encounter. She wants to improve their living situation into better. Through their farming business, she knows that she will achieve her dream just provide the needed supplies of her business. In this connection, she is requesting a loan of 15,000 pesos to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. She hopes that these supplies would provide better crops in order to feel then a comfortable life.

loan.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loan.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 47 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married and has five children. Juanita has a used clothing business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more used clothes for her business. Juanita has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loan.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loan.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years of age, married and has four grown-up children.Her husband is a farmer who cultivates their farm land while Teresita engages in vegetable vending to help her husband in gaining income. They aimed to earn and save more income to satisfy their necessities, save for future emergencies and finance the schooling of their grand children. Despite problems and difficulties they encountered in life, they have the determination to achieve their goals.
Teresita aimed to continue and strengthen the business to ensure a higher income. She is requesting for an additional capital of P12,000 to buy sweet potatoes, okras, squashes, beans, cabbages, tomatoes and eggplants to sell in their village. She believes that when she is going to strive harder, she will make the business grow and profitable in the future.

loan.use: to buy sweet potatoes, okras, squashes, beans, cabbages, tomatoes and eggplants to sell

loan.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Arlene has a shop that sells used clothing, like shirts, blouses, and jackets. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy more used clothing for resale. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy more used clothing for resale.

loan.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 28 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married and has one child. Fe has a snack-vending and reloading business and earns approximately PHP 500 each month with this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for her snack-vending business. Fe has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients for her snack-vending business.

loan.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
Arlene has a shop that sells homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage.
Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making homemade sausage.

loan.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 34 years old, separated, and has three children. She lives in Tawi-Tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Gena has a fish selling business and earns approximately 2,000PHP a month.
Gena is requesting a loan for 14,900 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Gena hopes to buy a fishing boat to earn more income to support her three children.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loan.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 38 years old and lives in Tawi-Tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Teresita has a general store and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Teresita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loan.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loan.name: Merry Grace

texts.en: Merry Grace, a 26-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for five years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, she is requesting a loan for PHP8,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell. In the future, Merry Grace hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loan.name: Remia

texts.en: Remia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. Remia has a shop that buys and sells a variety or different kinds of dried fish. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of dried fish to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Remia hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

loan.name: Margelyn

texts.en: Margelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Margelyn has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 13,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Margelyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Mary Jane has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Romulo

texts.en: Romulo is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. Romulo has a shop that sells vegetables, food seasonings & spices. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of vegetables & spices to sell. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Romulo hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of vegetables & spices to sell.

loan.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is an entrepreneur from Trinidad, Bohol. He sells ready-to-wear clothes like men's and women's shirts. Dionisio also sells slippers and accessories. A hard-working father, Dionisio sells fried chicken to his community so he could have an extra income. He said one of his top priorities is his child's education.
Dionisio requested this loan to buy chicken meat, cooking oil and more items to sell, such as shirts. Dionisio hopes to continue earning and be able to feed his family 3 times a day and keep his child in school.

loan.use: to buy chicken meat, cooking oil and more items to sell, such as shirts.

loan.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Despite financial difficulty, Merlita and her husband aimed to uplift their status of living and give their children a better life. She is now 58 years old and has four adult-age children. The main sources of their living is through farming and dress making. Her husband manages their rice farming business while Merlita engages herself in dress making business. She has been in this business for more five years and usually earns a profits of P6,000 a month that she utilized for their food and save some for future emergencies.
Being a hard working mother, she aimed to continue the business to supplement her husband income. She is asking for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy fabrics, threads, buttons and other materials needed in dress making. She hopes that this loan will enable her to improve the business and make it viable source of income.

loan.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons and other materials needed in sewing

loan.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 57 years old and lives in Conat, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. Juliet has a general store and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loan.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loan.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 30 years old, married, and a responsible mother of five children. She has been growing rice for over 13 years. Her harvested crops are mostly sells them at the market and using the income to support her familyâ€™s needs such as buying commodities, foods and paying for school fees of her five children.
She wants to prepare the land for a new crop, and is requesting a loan of 15,000 pesos for buying of seeds, fertilizers, fuel and lubricant for tractor, and seedlings. She is looking forward through these inputs her farming business would endow with abundant result.

loan.use: for buying of seeds, fertilizers, fuel and lubricant for tractor, and seedlings

loan.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Elvira has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen has a balut vending business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. [Balut is a fertilized duck (or chicken) egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell. It is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines.] Arlen is 36 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children.
Arlen has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase more balut for her business. She has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loan.use: to purchase more balut for her business

loan.name: Ma. Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 53 years old and is a married woman with a 6-year-old child. She is engaged in fish selling. Her husband, who is a fisherman, operates their fishing boat. Delia sells her husband's catch at the market and also buys more fish from other fishermen. She also sells crabs. Each month, Delia earns about 7,000 PHP from this business.
Delia has asked for a loan to purchase fish nets, hooks, and crab traps. Delia hopes for this loan to help increase her income.

loan.use: to purchase fish nets, hooks, and crab traps

loan.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single and gay. Richard has a beauty shop or parlor that provides make-up or beautification to customers. He also buys and sells jewelry like necklaces and bracelets. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan of 10,000 to buy materials and tools for the beauty salon.
Richard has been a member of HSPFI for since 2009. In the future, Richard hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy materials and tools for a beauty salon

loan.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Merlyn has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Ma. Marietes

texts.en:
Ma. Marietes is 36 years old and is a married woman with two children, ages 8 and 6. She has been a farmer for 10 years. Ma. Marietes tills her land in Trinidad, Bohol, growing rice crops to sell. She earns 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. Ma. Marietes is able to help provide for her family with her income.
Ma. Marietes has requested this loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn more and be able to save for her children's education.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loan.name: Simeona

texts.en:
40-year-old Simeona is a married woman with five children between the ages of 16 and 7. Simeona's husband is a fisherman. Simeona is engaged in seaweed farming. She says she has regular buyers of dried seaweed, so it is easier for her. Simeona also supports her husband's fishing. She helps sell his catch at the market. Together they work to improve their living conditions and achieve their dreams.
Simeona has requested this loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw and fish nets. Simeona hopes for her family's income to increase.

loan.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw and fish nets

loan.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Flordelina has a retail shop to buy & sell canned goods, snacks, dried fish, vegetables & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, dried squid & vegetables to sell.
Flordelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flordelina hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, dried squid & vegetables to sell

loan.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children.
Elena is making & peddling snacks like rice cakes, sugar coated rice or suman & bitso-bitso. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.
Elena has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elena hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loan.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong, 46, is married and has two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He has supported his family by running a mechanical shop at his house for 10 years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying equipment and materials to increase his productive capacity and better satisfy his customers.
