He hopes his business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his children to school.

loan.use: To buy equipment and materials to better satisfy his customers

loan.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 34, is married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a business making steel products in front of their house for four years.
Hong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying equipment and materials to increase her productive capacity and better satisfy her customers.
She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loan.use: To buy equipment and materials to better satisfy her customers

loan.name: Emerilou

texts.en:
Emerilou is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Emerilou has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, beverages & rice per kilograms. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, sacks of rice & beverages.
Emerilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emerilou hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, sacks of rice & beverages

loan.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia believes that, "a person with strong determination becomes successful". She is 42 years old and a mother of five. Despite the hardships of living, they aimed to improve their sources of income and educate their children. Both of them are farmers and they help each other in managing their rice farming business. They also operates a motorcycle transport to earn additional income.
Olivia is asking for an additional capital of P15,000 to be used in buying gasoline and spare parts needed for the maintenance of their motorcycle transport to be used daily passengers used. She believes that they can able to generate more income as they continue to work hard and strive harder. They are hoping that someday, they will improve their status of living and becomes financially stable.

loan.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle transport

loan.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Nguyen, 63, is a married man and has three children: one son and two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife support their family by running a general store in front of their house.
Nguyen started this business seven years ago. He sells medicinal oil and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products to stock his store and better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loan.use: To buy a greater variety of products to stock his store

loan.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 33-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Thu and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for four years.
Thu would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as soft drinks, confectionery and cigarettes, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loan.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as soft drinks, confectionery and cigarettes to sell

loan.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, a 49-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have run a business for three years. They sell a variety of basic goods to people in the local community .
Lan requests a loan to purchase more products such as soaps, shampoos, soft drink and confectionery to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her shop and save for emergencies.

loan.use: To purchase more products such as soaps, shampoos, soft drinks and confectionery

loan.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child.
Luciana has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Luciana has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Luciana hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is a 41-year-old married woman. She has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Linh has been working as a tailor for four years.
Linh would like to take a loan to buy material to make clothes for her customers. She hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loan.use: To buy sewing materials to make clothes for her customers

loan.name: Duong

texts.en: Duong, 51, is married and has two children â€“ a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband support their family by running a general store in front of their house. Duong started this business seven years ago. She sells soft drinks, confectionery and other household items to people in her community. Duong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages. She wants to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loan.use: to buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages.

loan.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh is a 48-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one child. Hanh and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for seven years. Hanh would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as soaps and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income. This will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loan.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as soaps and confectionery.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more products, such as soaps, toilet paper and soft drinks.

loan.name: Dominador

texts.en: Dominador, who is 51 years old, lives with his partner. He has two children. Dominador lives in his own house and tries very hard to provide a better life for his children. He works as a farmer, where he cultivates crops plants. He works very hard on the farming field. He has been working for 23 years on his own land. During the planting season, he counts on the support of his children and day laborers who see to the planting and move the collected products to a certain place so that later in can be transported with small vehicles. He feels very dedicated to his work. Thanks to his daily effort, today he enjoys seeing his plants give him a good crop. He says that he does not like the winter season because there is a large quantity of insects and rain during those months, damaging his crops. With the loan that he is asking for, he will buy more seed and fertilizer to expand his sown fields. With the P 15,000 he will buy seed,chemical and fertilizer products to maintain his crops.

loan.use: to buy chemical, fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business

loan.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 48 years old and lives in her own house with her husband alone. Her two children already have their own family which they live separately with them. She is an optimistic woman who has made many sacrifices just to provide the needs of her family especially when her children are still studying. She had established a little business in her own home where she sells a variety of grocery items such as coffee, breads and cooking oil.
With the good service she has offered, she received the trust of many people in their place. This causes her to requests a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchased additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, beans, eggs and other in demand goods to place in her store. She hopes with these variety of products she offered with affordable prices, she would earn high income and permit her and her husband a better quality of life.

loan.use: to purchased additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, beans, eggs and other in demand goods to place in her store

loan.name: Jemarie

texts.en:
As a responsible house wife, Jemarie engages in selling AVON, Natasha and MSE products to generates income. She is 30 years old and has one school-age child. Her ambition in life is to become financially stable in the future. In this regard, she planned to improve her business and make it viable source of income. Despite problems and competitors in the area, she still has the determination to continue the business.
She is asking for an additional capital of P6,000 to buy additional stocks of AVON, Natasha and MSE products like lotions,body sprays, roll ons, colognes, under wears, jewelries and foot wears to sell in their community. She hopes that she will improve the business and make it profitable in the future.

loan.use: to buy lotions, body sprays, roll ons, colognes, under wears, jewelries and foot wears to sell

loan.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 58 years old and lives in Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. Mercy has a general store business and earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Mercy has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for six years.

loan.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loan.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is 50 years old and lives in Toril, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is single. Lucena has a snack vending business and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business. Lucena has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to own a food stall in the market to earn money for her future.

loan.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to pay her registration fees and her monthly instalments

loan.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 54 years old a hardworking mother and wife. She is engaged in buy and sell of bananas and cleaning of bottles to sell as well. She is married and is raising five children excluding the one who already live separately with them. She has been involved in these businesses for the past four years. She learned that the more the business, the more the profit just be patient and hard working person.
As of now, she is asking a loan of 10, 000 pesos to buy additional bananas to sell and more bottles to clean up. With her determination, she hopes to boost her usual income for the betterment of their lives and save to finance the education of her two children who stop from school.

loan.use: to buy additional bananas to sell and more bottles to clean up

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms.

loan.name: Fidel

texts.en: Fidel is 41 years of age, married and has three children who are sending to school. Fidelâ€™s wife is a housekeeper and his companion to manage their farming business. His priority in life is to prepare for his children college level of education and see them professionals someday. Fidel will manage well his farm business. He will ensure that his crop is in good condition to get better yield and gain higher income that will used for his children education. Fidel is getting financial shortage to sustain his farm needs because he also provides his children allowances in school at the same time. Fidel is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his farm needs. He hopes to avail the loan and maintain his farming business.

loan.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for his farm needs.

loan.name: Hop

texts.en: Ms Hop is 48 years old and has two adult children. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens for meat. Her business started many years ago. Joining the credit program of Kiva partner SEDA in 2004, she invested in her farming activities. For this new loan, she has requested 9,810,000 Vietnam Dong (VND) to buy chicken feed and fertilizer.

loan.use: to buy chicken feed and fertilizer.

loan.name: Primo

texts.en: Primo is in forties. He is married and blessed with three children. His wife is a housekeeper. Despite of low standard of living, Primo and his wife strive to send their children in school. They want them to have better way of living. Primo runs a rice farming business. He plants and harvest rice to sell and some of it is for their food. His way to minimize their expenditure in farming is doing some field activities with his wife. Their budget for labor cost in farming will spend for the education of their children. Primo needs an additional working capital for his farm. He is requesting a loan of P40,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, herbicides and seeds to grow. Primo hopes that the loan will have a positive result in his farming business.

loan.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, herbicides and seeds to grow.

loan.name: Khadicha

texts.en: Khadicha lives in the A. Jomi region. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her sons work in Russia. Khadicha raises cattle. She has been doing this for 14 years. She is taking the loan to purchase calves.

loan.use: to purchase calves

loan.name: Hau

texts.en: Ms Hau was born in 1992. She runs a small wood workshop making furniture for the home. She started this business two years ago. Hau joined the credit program of Kiva partner SEDA in 2010, and she has used her loans to buy machines for the workshop. For this new loan, she has requested 7,194,000 Vietnam Dong (VND) to buy wood.

loan.use: to buy wood for her business.

loan.name: Constancia

texts.en: Constancia is married and has an adult son and daughter. Constancia lives in the village of San Antonio. This is largely an agricultural region of Isabela, where many people are involved in growing crops. Constancia has been involved in growing crops for 20 years. Constancia needs a loan in the sum of P 20,000 to purchase fertilizer and seed. Constancia has enough land and it is comfortable to work there. In the future, Constancia wants to continue expanding her business.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business

loan.name: Sheryll Ann

texts.en:
Due to lack of job opportunities, Sheryll ann engages in duck raising business to supplement her husband income. They were blessed with three children and they live happily in a village. They aimed to improve their status of living and educate all their children. Despite hardships and difficulties in life, they are striving hard to earn a living and support their family.
Sheryll ann planned to raise more ducks to bear eggs for sale, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional ducks to raise. She mentioned that the loan will be a great help for her to work out her plan and hoping that she will become successful in managing her business.

loan.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional ducks to raise

loan.name: Hang

texts.en: Ms Hang is 26 years old and has two children. She and her husband manage a business cooking lunch for workers. Hang started her business two years ago and it creates a stable income with which to manage family life. Hang joined the credit program of Kiva partner SEDA in 2010, and she has used her loans to buy kitchen equipment and food for the business. For this new loan, she has requested 7,194,000 Vietnam Dong (VND) for the same purpose.

loan.use: to buy kitchen equipment and food for her business.

loan.name: Anh

texts.en: Ms Anh is 30 years old and has two small children. She is a tailor and manages a small tailoring shop. Anh started her business three years ago and it creates a stable income for her family. Anh has joined the credit program of Kiva partner SEDA and has requested a loan of 6,322,000 Vietnam Dong (VND) to buy fabric to meet customer demand.

loan.use: to buy fabric to meet customer demand.

loan.name: Maria Flores

texts.en: Maria Flores is 57 years old and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City. She is married with five children. Maria Flores has a fish vending business and earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell. Maria Flores has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for three years.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loan.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 59 and a responsible mother of five. She loves to sell AVON, MSE and personal products in their community. This is her way of helping her husband in gaining income for their daily living. She has been in this business for almost four years. Being a friendly mother, she can able to sold more of her products in their community while her husband manages their rice farming business.
They planned to improve their business and earn more income to satisfy their needs and support the schooling of their grand children. She is requesting for a loan of P22,000 to buy dish-washing soaps, detergent soaps, lotions, creams and colognes to sell. She believes that her loan will help her to improve the business and hoping that they will achieve their goals in the future.

loan.use: to buy dish-washing soaps, detergent soaps, lotions, creams and colognes to sell

loan.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda is a loving mother of four children. Her husband works as a carpenter. They work hard to support their family and provide good upbringing and education for their children. Mavjuda has her own retail corner, where she sells gifts. The merchandise is in demand and is sold quickly. She has regular customers. In order to prepare for the upcoming holidays, Mavjuda wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 2800 somoni to refill her merchandise selection with new goods and gift sets. She is certain that you will support her, and that she will obtain this loan in order to realize her wishes. Thank you.

loan.use: to buy new merchandise

loan.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is 53 years old, widowed and is raising three children. As she performed household work, she also involved in selling rice and piggery business. It was profitable to her and three children because her businesses provides their every day necessities such as allowances. Currently, she is asking a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional rice to sell, feeds and vitamins for her pigs.
She needs to be hard working to feed her family though her children are helping her. She just hopes that they will not change in order to lift up their living condition and saves for the education of her youngest child.

loan.use: to buy additional rice to sell, feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loan.name: Diosa

texts.en: Diosa sells fruits and vegetables for a living. She sells bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes. Diosa is able to help buy her family's basic needs with her income. She works hard for her family, which comprises her husband and eight children aged between 9 and 26. Six of her children still go to school. Diosa has requested this loan to buy more bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes to sell. She hopes to earn a better income and sustain her children's education.

loan.use: to buy more bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes to sell.

loan.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry is a 53-year-old fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with five children. Jerry has been a fisherman for ten years. He sells his catch at the market and earns about 5,000 PHP per month. Jerry works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school. He plans to use this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. This will help Jerry catch more fish to sell. In the future, Jerry hopes to have a stable business and successful children.

loan.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loan.name: Marifat

texts.ru: ÐœÐ°ÑŠÑ€Ð¸Ñ„Ð°Ñ‚ Ð¶Ð¸Ñ‚ÐµÐ»ÑŒÐ½Ð¸Ñ†Ð° Ð³Ð¾Ñ€Ð¾Ð´Ð° ÐšÑƒÐ»ÑÐ±. Ð•Ð¹ 31 Ð³Ð¾Ð´. Ð£ Ð½ÐµÐµ Ð´Ð²Ð¾Ðµ Ð´ÐµÑ‚ÐµÐ¹. ÐžÐ½Ð° Ñ€Ð°Ð·Ð²ÐµÐ´ÐµÐ½Ð°. ÐšÑ€ÐµÐ´Ð¸Ñ‚ Ð±ÐµÑ€ÐµÑ‚ Ð´Ð»Ñ ÑƒÐ²ÐµÐ»Ð¸Ñ‡ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ñ Ð°ÑÑÐ¾Ñ€Ñ‚Ð¸Ð¼ÐµÐ½Ñ‚Ð° Ñ‚Ð¾Ð²Ð°Ñ€Ð°.
texts.en: Marifat is a resident of the city of Kulob. She is 31 years old, divorced and has two children. Marifat has a secondary education. She has been involved in selling fabrics for over seven years. Marifat is requesting this loan to expand the merchandise selection.

loan.use: to purchase new types of fabrics

loan.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 26 years old and earns a living by running a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has three children. Lourdes has run her business for a year now. She sells items such as canned goods, detergent soap and noodles. She also sells baby's diapers and vitamins. Lourdes works hard to support her family. Lourdes has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, soap and shampoo. She hopes to have a progressive business and successful children.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, soft drinks, soap and shampoo.

loan.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Gemma has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Gemma has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Max James

texts.en: Max James is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. Max James has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has run this business for two years. He has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale. Max James has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loan.name: Marisol

texts.en: Marisol is a 28-year-old married woman with two young children. Her husband is a barangay official. Marisol runs a sari-sari store business in Trinidad, Bohol. She sells various items such as canned goods, noodles and eggs. Marisol is able to help buy her family's daily needs with her income. Marisol has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, vinegar, soy sauce and canned goods. She hopes to earn a better income in order to save for her children's education.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, vinegar, soy sauce and canned goods.

loan.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is 41 years old, married and has five children. She sells food such as tea, rice and loaves of bread to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and employs one person. She earns extra income from farming activities. Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, Damaris has been able to grow her business and hopes to become financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy cooking oil, tea leaves and sugar.

loan.use: to buy cooking oil, tea leaves and sugar.

loan.name: Jay Anthony

texts.en: Jay Anthony is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Jay Anthony provides motorela, or motorcycle, services. He has run this business for three years. He has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline to run his service. Jay Anthony has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline to run his service.

loan.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
Rosalinda buys and peddles vegetables like string beans and sliced raw jack-fruit for vegetable soup. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell.
Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loan.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She runs of selling of vegetables and charcoal within their house and has been in the business for almost five years. She is earning a monthly profit of about 2,000 pesos.
She is applying for a loan of 12,000, which she intends to use to buy additional stock of charcoal, beans, legumes and other demands vegetables to sell. Her profits earned through this loan will save for their daily necessities and help pay school fees for her two children.
In future, she hopes to uplift their poor living with her business and industriousness.

loan.use: to buy additional stock of charcoal, beans, legumes and other demands vegetables to sell

loan.name: Loribel

texts.en:
Loribel is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.
Loribel has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Loribel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Loribel hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loan.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.
Fatima has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Fatima has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Fatima hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loan.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 37 year old married man. He has a daughter who is 5 years old. He describes himself to be an honest and God fearing man.
He operates a retail store where he sells beauty and pesonal care products such as hairbands, cutex, razor blades etc. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a conducive environment. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more beauty products.
Timothy's business goal is to expand his general store within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more beauty products such as hair bands, braids, cutex, etc

loan.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 42 years old, married with 4 children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living and she has been in the business for 28 years and employs two people.
She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to expand her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy maize flour, sugar and wheat flour.

loan.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and wheat flour.

loan.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.
Virginia has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school and office uniforms, repairs dresses, makes curtains and pillow cases. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.
Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loan.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is a 33-year-old married woman with 2 children aged 8 and 6. Her husband works as a farmer.
Ritchel is in the business of food vending. She cooks viands to sell to her community. Ritchel also supports her husband in managing their rice farm. She also helps sell their harvest at the market. Ritchel works hard to sustain her family.
Ritchel has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat and spices. This will help Ritchel's family with their businesses. In the future, Ritchel hopes for her children to finish college and be successful.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizers and raw ingredients such as pork and chicken meat and spices

loan.name: Latofat

texts.en: Latofat lives in the city of Kulob. She is 41 years old, married and has six children. Her husband and oldest son left to work in Russia. Latofat has a higher education and is a teacher in her field. Latofat is involved in selling children's and women's clothing. She has been in this business for four years. She is requesting this loan to pay for her son's university education.

loan.use: to pay for her son's education

loan.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.
Janeth has a shop that sells clothing products like shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing like t-shirts and blouses to sell.
Janeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Janeth hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy stocks of clothing like t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loan.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has 3 children ranging in age from 4 years to 8 years old. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale.
She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the grocery stall.
She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more kale. Her business goal is to run a well equipped grocery store with all kinds of fruits and vegetables within 5 years.

loan.use: To buy more kale to sell.

loan.name: Robilyn

texts.en:
Robilyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
Robilyn has a shop that sells used clothing like shirts, sweaters and blouses. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing to sell.
Robilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Robilyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: To buy stocks of used clothing to sell.

loan.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherineis 45years of age, married and blessed with three children. One of them already married and the rest wants to finishes their studies. She is engaged in selling of vegetables such as onions, garlic, tomatoes and ginger. She buys her products in their market and sells into higher price within their village.
She has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional vegetables to sell such as leafy vegetables, potatoes, and bitter melon. She hopes that her purchased goods would help her to increase her income both for the needs of his family and to save enough funds for the studies of two children.

loan.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell such as leafy vegetables, potatoes, and bitter melon

loan.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a responsible mother who owns and manages a variety store in their village. She is 46 years old and has one school-age child. With her husband, they agreed to educate their child and give her a better future. Despite financial difficulty, they have strong determination to uplift their status of living.
Tessie aimed to increase her product offerings in her store to satisfy her customers' demand, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional of P10,000 to buy junk foods, canned goods, noodles, eggs, candies, beverages, soaps and soft drinks to sell. She believes that through patience and hard work, she will improve the business and achieve their goals in the someday.

loan.use: to buy junk foods, canned goods, noodles, eggs, candies, beverages, soaps and soft drinks to sell

loan.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia, a married woman who works hard to support her family, has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 13 years. Now requesting a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment, Sofia would like to build and expand her business in the future to better ensure her family's financial stability.

loan.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loan.name: Ricardo

texts.en: Ricardo is a full of dreams that will not lose his hopes because he believes he can achieve his dream. He says that only when you can dream it, you can do it. Ricardo is 37 years old, lucky married to a loving housewife and blessed with four children. Ricardo engages in planting and harvesting of rice for almost 17 years. His earnings from the business depend on climates. His earning is minimal when his crop is affected by the typhoon and disease. Ricardo wants to gain higher income from his crops. He is requesting a loan of P40,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for good production. He hopes to achieve his dreams through the loan he request.

loan.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for good production.

loan.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea, a married mother of four children between 6 and 20 years of age, works hard for her family. For almost six years she has been earning a living by selling vegetables and fruits such as bananas and cassava, making about 4000 php per month.

Timotea is requesting this loan to buy more bananas, cassava and taro to sell. In the future, she hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loan.use: to buy more bananas, cassava and taro to sell.

loan.name: Charley

texts.en:
Charley believes that, "Poverty is not a hindrance to success". She is a hard working mother who owns and manages a variety store in their village. She is now 55 years old and has four grown-up children. Her ambition in life is to uplift their status of living and give their children a bright future. Despite problems and difficulties in life, they are striving hard to earn and save for their daily living.
Charley aimed to increase her product offerings to satisfy the needs of her customers but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy frozen foods, canned goods, noodles, junk foods, biscuits, soaps, beverages and soft drinks to sell in her store. She is hoping that the loan will be a great help to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy frozen foods, canned goods, noodles, junk foods, biscuits, soaps, beverages and soft drinks to sell

loan.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a dry goods retail business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, pants, bags, slippers and ready-to-wear clothing for her dry goods business.
Gertrude has been in this business for 10 years. Gertrude earns more income from auto supply and a general store.
Gertrude has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her auto supply business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants, bags, slippers and ready-to-wear clothing.

loan.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is from the village of San Antonio. He lives there with his wife and children. Jerry grows early crops, rice and corn. He has a large plot of land. He has been growing agricultural crops for 25 years.
Jerry plans to invest the loan from Kiva to buy seed and fertilizer at P 20,000 to keep his business accurate. Jerry gladly channels the financial means towards development of his business. He seeks to develop further and has a promising potential for this.

loan.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farming business

loan.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a business lady, who runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and has employed two people. She earns extra income from her employment. She is also married and has been blessed with one child. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blow dry machine and a hairdryer.

loan.use: To buy a hair blow dry machine and a hairdryer.

loan.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong, 62, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been running a grocery store for over ten years and are successful in their career. Three of her children are employed at a factory in Phnom Penh. Selling groceries is the main source of income for the family. In order to improve her family economy, Kong is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to sell to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children to study higher.

loan.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 39-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 7 years to 20 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customer is Kenya Creameries Corporation (KCC). She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure of roads during delivery. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a cow. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years.

loan.use: To buy a cow for milking.

loan.name: Anita

texts.en: At her age of 56, Anita is still a jolly person. She is happy person that you canâ€™t see on her face that she is encountering difficulties in life. Anita is a widowed mother of five. Anita is responsible in managing her rice farming business in their village. Anita proves to herself that even a woman can also do a man works. Anita patiently doing some farming activities to lessen her labor cost. She added that it is also a part of her exercise, especially she is getting aged. Anita is asking for a loan of P27,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for her plant care. She is keep on praying that she will maintain his healthy body and extend her helps to her grand children.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for her plant care.

loan.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, 67, is married and resides with her husband and two daughters in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over twenty years, have extensive experience, and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and other agricultural crops. Her daughters are employed in a garment factory.
In order to improve her family livelihood, Yon is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a store in the market where her daughters can sell groceries to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her children's business and renovate her house.

loan.use: to purchase a store in the market where her daughters can sell groceries.

loan.name: Agrimano

texts.en:
Agrimano is 41 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their children, in the province of Isabela. Agrimano is a farmer who grows agricultural crops. He buys and sells his products in San Antonio.
He applies for the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow rice and corn. The loan helps him to increase his income for the benefit of his family and to invest in his business. His dream is to increase his crop in order to earn more money and thus have a better living standard.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming business

loan.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 49 years old, lives with her husband. Due for not having a child at her age, she established a store in her home as her past time at the same time to have a business that would help her to generate income for household expenses. The business has been in existing for four years.
She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy oil, snacks, eggs, cookies, sweets, biscuits and soft drinks in order to increase her income and improve more service to her customers. She hopes to gain her expected income to save for security as they grow older and older.

loan.use: to buy oil, snacks, eggs, cookies, sweets, biscuits and soft drinks in order to increase her income and improve more service to her customers

loan.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is a 39-year-old single woman. She has two children, ages 4 and 16 years. She describes herself to be social.
She operates a grocery store where she sells bananas and maize. She has been involved in this business for fifteen years. Her business is located at a busy market and near a road. Her primary customers are passengers. In addition, Roseline runs a retail shop to increase her income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to improve the grocery store.
She will use the KES 5,000 loan to purchase bananas and maize. Her business goal is to be selling wholesale within five years.

loan.use: to buy more maize and bananas for selling.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to pay for her husband's truck repairs.

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 40 years old and is married with six children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living, and she has been in the business for three years and has employed two people. She describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to save her income, She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, tea leaves and fruit.

loan.use: To buy sugar, tea leaves and fruit.

loan.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 38 years old and lives in Lower Rizal, Oroquieta City. She divorced with two children.
Janice has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 1,300 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.
Janice has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loan.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loan.name: Leang

texts.en: Leang, 26, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a Chinese translator. Additionally, she runs a business selling cosmetics in the market. Her husband is a "Tuk Tuk" (a motorcycle with a side car) taxi driver. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Leang is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase clothes and more cosmetics to sell to generate extra profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a beauty salon, build a new house, and support her child to study in higher education.

loan.use: to purchase clothes and more cosmetics to sell.

loan.name: Ronnielyn

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Ronnielyn did not pursue her college, she is married to a farmer and they raised their family in a village. She is now 30 years old and has four children. She helps her husband in managing their farm lots by planting rice and vegetables for sale. They planned to improve their rice farming business to increase their yields and income to satisfy their necessities and finance the schooling of their children.
Ronnielyn is asking for a loan of P13,000 to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting rice. They mentioned that the loan will help them to improve their rice farming and hoping that they will be having a fruitful harvest. They believe that hard work will make them possible to increase their yields and achieve their plans in the future.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting rice

loan.name: Sa Man

texts.en:
Sa Man, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over ten years, have extensive experience, and are successful in their career. They have four hectares of farmland for growing agricultural crops to generate income for the family. Additionally, her husband is an administrator in Preah Sdach district.
In order to improve her agricultural business, Sa Man is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to pay for digging a well and purchasing a pump to pump water into her rice field in the dry season. By doing so, she would generate extra income in the dry season from her agricultural business to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home, build new house, and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor's degree.

loan.use: to pay for digging a well and purchase a pump to pump water into her rice field.

loan.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, 27, is married and resides with her mother, her husband and one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling charcoal for over two years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. In order to increase her family income, Chenda is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more charcoal to sell in order to get extra profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business, renew her house, and support her child to study for a Bachelor's degree.

loan.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loan.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Due to hardships of life, Emelinda helps her husband in managing their rice farming business to ensure a fruitful harvest. She is now 41 years old and has three school-age children. They planned to educate their children so that they will be having a bright future. Despite the hardships they encountered in farming, they have the patience and determination to work out their plans.
They aimed to expand their rice plantation to ensure a high production, due to insufficient capital, Emelinda is asking for an additional of P13,000 to buy breeding seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting rice. They believe that their patience and hard work will bear a good fruits and hoping that they will become financial stable in the future.

loan.use: to buy breeding seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost incurred in planting rice

loan.name: Dilshod

texts.en: Dilshod is married and the loving father of three children. He makes a living by breeding animals, farming and selling furniture via his store. Dilshod boasts optimal conditions for animal breeding, and, additionally, he personally grows their feed. Dilshod's wife assists him with running the business; they happily work together. Dilshod requires a loan in order to purchase two heads of large and small cattle. He would use the remainder of the loan to buy barley seeds for sowing.

loan.use: To buy cattle and seeds of barley

loan.name: Thongny

texts.en: Thongny, 32, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling clothes for over two years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a tuk-tuk taxi driver. In order to improve her husband's business, Thongny is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new tuk-tuk for her husband to run as a taxi and change the old one because it breaks down often. In the future, she would like to purchase a house in Phnom Penh and send her children to a good school.

loan.use: to purchase a new tuk-tuk for her husband to run as a taxi

loan.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth is 42 years old and lives in Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Lilibeth has a nipa palm business and earns approximately 7,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock of palm for her weaving. Lilibeth has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to purchase a multi cub and earn money for their children.

loan.use: to purchase more stock of nipa palm for weaving

loan.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 40 years old, married and is a responsible mother of two children. As she does household chores and looks after her children, she has also been involved in sales of dry goods such as clothes and bags. She sells men and women's outerwear. She started his business with his own monetary sources and thankful for the good result. For ten years of operating this business, she has tried to improve their source of income. She wants to expand more, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase of additional goods to offer such as blanket, bed sheet and clothes to make a good profit and improve living conditions as well as to finance the education of her children.

loan.use: to purchase of additional goods to offer such as blanket, bed sheet and clothes

loan.name: Puth

texts.en: Puth, 31, is married and resides with her mother, her husband, three children, and a sister in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is employed in a garment factory. Her husband is a fisherman. Additionally, she and her husband are also involved in growing rice. In order to improve her family's livelihood, Puth is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season. By doing so, she would generate extra income for her family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children in higher studies.

loan.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season

loan.name: Rosemosin

texts.en:
Rosemosin is engaged in agriculture. He lives with his wife and children. The familyâ€™s main income comes from land cultivation. Rosemosin would like to enlarge his business to get more income and to cover his children's educational costs.
With the help of this loan, Rosemosin asking a loan of P 15,000 to buy fertilizer and seed to grow. The loan will allow Rosemosin to grow and sell more crops. This way, Rosemosin will get additional income, sustain his family and provide a stable future for them.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow for his farming

loan.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is 35 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married and has two children.
Nemia has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this work.
She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.
Nemia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Nemia hopes to purchase a fishing boat.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loan.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon, 56, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.
She is a construction worker. Her daughter is a garment worker. Now, her son is getting a job in Korea.
Therefore, Thon is requesting for a loan of USD 300 to pay for her son's medical checkup for his immigration to Korea.
In the future, she would like to run a sewing shop for her daughter at home and build a fence around her house.

loan.use: to pay for her son's medical checkup.

loan.name: Eleazar

texts.en:
Eleazar is 63 years old and lives in Estrella,Sinacaban. She is married and has five children.
Eleazar has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for three years.
Eleazar requested a loan of 3,500 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
Eleazar has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Eleazar hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loan.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Sokea, 48, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker.
Her husband is a construction foreman. Two of her children are employed at the garment factory.
Sokea is requesting for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase construction materials for building her house.
In the future, she would like to run a food store that sells all kinds of food and drink and send her youngest child to a good school.

loan.use: to purchase construction materials for building her house.

loan.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 53, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.
She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over 15 years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their careers. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up animals. Additionally, her husband is a fisherman and a motor taxi driver.
Two of her children are employed at the garment factory.
In order to improve her family livelihood, Mao is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to run as motor taxi to generate more income to support the family.
In the future, she would like to grow rice in the dry season, build a new house and support her children to study at a higher educational level.

loan.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to run as motor taxi.

loan.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 27 years old and lives in San Vicente, Bajo,Oroquieta City. She is married and has one child.
Joan has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this work. She has a requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.
Joan has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loan.name: Arjie

texts.en:
Arjie is 35 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. He is married and has three children.
Arjie has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately PHP 700 each month doing this work.
He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase equipment for his motorcycle transport business.
Arjie has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loan.use: to purchase equipment for his motorcycle transport business.

loan.name: Va

texts.en:
Va, 59, is widowed and resides with her son in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.
She has been growing rice for over 20 years and is successful in her career. Additionally, she is a tailor.
Her son is a tuk tuk (motorcycle-based taxi) driver. Because the old tuk tuk breaks down often, Va is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a new tuk tuk for her son to run as taxi in order to attract more customers and earn more money to support the family.
In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and renew her house.

loan.use: to purchase a new tuk tuk for her son to run as taxi.

loan.name: Seak

texts.en:
Seak, 48, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sugarcane juice for over five years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. One of her children is a garment worker.
In order to improve her family economy, Seak is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more sugarcane to squeeze in order to get juice to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business, renew her house, and send her children to a good school.

loan.use: to purchase more sugarcane to squeeze in order to get juice to sell.

loan.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella is 32 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married and has two children.
Rosebella has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 900 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for her business.
Rosebella has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, she hopes to own a food stall. Rosebella is a loving mother and has a happy family. She and her husband want to send their children to school so that they can help them in the future.

loan.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
